4221195286,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/e-commerce-omnichannel-data-analyst-at-versace-4221195286?position=38&pageNum=0&refId=vq8WS7zgmrGZDLe1HPBa5g%3D%3D&trackingId=GtnXBMbNfgaTSQlf3cSLAg%3D%3D,E-commerce & Omnichannel Data Analyst,Versace,Greater Milan Metropolitan Area,"Country: Italy
Versace is one of the most recognizable names in the world. The luxury House immediately became a leader in fashion and culture following its founding in 1978.

Versace is led by Emmanuel Gintzburger as CEO and the design team is under the leadership of the Chief Creative Officer, Dario Vitale. Donatella Versace remains the Chief Brand Ambassador for Versace since April 1st, 2025.
The E-commerce & Omnichannel Data Analyst will join the Data Analytics Team, reporting into the Global Ecommerce & Omnichannel Data Science & Business Analytics Manager.
This role is crucial in supporting the business through in-depth and insightful data analysis, generating reports and recommendations for top management and the E-commerce & Omnichannel team.
Analyze digital and omnichannel business and digital marketing performance, creating reports and dashboards to share results with a wide range of stakeholders.
Monitor web analytics and KPIs related to the e-Commerce channel to track performance, generate valuable insights, and identify areas for improvement.
Collaborate with multiple teams (Merchandising, Media, CRM, Regional teams) to consolidate findings, provide actionable insights, and drive data-informed decisions.
Manage and organize work, including collaboration with the digital agencies on the data visualization platforms.
Analyze key business KPIs using Versace's analytics tools (GA4, Adobe Analytics, OBIEE, etc.).
Proactively identify business challenges, develop data-driven solutions, and communicate recommendations effectively.
Leverage data analysis skills to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies that can inform business strategy and improve performance.
Build and maintain data models and datasets to support reporting and analysis needs.
Analyze large datasets using SQL and similar languages to derive actionable insights and build insightful dashboards and reports.
2+ years of experience in a similar role within the Fashion & Luxury industry or at a major consulting firm, demonstrating a strong understanding of the business and its unique challenges.
Demonstrated experience working with data as a Data Analyst, including data manipulation, cleaning, analysis, and visualization.
Passion for the fashion and luxury world.
University degree in Business, Management, Digital Marketing, Data Science, or a related field.
Data-oriented mindset with advanced Excel and BI skills. Exceptional analytical skills, accuracy, and attention to detail are essential.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Domo, Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau or similar).
Strong understanding of statistical concepts and methods
Excellent written and spoken English (will be tested during the interview process).
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with a proactive approach and the ability to thrive in Versace's diverse and multicultural team.
Team player, highly organized, and flexible, with the ability to adapt to a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.

Diversity and inclusion are integral to Versace's DNA. We promote an inclusive environment where employees and customers from diverse backgrounds are welcomed, valued, and celebrated. We take pride in our commitment to diversity, equality, and inclusion, and will continue to uphold these principles wherever we do business. Our doors are open to all.
WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER M/D/F

Country: Italy

City: Milan, Piazza Einaudi, 4

Contract Type: Regular

Department: E-commerce &
column2:
Omnichannel

Mode: Hybrid


Versace is one of the most recognizable names in the world. The luxury House immediately became a leader in fashion and culture following its founding in 1978.

Versace is led by Emmanuel Gintzburger as CEO and the design team is under the leadership of the Chief Creative Officer, Dario Vitale. Donatella Versace remains the Chief Brand Ambassador for Versace since April 1st, 2025.


Your Opportunity:

The E-commerce &
column3: Omnichannel Data Analyst will join the Data Analytics Team, reporting into the Global Ecommerce &amp
column4: Omnichannel Data Science &amp
column5:
Business Analytics Manager.

This role is crucial in supporting the business through in-depth and insightful data analysis, generating reports and recommendations for top management and the E-commerce &
column6:
Omnichannel team.


Your Contribution:

  • Analyze digital and omnichannel business and digital marketing performance, creating reports and dashboards to share results with a wide range of stakeholders.
  • Monitor web analytics and KPIs related to the e-Commerce channel to track performance, generate valuable insights, and identify areas for improvement.
  • Collaborate with multiple teams (Merchandising, Media, CRM, Regional teams) to consolidate findings, provide actionable insights, and drive data-informed decisions.
  • Manage and organize work, including collaboration with the digital agencies on the data visualization platforms.
  • Analyze key business KPIs using Versace's analytics tools (GA4, Adobe Analytics, OBIEE, etc.).
  • Proactively identify business challenges, develop data-driven solutions, and communicate recommendations effectively.
  • Leverage data analysis skills to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies that can inform business strategy and improve performance.
  • Build and maintain data models and datasets to support reporting and analysis needs.
  • Analyze large datasets using SQL and similar languages to derive actionable insights and build insightful dashboards and reports.


Your Skills:

  • 2+ years of experience in a similar role within the Fashion &
column7:
Luxury industry or at a major consulting firm, demonstrating a strong understanding of the business and its unique challenges.
  • Demonstrated experience working with data as a Data Analyst, including data manipulation, cleaning, analysis, and visualization.
  • Passion for the fashion and luxury world.
  • University degree in Business, Management, Digital Marketing, Data Science, or a related field.
  • Data-oriented mindset with advanced Excel and BI skills. Exceptional analytical skills, accuracy, and attention to detail are essential.
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Domo, Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau or similar).
  • Strong understanding of statistical concepts and methods
  • Experience with SQL.
  • Excellent written and spoken English (will be tested during the interview process).
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with a proactive approach and the ability to thrive in Versace's diverse and multicultural team.
  • Team player, highly organized, and flexible, with the ability to adapt to a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.


    • Diversity and inclusion are integral to Versace's DNA. We promote an inclusive environment where employees and customers from diverse backgrounds are welcomed, valued, and celebrated. We take pride in our commitment to diversity, equality, and inclusion, and will continue to uphold these principles wherever we do business. Our doors are open to all.

    WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER M/D/F

4232292934,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-it-cor-srl-4232292934?position=41&pageNum=0&refId=vq8WS7zgmrGZDLe1HPBa5g%3D%3D&trackingId=0J5lbDgGYyhO0VeFaNK7Sg%3D%3D,Data Analyst,IT.COR Srl,"Carpiano, Lombardy, Italy","IT.COR S.r.l., azienda di consulenza IT, è alla ricerca di un/una Data Analyst. Ricechiamo una risorsa in grado di raccogliere, analizzare e interpretare grandi volumi di dati, per tradurli in insight utili a supporto delle decisioni aziendali.
Linguaggi di programmazione: Ottima conoscenza di SQL, Python, e R.
Analisi Dati: Esperienza avanzata con Excel e utilizzo di strumenti di Business Intelligence come Power BI, Tableau e Looker.
Database e Big Data: Esperienza con SQL e NoSQL, gestione di database relazionali e cloud (esperienza con AWS, Google BigQuery, Azure).
Statistica e Matematica: Conoscenza solida di analisi statistica, test A/B, regressione, e modelli predittivi.
Machine Learning (opzionale): Conoscenza di base dei modelli di apprendimento automatico (machine learning).
ETL e Data Pipeline: Esperienza con strumenti di data wrangling e pipeline di trasformazione dei dati.
Data Storytelling: Capacità di tradurre dati complessi in insight comprensibili per il business, presentando informazioni in modo chiaro ed efficace.
Problem Solving: Ottime capacità di identificare problemi aziendali e proporre soluzioni basate sui dati.
Interpretazione Dati: Abilità nell'analizzare KPI, metriche di business e trend, per fornire previsioni e raccomandazioni.
Certificazioni (opzionale): Certificazioni come Google Data Analytics, Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate, e AWS Data Analytics sono considerate un plus.
Le ricerche sono rivolte a candidati di entrambi i sessi, in ottemperanza alla Legge 903/77.

IT.COR S.r.l., azienda di consulenza IT, è alla ricerca di un/una Data Analyst. Ricechiamo una risorsa in grado di raccogliere, analizzare e interpretare grandi volumi di dati, per tradurli in insight utili a supporto delle decisioni aziendali.


Requisiti:

  • Linguaggi di programmazione: Ottima conoscenza di SQL, Python, e R.
  • Analisi Dati: Esperienza avanzata con Excel e utilizzo di strumenti di Business Intelligence come Power BI, Tableau e Looker.
  • Database e Big Data: Esperienza con SQL e NoSQL, gestione di database relazionali e cloud (esperienza con AWS, Google BigQuery, Azure).
  • Statistica e Matematica: Conoscenza solida di analisi statistica, test A/B, regressione, e modelli predittivi.
  • Machine Learning (opzionale): Conoscenza di base dei modelli di apprendimento automatico (machine learning).
  • ETL e Data Pipeline: Esperienza con strumenti di data wrangling e pipeline di trasformazione dei dati.


Competenze Analitiche:

  • Data Storytelling: Capacità di tradurre dati complessi in insight comprensibili per il business, presentando informazioni in modo chiaro ed efficace.
  • Problem Solving: Ottime capacità di identificare problemi aziendali e proporre soluzioni basate sui dati.
  • Interpretazione Dati: Abilità nell'analizzare KPI, metriche di business e trend, per fornire previsioni e raccomandazioni.
  • Certificazioni (opzionale): Certificazioni come Google Data Analytics, Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate, e AWS Data Analytics sono considerate un plus.


Altre Informazioni:

  • Sede: Carpiano (MI)
  • Modalità di lavoro: Onsite
  • Inquadramento: CCNL Commercio


Le ricerche sono rivolte a candidati di entrambi i sessi, in ottemperanza alla Legge 903/77.

4233040350,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/platform-consultant-at-mediaset-4233040350?position=42&pageNum=0&refId=vq8WS7zgmrGZDLe1HPBa5g%3D%3D&trackingId=JfJhxEVLGGOeYws3toz2sA%3D%3D,Platform Consultant,Mediaset,"Cologno Monzese, Lombardy, Italy","All’interno di Publitalia '80, per il team dedicato alla piattaforma digitale Mediaset AdManager, siamo alla ricerca di un/a Platform Consultant con spiccato approccio commerciale e strategico, responsabile della gestione di clienti esistenti e dell’attivazione di nuovi lead nel segmento PMI.

Gestione end-to-end del ciclo di vendita, dalla prima interazione con il cliente all’attivazione delle campagne pubblicitarie, con l’obiettivo di massimizzare il ritorno sull’investimento e garantire un’esperienza di valore.
Sviluppo di nuove opportunità commerciali, attraverso attività di prospecting strategico e consolidamento dei lead esistenti, contribuendo attivamente alla crescita del business.
Elaborazione e attuazione di strategie commerciali a medio-lungo termine, per il raggiungimento continuativo degli obiettivi individuali e di team.
Approccio consulenziale nella proposta di soluzioni, in grado di interpretare le esigenze del cliente, individuare opportunità e costruire relazioni strategiche e durature.
Collaborazione cross-funzionale con i team interni, per il miglioramento dei flussi operativi e l’ottimizzazione dell’esperienza utente sulla piattaforma Mediaset AdManager.
Spiccata attitudine commerciale, orientamento al cliente e capacità di costruire relazioni di fiducia con clienti PMI.
Esperienza consolidata nella vendita di soluzioni digitali e pubblicitarie, con ottima conoscenza del mercato e delle dinamiche di conversione.
Risultati comprovati nel raggiungimento e superamento degli obiettivi di vendita, anche in contesti sfidanti e ad alta competitività.
Forte orientamento al risultato, flessibilità operativa e capacità di adattarsi rapidamente a contesti in evoluzione.
Competenze nella vendita di soluzioni tecnologiche, con capacità di sviluppare proposte di valore in linea con le esigenze dei clienti.
Ottima padronanza degli strumenti digitali di supporto alla vendita, in particolare CRM (Dynamics) e suite Office, per una gestione strutturata ed efficiente del funnel commerciale.
Pieno supporto nelle attività e sostegno nella tua crescita
Responsabilizzazione, e quindi possibilità di prendere decisioni, sbagliare, apprendere e migliorare
Challenge e spinta al miglioramento continuo
Spazi di condivisione ed espressione personale

All’interno di Publitalia '80, per il team dedicato alla piattaforma digitale Mediaset AdManager, siamo alla ricerca di un/a Platform Consultant con spiccato approccio commerciale e strategico, responsabile della gestione di clienti esistenti e dell’attivazione di nuovi lead nel segmento PMI.



Responsabilità:

  • Gestione end-to-end del ciclo di vendita, dalla prima interazione con il cliente all’attivazione delle campagne pubblicitarie, con l’obiettivo di massimizzare il ritorno sull’investimento e garantire un’esperienza di valore.
  • Sviluppo di nuove opportunità commerciali, attraverso attività di prospecting strategico e consolidamento dei lead esistenti, contribuendo attivamente alla crescita del business.
  • Elaborazione e attuazione di strategie commerciali a medio-lungo termine, per il raggiungimento continuativo degli obiettivi individuali e di team.
  • Approccio consulenziale nella proposta di soluzioni, in grado di interpretare le esigenze del cliente, individuare opportunità e costruire relazioni strategiche e durature.
  • Collaborazione cross-funzionale con i team interni, per il miglioramento dei flussi operativi e l’ottimizzazione dell’esperienza utente sulla piattaforma Mediaset AdManager.



Competenze richieste:

  • Spiccata attitudine commerciale, orientamento al cliente e capacità di costruire relazioni di fiducia con clienti PMI.
  • Esperienza consolidata nella vendita di soluzioni digitali e pubblicitarie, con ottima conoscenza del mercato e delle dinamiche di conversione.
  • Risultati comprovati nel raggiungimento e superamento degli obiettivi di vendita, anche in contesti sfidanti e ad alta competitività.
  • Forte orientamento al risultato, flessibilità operativa e capacità di adattarsi rapidamente a contesti in evoluzione.
  • Competenze nella vendita di soluzioni tecnologiche, con capacità di sviluppare proposte di valore in linea con le esigenze dei clienti.
  • Ottima padronanza degli strumenti digitali di supporto alla vendita, in particolare CRM (Dynamics) e suite Office, per una gestione strutturata ed efficiente del funnel commerciale.


Cosa troverai:

  • Pieno supporto nelle attività e sostegno nella tua crescita
  • Responsabilizzazione, e quindi possibilità di prendere decisioni, sbagliare, apprendere e migliorare
  • Challenge e spinta al miglioramento continuo
  • Collaborazione, confronto, feedback
  • Spazi di condivisione ed espressione personale

MSX International Group is the leading global provider of outsourced business solutions for the automotive industry making business in more than 80 countries. MSXI’s deep industry expertise combined with advanced data analytics and custom software solutions improve the performance of automotive dealership networks by increasing revenue, reducing cost, and enhancing customer satisfaction.
Are you an automotive fan? Do you have experience in the world of data analysis and enjoy providing the best solutions for customers? MSXI has the job for you!
MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Junior Data Analyst to join our team in Rome or Milan.

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will support the data management and analysis processes within the organization. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes.
Collaborate with teams to identify business needs and data requirements
Create reports, and conduct analyses regarding trainings
Applying the procedures in compliance with the company's standards and policies

We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Junior Data Analyst has a Bachelor’s degree in IT, Statistics or similar experience, as well as:
Advanced level user of Power BI, HTML, MS Office
Fully professional Italian and English knowledge
Experience of planning complex schedules of activities
If you can demonstrate that you are familiar with data analysis and reporting and you are a team-player, we would like to hear from you!

At MSX, our employees are the force behind our success. We are dedicated to empowering and encouraging our people and offer flexible working methods to suit all. We are a Disability Confident Committed organisation who takes pride in our diverse workforce.
In Joining MSX, You Can Enjoy
You can learn more about MSX International on our website: www.msxi.com

and the power of technology, to craft tailored and innovative solutions
To enhance every journey in the world of mobility

Company Description

MSX International Group is the leading global provider of outsourced business solutions for the automotive industry making business in more than 80 countries. MSXI’s deep industry expertise combined with advanced data analytics and custom software solutions improve the performance of automotive dealership networks by increasing revenue, reducing cost, and enhancing customer satisfaction.

Job Description

Junior Data Analyst

40 hours per week, Monday-Friday

Rome / Milan, hybrid

Are you an automotive fan? Do you have experience in the world of data analysis and enjoy providing the best solutions for customers? MSXI has the job for you!

MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Junior Data Analyst to join our team in Rome or Milan.

The Role

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will support the data management and analysis processes within the organization. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes.

Your Key Tasks Will Be

  • Collaborate with teams to identify business needs and data requirements
  • Create reports, and conduct analyses regarding trainings
  • Applying the procedures in compliance with the company's standards and policies

About You

We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Junior Data Analyst has a Bachelor’s degree in IT, Statistics or similar experience, as well as:

  • Experience in reporting, data analysis
  • Advanced level user of Power BI, HTML, MS Office
  • Experience with Learning Management Systems (Cornerstone)
  • Fully professional Italian and English knowledge
  • Great problem-solving and communication skills
  • Experience of planning complex schedules of activities

If you can demonstrate that you are familiar with data analysis and reporting and you are a team-player, we would like to hear from you!

What’s in it for you?

At MSX, our employees are the force behind our success. We are dedicated to empowering and encouraging our people and offer flexible working methods to suit all. We are a Disability Confident Committed organisation who takes pride in our diverse workforce.

In Joining MSX, You Can Enjoy

  • Competitive salary
  • Company laptop and phone
  • Lunch voucher

Working Pattern

  • 40 hours per week
  • Monday – Friday, 9 am to 6 pm
  • Rome or Milan - hybrid

You can learn more about MSX International on our website: www.msxi.com

About MSX

With over 5,000 employees based in more than 80 countries across the globe, our teams provide industry leading expertise that spans:

  • Consumer Engagement
  • Parts, Accessories &
column2:

4236641254,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analista-dati-at-teethan-4236641254?position=47&pageNum=0&refId=vq8WS7zgmrGZDLe1HPBa5g%3D%3D&trackingId=AVlWlG3kX43TQZsBtM9Jqw%3D%3D,Analista dati,Teethan,"Garbagnate Milanese, Lombardy, Italy","Hai voglia di fare la differenza con i numeri e le analisi? Scrivici: potresti essere tu la persona che stiamo cercando.

In Teethan S.p.A. (www.teethan.com), azienda medicale innovativa che opera nel mercato dentale, siamo alla ricerca di un Data Analyst con spirito analitico, precisione e voglia di contribuire attivamente alle scelte strategiche dell’azienda.

La figura lavorerà a stretto contatto con il reparto Marketing e Sales, e avrà un ruolo centrale nell’elaborazione e interpretazione dei dati aziendali, con l’obiettivo di supportare processi decisionali più rapidi, consapevoli ed efficaci.
Analisi dei dati di vendita e delle performance di marketing
Costruzione e aggiornamento di report periodici (KPI, dashboard, ecc.)
Interpretazione dei dati per la generazione di insight utili alla Direzione aziendale
Segmentazione clienti e studio delle buyer personas
Collaborazione con il CRM Manager per garantire la qualità e l'integrità dei dati
Supporto alla direzione nelle analisi previsionali (forecasting) e nelle simulazioni di scenario
Esperienza pregressa di almeno 2 anni in ruoli di data analysis, preferibilmente in aziende B2B o ambito healthcare
Conoscenza avanzata di Excel e buona padronanza di strumenti di data visualization (es: Power BI, Looker, Tableau)
Familiarità con l’uso di CRM (preferibilmente Hubspot) e tool di marketing automation
Pensiero critico, capacità di sintesi e attitudine al problem solving
Autonomia organizzativa, senso del risultato e voglia di crescere in un contesto dinamico
Inserimento in un contesto innovativo, con progetti concreti e una forte attenzione alla crescita professionale
Formazione continua su strumenti, metodi e modelli di analisi
Retribuzione da definire in base all’esperienza, con possibilità di premialità legate a progetti o obiettivi strategici
Ambiente di lavoro collaborativo e orientato al risultato

Hai voglia di fare la differenza con i numeri e le analisi? Scrivici: potresti essere tu la persona che stiamo cercando.


In Teethan S.p.A. (www.teethan.com), azienda medicale innovativa che opera nel mercato dentale, siamo alla ricerca di un Data Analyst con spirito analitico, precisione e voglia di contribuire attivamente alle scelte strategiche dell’azienda.

La figura lavorerà a stretto contatto con il reparto Marketing e Sales, e avrà un ruolo centrale nell’elaborazione e interpretazione dei dati aziendali, con l’obiettivo di supportare processi decisionali più rapidi, consapevoli ed efficaci.


Responsabilità principali:
column2:
• Analisi dei dati di vendita e delle performance di marketing
  • Costruzione e aggiornamento di report periodici (KPI, dashboard, ecc.)
  • Interpretazione dei dati per la generazione di insight utili alla Direzione aziendale
  • Segmentazione clienti e studio delle buyer personas
  • Collaborazione con il CRM Manager per garantire la qualità e l'integrità dei dati
  • Supporto alla direzione nelle analisi previsionali (forecasting) e nelle simulazioni di scenario

Profilo richiesto

  • Esperienza pregressa di almeno 2 anni in ruoli di data analysis, preferibilmente in aziende B2B o ambito healthcare
  • Conoscenza avanzata di Excel e buona padronanza di strumenti di data visualization (es: Power BI, Looker, Tableau)
  • Familiarità con l’uso di CRM (preferibilmente Hubspot) e tool di marketing automation
  • Pensiero critico, capacità di sintesi e attitudine al problem solving
  • Autonomia organizzativa, senso del risultato e voglia di crescere in un contesto dinamico


Cosa offriamo

  • Inserimento in un contesto innovativo, con progetti concreti e una forte attenzione alla crescita professionale
  • Formazione continua su strumenti, metodi e modelli di analisi
  • Retribuzione da definire in base all’esperienza, con possibilità di premialità legate a progetti o obiettivi strategici
  • Ambiente di lavoro collaborativo e orientato al risultato

ICT Junior Business Intelligence Specialist

The candidate will be part of the ICT Business Intelligence department and will join the team dedicated to designing the company's data architecture and managing the analysis and planning tools used within the company.

Main Activities And Responsibilities

  • Management and maintenance of the BI suite.
  • Development and maintenance of SAP BusinessObjects reports.
  • Development and maintenance of Power BI dashboards and reports.
  • Support for planning activities using company platforms.
  • User support and help desk assistance for BI issues.

Required Skills

  • Diploma or Degree in STEM disciplines.
  • At least one year of experience in analysis and reporting.
  • Good knowledge of SQL language.
  • Knowledge of the main DBMS (especially SQL Server, Oracle, and Snowflake).
  • Knowledge of at least one reporting tool (SAP BusinessObjects and/or Power BI).
  • Experience with ETL processes and data integration tools.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent knowledge of the English language.

Ali Lavoro Spa, filiale di Cassina de Pecchi, sta selezionando per giovane azienda italiana specializzata nella produzione di integratori alimentari conto terzi, un-una impiegato-impiegata amministrativo PT 20 ore.
La risorsa, che gestirà le attività in completa autonomia, si occuperà principalmente di:
Effettuare la registrazione della contabilità generale
Prima nota cassa e banca, corrispettivi
Gestione R.A. controlli IVA, gestione dei cespiti
Operazioni di rettifica ai fini dei Bilanci del periodo
Predisposizione e gestione dei pagamenti bancari
Monitoraggio delle scadenze e dei pagamenti
Creazione ordini a fornitore ed inserimento dati
Contrattazione con fornitori per ordini merce
Diploma in ragioneria e/o laurea in economia e/o finanza
Esperienze in società di consulenza in ambito economico/finanziario o in società di revisione

Ali Spa

Ali Lavoro Spa, filiale di Cassina de Pecchi, sta selezionando per giovane azienda italiana specializzata nella produzione di integratori alimentari conto terzi, un-una impiegato-impiegata amministrativo PT 20 ore.

La risorsa, che gestirà le attività in completa autonomia, si occuperà principalmente di:

  • Effettuare la registrazione della contabilità generale
  • Prima nota cassa e banca, corrispettivi
  • Registrazione fatture fornitori
  • Stampa dei registri IVA
  • Riconciliazioni estratti conto bancari
  • Gestione incassi clienti
  • Gestione R.A. controlli IVA, gestione dei cespiti
  • Operazioni di rettifica ai fini dei Bilanci del periodo
  • Predisposizione e gestione dei pagamenti bancari
  • Monitoraggio delle scadenze e dei pagamenti
  • Creazione ordini a fornitore ed inserimento dati
  • Controllo bolle di carico magazzino
  • Contrattazione con fornitori per ordini merce
  • Riapprovvigionamento magazzino tramite gestionale
  • Solleciti per recupero crediti

Si Richiede

  • Diploma in ragioneria e/o laurea in economia e/o finanza
  • Conoscenza di Excel
  • Esperienze in società di consulenza in ambito economico/finanziario o in società di revisione
  • Esperienza in reparto amministrazione/finanza

Si Offre

  • Contratto a t. determinato con possibilità di assunzione a t. indeterminato
  • Inserimento al 3 livello del CCNL del commercio
  • Part time 20h/settimana dal lunedì al venerdì (9.00 - 13.00)

Luogo di lavoro: Sesto San Giovanni (MI)

Tutti gli annunci di lavoro da noi pubblicati si intendono rivolti ad ambo i sessi, a persone di tutte le eta' e nazionalita' (ex L. 903/77, D.Lgs. 215/03 e 216/03 s.m.i.). Informativa sul trattamento dati (GDPR: Reg. UE 2016/679) presente al seguente Link e nel sito di Ali Lavoro. Agenzia per il Lavoro, iscrizione Albo informatico Sez. I Aut. ANPAL Prot. 75.

Settore: Altro

Ruolo: Amministrazione/Paghe e contributi

Tipo di occupazione: Contratto a tempo determinato

4237573022,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-f2informatica-consulenza-cloud-nosql-iot-4237573022?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=vq8WS7zgmrGZDLe1HPBa5g%3D%3D&trackingId=Uv1%2Bm9toLET7lA44sME0FA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,"F2Informatica | Consulenza, Cloud, NoSQL, IoT","Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Dal 1998 sosteniamo le aziende nell'utilizzo e nello sviluppo delle tecnologie digitali, in modo da potenziarne la crescita. Siamo specializzati in servizi di consulenza e sviluppo software su tematiche Cloud, IoT, NoSQL.
Stiamo cercando un Data Analyst middle, per un nostro importante cliente nel settore Media e broadcasting.

Ti occuperai della progettazione e gestione di pipeline dati, sviluppo di report e dashboard (Tableau/Power BI), monitoraggio dei sistemi (Grafana) e collaborazione con team cross-funzionali, utilizzando strumenti di versionamento del codice (es. Git) e interfacciandoti con gli stakeholder per la raccolta dei requisiti.
Esperienza consolidata in ruoli di Data Analyst o Data Scientist
Ottima conoscenza di strumenti di BI: Tableau e/o Power BI
Esperienza con tool di monitoring come Grafana
Esperienza nella raccolta e analisi dei requisiti funzionali
Contratto e benefit: offriamo contratto a tempo indeterminato (CCNL Commercio) + ticket restaurant per ogni giorno lavorato. La retribuzione sarà commisurata all'effettiva esperienza del candidato.
Per contribuire al tuo sviluppo professionale avrai la possibilità di seguire corsi di formazione e di ottenere certificazioni relative al tuo settore.
uno o due colloqui con i referenti tecnici del team.
👉 Ti riconosci in questa descrizione? Candidati direttamente qui su LinkedIn. Siamo curiosi di conoscerti!
Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità.

Gli interessati possono inviare curriculum vitae corredato di autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati Informativa ai sensi degli Artt. 13 e 14 del Regolamento UE 2016/679 in materia di protezione dei dati personali. F2 Informatica S.r.l., Titolare del trattamento, con sede legale in via Settembrini, 35, 20124, Milano, utilizza i dati che la riguardano esclusivamente per lo svolgimento dell'attività di ricerca, selezione e valutazione del Personale. I Suoi dati saranno condivisi con terzi solo nei limiti di cui all’informativa estesa e saranno conservati presso per un periodo di tempo non superiore a 6 mesi. Per informazioni dettagliate, anche in ordine al Suo diritto di accesso agli altri Suoi diritti, può contattare il nostro Referente Privacy all’indirizzo privacy@f2informatica.it o il nostro DPO al seguente indirizzo: dpo-f2informatica@oneseal.eu

4233903298,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-internship-at-kedrion-biopharma-4233903298?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=tJCtI%2BbcYxPNWl3sUl1IyA%3D%3D&trackingId=V68QeHtJ6VkrBC8mpMEMIQ%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Internship,Kedrion Biopharma,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Job description:
Business Intelligence Intern (Global/International) Location: Milan, Italy

We are looking for a motivated and talented intern to join our Business Intelligence team. The ideal candidate will have a strong passion for data analysis and the ability to transform complex information into valuable business insights on a global scale. Key responsibilities will include supporting project execution, participating in the analysis, development, and maintenance of Business Intelligence, Big Data, and Analytics solutions. The candidate will operate in line with requirements and the technical landscape, adopting best practices and adhering to external regulations. Requirements: • Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or related fields (also in progress).• Basic knowledge of Business Intelligence tools.• Analytical skills and attention to detail.• Good communication skills and teamwork abilities.• Proficiency in English. Main Responsibilities: • Assist in the collection and management of data from various international business sources.• Supporting data analysis using BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, and SQL. Training to be provided where suitable.• Creation of reports and dashboards to present analysis results.• Collaboration with the team to understand business needs and provide data-driven solutions.• Providing support in the maintenance and management of the company's Data Warehouse and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.• Supporting the supervisor in gathering and evaluating business requirements to ensure they are correctly collected and technically feasible.• Assisting the supervisor in regular maintenance of BI/Big Data and Analytics, in line with requirements and the technical landscape.• Drafting and supporting documentation to accurately represent business processes and train end users on new solutions in conjunction with the supervisor.• For the area of responsibility, supporting the supervisor in executing project activities to ensure initiatives are completed on time and within budget.• Collaborating with business functions in reviewing technical documents to ensure alignment with business requirements.• Assisting with the execution all testing phases, in line with test plans, to monitor the correct functioning of implemented applications.• Support the provision of training to end users and day to day services to ensure smooth adoption of BI applications.• Supporting IT support services and business end users in resolving complex issues to ensure they are resolved with minimal disruption. What We Offer: Opportunities for learning and professional growth in an international context.Dynamic and stimulating work environment.Chance to work on innovative and impactful global projects
This announcement is addressed to applicants of both sexes (L. 903/77 - D.Lgs n. 198/2006) and also to those belonging to Protected Categories (L.68/99).

4224392204,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/oss-endoscopia-at-fondazione-sacra-famiglia-onlus-4224392204?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=tJCtI%2BbcYxPNWl3sUl1IyA%3D%3D&trackingId=18KeU9vj81x0sZJUL%2F3R9A%3D%3D,OSS - Endoscopia,Fondazione Sacra Famiglia Onlus,"Cesano Boscone, Lombardy, Italy","Casa di Cura Ambrosiana è una clinica privata accreditata con il Servizio Sanitario Regionale in grado di offrire prestazioni di ricovero e prestazioni ambulatoriali nelle principali specialità.

Casa di Cura Ambrosiana è stata fondata nel 1967 da Fondazione Sacra Famiglia Onlus per rispondere alle esigenze medico-chirurgiche di pazienti portatori di handicap. Nel corso degli anni, oltre a mantenere la mission di cura verso la popolazione fragile, si è notevolmente ampliata nelle competenze e nell’offerta, mettendosi al servizio dell’eterogenea utenza del territorio.
Casa di Cura Ambrosiana ricerca un/a OSS da inserire all'interno dell'ambulatorio di Endoscopia.
verificare il programma giornaliero e prepara le attrezzature, in collaborazione con l'Infermiere
accogliere il paziente, raccogliendo i dati anamnestici, verificando la corretta preparazione e informandolo sulla procedura
aiutare il paziente nella preparazione per l'esame e assistere il medico durante la procedura
supportare il paziente nella fase di recupero e fornisce indicazioni post-esame
gestire la la pulizia e la sterilizzazione delle attrezzature.
esperienza maturata nel ruolo o in attività di sterilizzazione di strumenti
disponibilità full-time (dal lunedì al venerdì dalle 8:30 alle 16:00).
Si offre contratto di assunzione full-time.

Le persone, ambosessi (L. 903/77), interessate che rispondono alle caratteristiche richieste possono inoltrare la propria candidatura, corredata di autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi dell’art. 13 del D. Lgs. 196/2003 e all’art. 13 GDPR 679 del 2016.

4130498632,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-subito-4130498632?position=4&pageNum=2&refId=tJCtI%2BbcYxPNWl3sUl1IyA%3D%3D&trackingId=mcW6x1naQMIS5DNqHwVh3A%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Subito,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We’re Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We’re all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You’ll Do & Who You Are
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito’s team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.
The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.
The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it’s more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding
4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences
Prior experience in a digital company
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
Hands on experience on Data Science projects
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‘Work from anywhere’ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a €8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Who You Are

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito’s team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.

The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Your Typical Day

  • Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it’s more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
  • Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
  • Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
  • Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
  • Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
  • Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding

Skills Required

  • 4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
  • Highly proficient with SQL
  • Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
  • Applied knowledge of statistical techniques
  • Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences

Plus

  • Good English proficiency level
  • Prior experience in a digital company
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
  • Hands on experience on Data Science projects

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
  • Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
  • Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • ‘Work from anywhere’ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a €8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

4230791789,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/stage-fraud-data-analyst-at-leroy-merlin-4230791789?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=tJCtI%2BbcYxPNWl3sUl1IyA%3D%3D&trackingId=KLAVMhIbpiX1eeghvGDcGQ%3D%3D,Stage Fraud Data Analyst,Leroy Merlin,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","🔎 Chi siamo?

Leroy Merlin fa parte del gruppo internazionale Adeo e ha una missione chiara: aiutare le persone a realizzare i loro progetti di casa e di vita, offrendo soluzioni innovative e ad alto impatto positivo. La nostra strategia è omnicanale, il nostro focus sono le persone.
Vogliamo costruire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, collaborativo e stimolante, dove il miglioramento continuo è il motore della crescita personale e professionale.
✅ Formazione e sviluppo: affronterai un percorso strutturato tra attività pratiche on the job e approfondimenti teorici in aula.
✅ Mentorship e supporto: avrai il supporto di tutor aziendali che ti guideranno passo dopo passo, aiutandoti a sviluppare competenze chiave.
✅ Strumenti digitali: ti forniremo PC e smartphone aziendale per lavorare in modo smart e digitale.
✅ Ambiente dinamico e flessibile: dopo la fase di inserimento, potrai accedere alla nostra policy di smart working ibrido, alternando giornate in sede e da remoto.
✅ Mensa aziendale: perché anche il benessere passa dal buon cibo!

Sarà un’esperienza unica all’interno del team Finance, con l’obiettivo di contribuire attivamente all'analisi dei dati per identificare e prevenire le frodi. Il ruolo offre l’opportunità di lavorare a stretto contatto con Data Scientists e analisti esperti, al fine di acquisire competenze pratiche in un ambiente dinamico e stimolante.
🔹Creazione di reportistica e dashboard automatizzati con tool di data visualization per il monitoraggio del dato (PowerBI e Looker)
🔹Supporto all’analisi dei dati per identificare schemi e possibili frodi
🔹Supporto allo sviluppo e implementazione di modelli di rilevamento frodi, e monitoring continuo delle anomalie
🔹Collaborazione con altri dipartimenti per migliorare i processi di prevenzione
🔹Opportunità di interagire con le altre Business Units italiane del gruppo ADEO: Bricocenter e Tecnomat
🎓 Laurea triennale/magistrale in discipline quantitative (es. Statistica, Matematica, Informatica, Ingegneria Gestionale)
💻Buona conoscenza di Excel/Gsheet (funzioni principali e tabelle pivot) e PPT/Gslide
🧩 Conoscenza e/o interesse per linguaggi di programmazione (SQL) e Power BI/Looker
🤖 Conoscenza e/o interesse nell’utilizzo di tecnologie AI
🌍Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese e/o francese
🎯 Attitudine al problem solving e proattività
🌍 Crediamo che la diversità sia una risorsa fondamentale per il nostro successo. Accogliamo con favore le candidature di tutte le persone, indipendentemente da genere, età, background e abilità.
👉 Inviaci la tua candidatura e inizia il tuo percorso con noi!

🔎 Chi siamo?

Leroy Merlin fa parte del gruppo internazionale Adeo e ha una missione chiara: aiutare le persone a realizzare i loro progetti di casa e di vita, offrendo soluzioni innovative e ad alto impatto positivo. La nostra strategia è omnicanale, il nostro focus sono le persone.

🔹Opportunità di interagire con le altre Business Units italiane del gruppo ADEO: Bricocenter e Tecnomat


✅ QUALIFICHE E COMPETENZE

🌍 Crediamo che la diversità sia una risorsa fondamentale per il nostro successo. Accogliamo con favore le candidature di tutte le persone, indipendentemente da genere, età, background e abilità.


🎯 Vuoi unirti al team Finance?

👉 Inviaci la tua candidatura e inizia il tuo percorso con noi!

4217848552,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-growth-communication-strategist-at-mediaset-4217848552?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=tJCtI%2BbcYxPNWl3sUl1IyA%3D%3D&trackingId=fnusBNLu4GVAjse%2FNCD90Q%3D%3D,Digital Growth & Communication Strategist,Mediaset,"Cologno Monzese, Lombardy, Italy","All’interno di Publitalia80, nel team dedicato alla piattaforma digitale Mediaset AdManager, stiamo cercando un/a digital-first marketer con approccio strategico e mindset da growth hacker, capace di guidare le attività di lead generation, ottimizzare il funnel di conversione e monitorare i KPI, integrando comunicazione multicanale e sviluppo di partnership strategiche.
Cosa farai – Focus su crescita, dati e attivazione
Pianificare e implementare strategie di lead generation attraverso campagne digitali, inbound marketing, eventi e altre iniziative mirate.
Gestire e monitorare l'intero funnel di conversione, assicurandosi che ogni fase sia ottimizzata per migliorare i tassi di conversione.
Monitorare e analizzare i KPI principali (es. CPL, ROI, conversion rate, CAC) per valutare l'efficacia delle attività di marketing e identificare aree di miglioramento.
Collaborare con il team Sales per assicurare un flusso continuo di opportunità qualificate e migliorare la gestione dei contatti.
Sviluppare e coordinare campagne di comunicazione multicanale (offline e online), garantendo coerenza del brand e massimizzando l’impatto su diversi touchpoint.
Creare, in collaborazione con agenzie esterne, contenuti di valore (articoli, blog post, video, materiali promozionali, social media) per migliorare il posizionamento dell'azienda.
Gestire la presenza aziendale sui media tradizionali, digitali e social, mantenendo una narrativa forte e coerente.
Lavorare a stretto contatto con agenzie creative, PR e partner media per amplificare la visibilità dei messaggi chiave.
Identificare e sviluppare relazioni strategiche con partner chiave (es. fornitori, associazioni, piattaforme) per ampliare le opportunità di mercato.
Monitorare il ROI delle partnership e ottimizzare gli accordi per garantire risultati misurabili.
Chi sei – Hard skills + digital mindset
Esperienza: 3/5 anni in ruoli analoghi nel digital marketing e/o marketing&communication, preferibilmente in contesti B2B rivolti a SMB
Competenze analitiche: Capacità di interpretare dati e KPI per orientare strategie e decisioni.
Capacità strategiche: Esperienza nella creazione di piani di marketing cross-mediali e nel posizionamento di brand.

Conoscenza digitale: Padronanza delle piattaforme di marketing automation, strumenti di tracciamento (es. Google Analytics, CRM) e gestione campagne (es. Google Ads, Meta Ads). Conoscena approfondita di CRM quali ad esempio Salesforce, Dynamics sales.
Lingue: Ottima conoscenza della lingua italiana e inglese, Spagnolo nice to have

4233574668,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-stage-curriculare-at-publicis-sapient-4233574668?position=2&pageNum=5&refId=547IUzW2rteAK93iperoLg%3D%3D&trackingId=r8JTNC2%2FIleDPlzZFhRobA%3D%3D,Data Analyst Stage curriculare,Publicis Sapient,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Come Data Analyst Curricular Intern, avrai l'opportunità di analizzare le performance delle campagne digitali, con particolare attenzione ai KPI di funnel e media. Sarai responsabile della raccolta e dell'organizzazione dei dati da fonti interne ed esterne, contribuendo a pulire e correggere eventuali errori nei sistemi di raccolta e archiviazione dei dati. In questo ruolo, fornirai report dettagliati e documenti con i risultati delle analisi, presentandoli agli stakeholder interni e supportando il cliente in analisi ad hoc per sbloccare insights chiave.
• Analizzare le performance delle campagne digitali, con particolare attenzione ai KPI di funnel e media.
• Raccogliere dati da fonti interne ed esterne, organizzarli e strutturarli per la pulizia dei database, correggendo eventuali errori nei sistemi di raccolta e archiviazione.
• Creare report e documenti dettagliati con i risultati delle analisi da presentare agli stakeholder interni.
• Supportare il cliente in analisi ad hoc e richieste specifiche per ottenere insight strategici.
• Passione per l'analisi dei dati, individuazione di pattern e anomalie, con capacità di risolverli.

column1: • Capacità di operare in ambienti di lavoro complessi, fluidi e dinamici.
• Fluente in inglese (sia scritto che parlato).

• Possibilità di partecipare a conferenze ed eventi formativi.
• Accesso a benefit aziendali attraverso i nostri partner.

Publicis Sapient è una società globale di consulenza digitale e tecnologica parte di Publicis Groupe, specializzata nella trasformazione digitale. La nostra missione è aiutare le aziende a ottimizzare processi e migliorare l'esperienza del cliente attraverso l'uso di soluzioni digitali avanzate.

Come parte del nostro impegno per una forza lavoro inclusiva e diversificata, Publicis Sapient è dedicata alla parità di opportunità di impiego senza distinzione di razza, colore, origine nazionale, etnia, genere, status di veterano protetto, disabilità, orientamento sessuale, identità di genere o religione. Siamo inoltre impegnati a fornire sistemazioni ragionevoli per individui qualificati con disabilità e veterani disabili nelle nostre procedure di candidatura.

Come Data Analyst Curricular Intern, avrai l'opportunità di analizzare le performance delle campagne digitali, con particolare attenzione ai KPI di funnel e media. Sarai responsabile della raccolta e dell'organizzazione dei dati da fonti interne ed esterne, contribuendo a pulire e correggere eventuali errori nei sistemi di raccolta e archiviazione dei dati. In questo ruolo, fornirai report dettagliati e documenti con i risultati delle analisi, presentandoli agli stakeholder interni e supportando il cliente in analisi ad hoc per sbloccare insights chiave.


Le tue responsabilità:

• Analizzare le performance delle campagne digitali, con particolare attenzione ai KPI di funnel e media.

• Raccogliere dati da fonti interne ed esterne, organizzarli e strutturarli per la pulizia dei database, correggendo eventuali errori nei sistemi di raccolta e archiviazione.

• Creare report e documenti dettagliati con i risultati delle analisi da presentare agli stakeholder interni.

• Supportare il cliente in analisi ad hoc e richieste specifiche per ottenere insight strategici.

Competenze tecniche:

• Passione per l'analisi dei dati, individuazione di pattern e anomalie, con capacità di risolverli.

• Esperienza consolidata con software come Power BI, Tableau, Qlik
column2:
esperienza con Adobe è un plus.

• Conoscenza del pacchetto Office.


Competenze trasversali:

• Capacità di operare in ambienti di lavoro complessi, fluidi e dinamici.

• Fluente in inglese (sia scritto che parlato).


Cosa offriamo:

• Stage curriculare retribuito con possibilità di lavoro ibrido.

• Possibilità di partecipare a conferenze ed eventi formativi.

• Accesso a benefit aziendali attraverso i nostri partner.

4239548692,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-analytics-consultant-intern-milan-at-fifty-five-4239548692?position=5&pageNum=5&refId=547IUzW2rteAK93iperoLg%3D%3D&trackingId=5HsXZz4wvFUXT%2Baxo%2F8Y%2Bg%3D%3D,Digital Analytics Consultant Intern - Milan,fifty-five,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","About The Company

Rapid shifts in technology have dramatically changed the way people interact and engage with brands. fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands leverage data to improve marketing, media, and customer experience through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.
As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +400 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.
Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York.

We are looking for a Digital Analytics Consultant Intern to join our new Milan-based consulting team. This is a varied role which spans across website architecture, UX analysis, media advisory and digital strategy. As a Consultant intern at 55, you will be working on marketing analytics and marketing activations as opposed to setting up and optimising campaigns, so we therefore are seeking applicants with some prior experience in marketing or web analytics.

Working as part of a small, collaborative team, you will play a key role in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple, big brand clients across industries such as luxury, automotive, retail and beauty. These projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation and media-mix optimisation and you will be required to promote a customer-centric vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions.

You will report to the Head of office and work alongside other Consultants and technical experts such as Tracking Specialists, Cloud Engineers and Innovation Experts. Led by the Senior Consultant, you will contribute to the timely & professional delivery of our projects. Examples of the sort of project work you will be part of delivering within the first year of your role include but are not limited to
column2: the creation and monitoring of complex dashboards aimed at aggregating findings from numerous data sources
column3: the evaluation of client's existing marketing channel mix and the recommendation of the most suitable attribution model
column4: the implementation of cookie consent management solutions to obtain users consent for data collection, martech audience review and architecture recommendation. This is an exciting, hands-on role within a company that puts collaboration and knowledge sharing at the heart of everything we do.

column1: Within your first year at fifty-five, you will be taking on the following core tasks and responsibilities, amongst others:
Delivering high quality outcomes for a variety of projects in the Ad Tech and Web Analytics space, working in a client-facing position, supported by a team of technical specialists
Meeting client's requirements within the agreed deadlines, keeping track of the necessary tasks for each project and liaising with the relevant owners internally and externally
column2: foreseeing and escalating issues / risks as appropriate

column1: Developing a sharp, operational expertise regarding web analytics and media-buy topics

Progressing in your journey at fifty-five, you will be given the opportunity to grow in your role through first-hand exposure to multiple disciplines and, if interested, you might be selected to take a specialist path.
Understanding of how clients use digital data in their businesses
Analytical mindset, keen to apply data to challenges
Fluent or native in italian & english are mandatory
Detail oriented, proactive and self-motivated, good organisation is paramount
Curious and eager to learn, able to challenge and recommend solutions to problems
Flexible, versatile and works well under pressure
Collaborative, works well in a team, understands that the sum of our parts is better than the individual
Strong interest in new marketing technologies & the digital industry
Interest in working in a small, growing team
If this sounds like you, please get in touch! We look forward to meeting you.
In return, we are pleased to offer you the following benefits:
Being part of a multicultural, dynamic and fast-growing team
Continuous (and certified) training on the digital ecosystem and technologies (initial training for all new employees, followed by recurring training sessions)
The flexibility to work remotely for part of the week - this will continue post Covid

fifty-five encourages diversity and is committed to guaranteeing equal treatment of all applications, regardless of gender, age, origin, sexual orientation, state of health or political or religious opinion.

Rapid shifts in technology have dramatically changed the way people interact and engage with brands. fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands leverage data to improve marketing, media, and customer experience through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.

As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +400 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York.

About The Role

As a Consultant intern at 55, you will be working on marketing analytics and marketing activations as opposed to setting up and optimising campaigns, so we therefore are seeking applicants with some prior experience in marketing or web analytics.

Working as part of a small, collaborative team, you will play a key role in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple, big brand clients across industries such as luxury, automotive, retail and beauty. These projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation and media-mix optimisation and you will be required to promote a customer-centric vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions.

You will report to the Head of office and work alongside other Consultants and technical experts such as Tracking Specialists, Cloud Engineers and Innovation Experts. Led by the Senior Consultant, you will contribute to the timely &

the implementation of cookie consent management solutions to obtain users consent for data collection, martech audience review and architecture recommendation. This is an exciting, hands-on role within a company that puts collaboration and knowledge sharing at the heart of everything we do.

4238757068,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-intern-at-ab-inbev-4238757068?position=8&pageNum=5&refId=547IUzW2rteAK93iperoLg%3D%3D&trackingId=iFk67HCS1HB%2F4RpBMgzpiA%3D%3D,Data Analyst Intern,AB InBev,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Seniority Level:

We are seeking a motivated and curious Data Analyst Intern to join our Operations team and help us build and enhance reporting, dashboards, and analytical tools across our logistics and supply chain operations. You’ll work closely with regional leaders in Commercial, Sales and Logistics to support visibility, identify inefficiencies, and enable data-driven decisions in a dynamic, multinational environment.
Support the design, development, and automation of operational reports and KPIs across countries
Analyze logistics performance data (e.g., transportation, warehousing, order fulfillment)
Create dashboards (Power BI or Excel-based) that provide actionable insights for the operations team
Partner with supply chain, planning, and logistics stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver solutions
Support ad hoc analysis and deep dives into operational bottlenecks or cost drivers
Identify opportunities to streamline data processes and improve data accuracy
Bachelor’s or Master’s student in Engineering, Business Analytics, Statistics, Data Science, or related field
Solid skills in Excel (advanced functions, pivot tables, etc.)
Familiarity with Power BI or other dashboarding tools will help a lot
Basic knowledge of SQL is a big plus
Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate in an international team
Proactive attitude, willingness to learn, and ability to work independently

Seniority Level:

Role Overview

We are seeking a motivated and curious Data Analyst Intern to join our Operations team and help us build and enhance reporting, dashboards, and analytical tools across our logistics and supply chain operations. You’ll work closely with regional leaders in Commercial, Sales and Logistics to support visibility, identify inefficiencies, and enable data-driven decisions in a dynamic, multinational environment.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support the design, development, and automation of operational reports and KPIs across countries
  • Analyze logistics performance data (e.g., transportation, warehousing, order fulfillment)
  • Create dashboards (Power BI or Excel-based) that provide actionable insights for the operations team
  • Partner with supply chain, planning, and logistics stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver solutions
  • Support ad hoc analysis and deep dives into operational bottlenecks or cost drivers
  • Identify opportunities to streamline data processes and improve data accuracy

What We’re Looking For

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s student in Engineering, Business Analytics, Statistics, Data Science, or related field
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset
  • Solid skills in Excel (advanced functions, pivot tables, etc.)
  • Familiarity with Power BI or other dashboarding tools will help a lot
  • Basic knowledge of SQL is a big plus
  • Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate in an international team
  • Proactive attitude, willingness to learn, and ability to work independently

4233369181,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-bracco-4233369181?position=9&pageNum=5&refId=547IUzW2rteAK93iperoLg%3D%3D&trackingId=rPnm%2BfoiuHVLdnnaFvecig%3D%3D,DATA ANALYST,Bracco,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Bracco is an international Group active in the healthcare sector and a leader in diagnostic imaging. The Group’s main products are contrast agents sold in over 100 countries, both directly and indirectly through branches, joint ventures and license and distribution agreements.
Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive innovation and impact?
We are looking for a Data Analyst based in Milan. In this role, you'll contribute in shaping data-driven strategies and optimizing operations across our organization.
What is the main purpose of this job?
As Data Analyst, you will join the Transformation & Performance Improvement team.

You'll oversee the development and implementation of data analytics strategies to align with organizational goals. Your expertise in data analysis and visualization will support decision-making processes and continuous improvement initiatives.
You'll be responsible for ensuring data accuracy, identifying trends, and optimizing efficiency through insightful data analysis.
Develop and implement data analytics strategies aligned with organizational goals.
Utilize advanced data analytics tools such as Power BI to create insightful dashboards for effective visualization.
Define key metrics and KPIs to measure business performance and support decision-making processes.
Conduct in-depth analysis of raw data to identify trends, patterns, and outliers.
Collaborate closely with internal teams to enhance data-driven decision-making capabilities.
Provide support to production sites in Italy by understanding their data needs and offering data analysis expertise.
Communicate complex analytical findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders effectively.
Willingness to travel primarily within Italy to provide on-site support to production sites.
Degree in Management Engineering, Statistics, or related field.
Proven experience as Data Analyst with a focus on Power BI usage.
Strong proficiency in Python for data cleaning, data visualization and analysis.
Minimum 3-5 years of work experience, preferably in industrial sectors.
Experience in pharma, chemical or food industry is considered a plus.
Knowledge of Continuous Improvement and Operational Excellence principles is considered a plus.
If you meet the requirements of this opportunity and would like to join an international group working to improve patients' lives, apply now!
At Bracco, we believe in the values of diversity and inclusion. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people and their experiences, ensuring a fair opportunity for all.

Bracco is an international Group active in the healthcare sector and a leader in diagnostic imaging. The Group’s main products are contrast agents sold in over 100 countries, both directly and indirectly through branches, joint ventures and license and distribution agreements.

Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive innovation and impact?

We are looking for a Data Analyst based in Milan. In this role, you'll contribute in shaping data-driven strategies and optimizing operations across our organization.


What is the main purpose of this job?

As Data Analyst, you will join the Transformation &
column2:
Performance Improvement team.

You'll oversee the development and implementation of data analytics strategies to align with organizational goals. Your expertise in data analysis and visualization will support decision-making processes and continuous improvement initiatives.

You'll be responsible for ensuring data accuracy, identifying trends, and optimizing efficiency through insightful data analysis.


Responsibilities

  • Develop and implement data analytics strategies aligned with organizational goals.
  • Utilize advanced data analytics tools such as Power BI to create insightful dashboards for effective visualization.

Travel

Your Profile

  • Proven experience as Data Analyst with a focus on Power BI usage.
  • Strong proficiency in Python for data cleaning, data visualization and analysis.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.

If you meet the requirements of this opportunity and would like to join an international group working to improve patients' lives, apply now!

4231818496,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/graduate-program-2025-data-science-analytics-at-nexi-group-4231818496?position=2&pageNum=7&refId=k4hSbUEjEHsw8dKwjEoj1A%3D%3D&trackingId=182LDYnX9y7j8o3RgczMwQ%3D%3D,Graduate Program 2025 - Data Science & Analytics,Nexi Group,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Are you looking to kick off your career journey?
Do you like the idea of joining the European PayTech?
If so, you are at the right place!

Our graduate program offers you the chance to create your unique career path within our diverse international team, operating in more than 25 countries. Rotate among different departments, learn from experienced professionals, and make a difference by working on real business cases.
Our Graduate Program is more than a learning path - it's a journey where you will work on real business cases and have a direct impact on business results.
Permanent position in one of the business departments from the start of your employment.
Two rotations between different business departments during the 12-month program.
Project Management and Communication training path after the first six months.
Continuous learning and skill improvement through structured training sessions at our Digital PayTech University.
Opportunity to develop business ideas, implement them, and build your network of stakeholders within a group of highly skilled business leaders from all over Europe.
Exciting Opportunities in Data Science and Analytics

As part of our Data Science and Analytics team, you will contribute to data-driven decision-making in the Paytech industry. You'll work in positions such as Data Scientist, Data Engineer, and BI Data Engineer.

In this department, you'll analyse large datasets, transform data into insights, develop predictive models, and create data visualisations to support business strategies. This role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge tools and technologies, enhancing your analytical skills and significantly impacting our company's success.

As part of our selection process, the top candidates will be invited to participate in an exciting hackathon at our office location. This is a fantastic opportunity to showcase your skills, collaborate with peers, and potentially secure a spot on our team. Stay tuned for more details!
What makes you stand out as the ideal participant for this program?
If you see yourself in the description that follows, you should definitely take the first step and apply!
You have a master's degree in Engineering, STEM or Economics & Business, graduated within the last 12 months or will graduate in 2025.
You are a career starter with no more than one year of working experience.
You are fluent in English and in the local language of the country you are applying for (any additional language is beneficial).

You can easily imagine working in an international environment and actively collaborating with colleagues from all over Europe (if you have study or work-related international experience from abroad, that will be considered a beneficial qualification).
You are committed to your work, have an exciting university career with proven great results, enjoy learning new things, feel confident to own projects by yourself and like being part of a team.
For you, formal training is a starting point - you always look for more and want to make a difference in everything you work on.
Don't miss out on this amazing opportunity. Apply today and discover what's in it for you!
We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong. By applying to our Graduate Program, you're one step closer to joining us.
We're excited to learn more about you!

Are you looking to kick off your career journey?

Do you like the idea of joining the European PayTech?


If so, you are at the right place!


Our graduate program offers you the chance to create your unique career path within our diverse international team, operating in more than 25 countries. Rotate among different departments, learn from experienced professionals, and make a difference by working on real business cases.


About the program

Our Graduate Program is more than a learning path - it's a journey where you will work on real business cases and have a direct impact on business results.


What can you expect?

  • Permanent position in one of the business departments from the start of your employment.
  • Two rotations between different business departments during the 12-month program.
  • Project Management and Communication training path after the first six months.
  • Continuous learning and skill improvement through structured training sessions at our Digital PayTech University.
  • Opportunity to develop business ideas, implement them, and build your network of stakeholders within a group of highly skilled business leaders from all over Europe.


Exciting Opportunities in Data Science and Analytics

As part of our Data Science and Analytics team, you will contribute to data-driven decision-making in the Paytech industry. You'll work in positions such as Data Scientist, Data Engineer, and BI Data Engineer.


In this department, you'll analyse large datasets, transform data into insights, develop predictive models, and create data visualisations to support business strategies. This role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge tools and technologies, enhancing your analytical skills and significantly impacting our company's success.


As part of our selection process, the top candidates will be invited to participate in an exciting hackathon at our office location. This is a fantastic opportunity to showcase your skills, collaborate with peers, and potentially secure a spot on our team. Stay tuned for more details!


What makes you stand out as the ideal participant for this program?

If you see yourself in the description that follows, you should definitely take the first step and apply!

  • You have a master's degree in Engineering, STEM or Economics &
column2:
Business, graduated within the last 12 months or will graduate in 2025.
  • You are a career starter with no more than one year of working experience.
  • You are fluent in English and in the local language of the country you are applying for (any additional language is beneficial).
  • You can easily imagine working in an international environment and actively collaborating with colleagues from all over Europe (if you have study or work-related international experience from abroad, that will be considered a beneficial qualification).
  • You are committed to your work, have an exciting university career with proven great results, enjoy learning new things, feel confident to own projects by yourself and like being part of a team.
  • For you, formal training is a starting point - you always look for more and want to make a difference in everything you work on.


    • Apply Now!

    Don't miss out on this amazing opportunity. Apply today and discover what's in it for you!


    We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong. By applying to our Graduate Program, you're one step closer to joining us.


    We're excited to learn more about you!
