4233711683,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-sas-power-bi-leading-insurance-company-at-hays-4233711683?position=3&pageNum=7&refId=k4hSbUEjEHsw8dKwjEoj1A%3D%3D&trackingId=JoGLiFCJtYefRLwcsnZ5fA%3D%3D,"Data Analyst (SaS, Power BI) | Leading Insurance Company",Hays,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","La tua nuova azienda
Il nostro cliente è il leader italiano nel settore assicurativo in ambito sanitario.
Grazie a +15 anni di esperienza e oltre 200 dipendenti, la realtà è ad oggi il partner di riferimento per ospedali, ambulatori e professionisti.
La società si distingue per la costruzione di soluzioni assicurative personalizzate che vengono affiancate a moderne e dettagliate tecniche di analisi dati e risk management.
All’interno della BU Market Analysis, stiamo ricercando un Data Analyst a diretto riporto dell'UW Lead.

Inserita in un processo di totale revisione dei tool di reportistica, la figura sarà responsabile della creazione di nuove dashboard e monitoraggio di quelle esistenti (linee di business, prodotti assicurativi, princing, rischio, etc.).
La risorsa collaborerà quindi con il team Underwriting (UW) e fungerà da punto di contatto con il team IT per tutte le tematiche correlate al mondo Data.
Si occuperà quindi della definizione delle necessità di business, estrapolazione e riconciliazione del dato, creazione della reportista e analisi degli insight.
Parallelamente, saranno inoltre necessarie attività di manutenzione periodica delle dashboard esistenti e di analisi ad hoc (nuovi clienti/progetti, mercato, etc.).
Di cosa hai bisogno per avere successo
Richiediamo almeno uno/due anni anno di esperienza in ruoli analoghi assieme ad un solido percorso accademico.
Ricerchiamo inoltre ottime competenze lato programmazione in SaS e gestione DB, oltre a buona padronanza di Power BI e R (o Python).
Salary package e inquadramento saranno funzione dell’esperienza effettiva e dei valori di partenza.
Sede di lavoro: Milano centro, con buona flessibilità lato smart working.
Se sei interessato a questa opportunità, clicca su ""Candidarsi ora"" per inviare una copia aggiornata del tuo CV.
Se questa opportunità non è in linea con le tue aspettative, ma sei alla ricerca di un nuovo lavoro, visita il nostro sito Internet per scoprirne di nuove.
I candidati di ambo i sessi, dopo aver visionato l'informativa obbligatoria sulla privacy sul sito www.hays.it, sono pregati di inviare il CV.
Hays S.r.l. Agenzia per il Lavoro Accreditata: Aut. Min. N. 13/I/0007145/03.04 del 1 Aprile 2008

4233952543,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/intern-research-data-intelligence-at-colliers-4233952543?position=4&pageNum=7&refId=k4hSbUEjEHsw8dKwjEoj1A%3D%3D&trackingId=uM%2B%2BpNzMWI96jzwtCvCUxg%3D%3D,Intern Research & Data Intelligence,Colliers,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Company Description

At Colliers, we help leaders succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses, and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas, and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.
BE creative. BE the expert. BE a team player. Be all that and more at Colliers International.

Colliers is a listed real estate advisor active in 66 countries with more than 18,000 employees. We contribute to a better society by solving real estate issues and accelerating the sustainability transition in the built environment. In 2025 we will be completely climate neutral.

We connect global market developments and data with the needs of property owners, property investors, and property tenants. This enables us to understand the sector of tomorrow and to provide forward-looking advice. These insights help us add value to all phases of the real estate cycle and build long-lasting customer relationships. We offer creative solutions that are not only attractive today, but also remain relevant and sustainable later on.
In Italy, we work with 170 professionals in an organization where entrepreneurship, expertise, and doing the right thing are important. Together we shape the future of real estate.
Is Data Intelligence & Research your passion? Do you feel ready to analyse the real estate market and macro-economic trends?

The resource in the Data Intelligence & Research Department will have a cross-team role. This is a resource with enthusiasm, a propensity for team working, strong analytical and communication skills, an aptitude for analysis and technology, and good language skills.
As the Intern Data Researcher you will be in charge of:
Cross-support all activities of the research team
Collecting and analysing property market data through the management of datasets
Develop market outputs through the production of market maps and reports
Supporting the data analytics teasm in the automation of database research
Degree in urban planning, economics, statistics, and similar disciplines.
Researching, collecting, reporting and detailing abilities
Native Italian speaker and proficient in English
Familiar with Office Package especially with Excel and Power Point
Availability to travel across the main Italian cities.

4224349918,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/oliver-wyman-%E2%80%93-data-analytics-analyst-senior-analyst-italy-at-oliver-wyman-4224349918?position=6&pageNum=7&refId=k4hSbUEjEHsw8dKwjEoj1A%3D%3D&trackingId=S4KZPgR%2FpJh2%2FQ7tPquMKw%3D%3D,Oliver Wyman – Data & Analytics - Analyst/Senior Analyst - Italy,Oliver Wyman,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Who We Are

Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Clients approach us with their most significant challenges, and we assemble teams of experts to address each facet of these complex issues. Together, we create breakthroughs that lead to remarkable impact.

Within Oliver Wyman, the Data and Analytics (DNA) division was established in 2017 and is operating across the entire world, with a focus on Europe. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing team of quantitative analytics specialists, collaborating closely with colleagues across the firm to cover a global footprint, working across multiple industries including, but not limited to, Financial Services, Climate & Sustainability, Energy, Retail, and Transportation.

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.

As a member of Oliver Wyman’s Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with colleagues and clients at all levels from your very first day, helping clients solve their most pressing challenges. Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas. Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.
Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles – click here for more information
Modelling portfolio decarbonization strategies leveraging advanced analytics techniques for large European banks
Optimizing and developing a promotional program using data from historical promotions for an Asian health & beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkit
Validating a customer-facing GenAI chatbot for an American bank
Developing probability of default and loss models in Python for European and UK-based banks
Identifying supply chain risks by combining multiple live data feeds, and developing and applying a bespoke AI based risk methodology – click here for more information
Developing a next best action model to reduce customer churn for a global telecom company

Expect a steep learning curve, as no two projects are ever the same. You’ll have the opportunity to travel internationally, gaining invaluable experiences and insights across different cultures and with access to the latest technologies, you’ll constantly expand your toolkit with each new endeavor.
You won’t be alone on this journey
column2: various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. You’ll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.

column1: This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If you’re excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!
Bachelor's, Master’s, or PhD in a quantitative discipline from a top academic program (Data Science, Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Data-driven mindset and proficiency with numbers, paired with the ability to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner to clients and colleagues
Ideally, programming skills in Python or R, but more importantly, an eagerness to continuously extend your knowledge of technologies
Strong commitment to teamwork and resilience in a creative and constantly changing environment
Excellent command of the English and Italian language (verbal and written)
Interest and experience in financial services and risk management is a plus

Please submit your CV, cover letter and transcripts. If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website or alternatively, apply to attend one of our events, details of which can be found here.​
What to expect during the interviews process?
At Oliver Wyman, we want you to shine in your interview. Our process is designed like our work environment — it’s challenging, exciting, and fun.

With a mix of conversational and case and technical interviews, our approach not only helps us to get to know you better, understanding your strengths and interests, but it also enables you to learn more about our people and our business.
If you want to learn more about consulting interviews and start your preparation, please visit our careers page: https://www.oliverwyman.com/careers/entry-level/interview-preparation.html

Who We Are

Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Clients approach us with their most significant challenges, and we assemble teams of experts to address each facet of these complex issues. Together, we create breakthroughs that lead to remarkable impact.

Within Oliver Wyman, the Data and Analytics (DNA) division was established in 2017 and is operating across the entire world, with a focus on Europe. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing team of quantitative analytics specialists, collaborating closely with colleagues across the firm to cover a global footprint, working across multiple industries including, but not limited to, Financial Services, Climate &
column2:
Sustainability, Energy, Retail, and Transportation.

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.


What You Will Do


As a member of Oliver Wyman’s Data &
column3:
Analytics team, you will collaborate with colleagues and clients at all levels from your very first day, helping clients solve their most pressing challenges. Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas. Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.

Notable projects include:

  • Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles – click here for more information
  • Modelling portfolio decarbonization strategies leveraging advanced analytics techniques for large European banks
  • Optimizing and developing a promotional program using data from historical promotions for an Asian health &
column4:
beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkit
  • Validating a customer-facing GenAI chatbot for an American bank
  • Developing probability of default and loss models in Python for European and UK-based banks
  • Identifying supply chain risks by combining multiple live data feeds, and developing and applying a bespoke AI based risk methodology – click here for more information
  • Developing a next best action model to reduce customer churn for a global telecom company


    • Why Join Us?


    Expect a steep learning curve, as no two projects are ever the same. You’ll have the opportunity to travel internationally, gaining invaluable experiences and insights across different cultures and with access to the latest technologies, you’ll constantly expand your toolkit with each new endeavor.

    You won’t be alone on this journey
column5:
various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. You’ll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.

This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If you’re excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!


Who Can Apply?

  • Bachelor's, Master’s, or PhD in a quantitative discipline from a top academic program (Data Science, Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
  • Data-driven mindset and proficiency with numbers, paired with the ability to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner to clients and colleagues
  • Ideally, programming skills in Python or R, but more importantly, an eagerness to continuously extend your knowledge of technologies
  • Strong commitment to teamwork and resilience in a creative and constantly changing environment
  • Excellent command of the English and Italian language (verbal and written)
  • Interest and experience in financial services and risk management is a plus


How to Apply?

Please submit your CV, cover letter and transcripts. If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website or alternatively, apply to attend one of our events, details of which can be found here.​


What to expect during the interviews process?

At Oliver Wyman, we want you to shine in your interview. Our process is designed like our work environment — it’s challenging, exciting, and fun.


With a mix of conversational and case and technical interviews, our approach not only helps us to get to know you better, understanding your strengths and interests, but it also enables you to learn more about our people and our business.

If you want to learn more about consulting interviews and start your preparation, please visit our careers page: https://www.oliverwyman.com/careers/entry-level/interview-preparation.html

Potrai entrare a far parte di una global energy tech company impegnata a raggiungere la neutralità carbonica entro il 2050, che punta sulle competenze e sulla crescita delle persone investendo risorse nella ricerca di soluzioni tecnologiche innovative .

Come Junior Data Engineer, farai parte di Plenitude Società Benefit. In particolare, all’interno del tuo team Data Engineering & Data Platform collaborerai con gli altri esperti del mondo dati (Data Scientist, Data Analyst, BI Expert) per costruire team multifunzionali, al fine di creare business value dai dati, lavorando alla diffusione in azienda dell’utilizzo dei dati, degli analytics e dei data products.
Integrazione dei nuovi flussi dati all’interno delle piattaforme dati esistenti
Fornire supporto al disegno dei data model e sviluppare data product comprendendo perimetri, dimensionamenti e ottimizzazioni
Applicare le best practice e le direttive per rispettare i requisiti di sicurezza e compliance definite in azienda.
Conoscenza di almeno un linguaggio di programmazione tra: python, scala e java (python requisito preferenziale).
Gradita la conoscenza di devops/dataops: git, testing automation, ci/cd, shell-scripting.
Gradita la conoscenza di databricks e pyspark.
Gradita la conoscenza di almeno una delle piattaforme cloud principali: azure, aws, gcp (Azure requisito preferenziale).
Gradita la conoscenza di base dei principali principi di modellizzazione e approccio al dato (dwh, datavault, 3nr, star schema, snowflake, data/delta lake, data mesh, etc.).
Promuoviamo forme flessibili di lavoro, offrendo opzioni di Smart working ed orari flessibili al fine di sostenere il maggior equilibrio tra vita professionale e personale.
Contratto di lavoro a Tempo Indeterminato / Apprendistato professionalizzante – in base all’esperienza maturata

column1: Sistema di reward e programma articolato di benefits ed iniziative di welfare. Scopri di più: link welfare
Ambiente di lavoro in cui ognuno possa sentirsi riconosciuto e apprezzato nella propria unicità
I candidati ritenuti di maggior interesse saranno contattati per le fasi successive.
Per informazioni sul processo di selezione e consigli utili puoi cliccare qui .

Plenitude Società Benefit , società controllata da Eni, è presente sul mercato con un modello di business distintivo che integra la produzione da rinnovabili, la vendita di energia e le soluzioni energetiche e un’ampia rete di punti di ricarica per veicoli elettrici.

Fornisce energia a 10 milioni di clienti europei nel mercato retail con l’obiettivo di raggiungere 11,5 milioni di clienti entro il 2027. La Società ha l’obiettivo di raggiungere oltre 8 GW di capacità rinnovabile installata al 2027 e oltre 15 GW al 2030. Nel settore della mobilità elettrica possiede una rete di migliaia di punti di ricarica che sarà ampliata sia in Italia che in Europa con l’obiettivo di raggiungere 40.000 punti entro il 2027. Inoltre, è leader in Italia nella generazione distribuita da impianti fotovoltaici di piccola taglia.

Plenitude è una Società Benefit, che integra, all’interno del proprio Statuto, l’obiettivo di avere un impatto positivo sulle persone, le comunità e l’ambiente e si inquadra nel più ampio impegno di Eni volto a creare valore attraverso la transizione energetica. Presente in diversi Paesi del mondo, Plenitude ha l’obiettivo di azzerare le emissioni nette di CO2 Scope1, 2 e 3 entro il 2040 e grazie a una proposta integrata e diversificata, di fornire energia decarbonizzata a tutti i clienti.

Job Description

Cosa vuoi fare DI grande?

Potrai entrare a far parte di una global energy tech company impegnata a raggiungere la neutralità carbonica entro il 2050, che punta sulle competenze e sulla crescita delle persone investendo risorse nella ricerca di soluzioni tecnologiche innovative .

Immagina Il Tuo Lavoro

Come Junior Data Engineer, farai parte di Plenitude Società Benefit. In particolare, all’interno del tuo team Data Engineering &
column2:
Data Platform collaborerai con gli altri esperti del mondo dati (Data Scientist, Data Analyst, BI Expert) per costruire team multifunzionali, al fine di creare business value dai dati, lavorando alla diffusione in azienda dell’utilizzo dei dati, degli analytics e dei data products.

Attività Principali

• Applicare le best practice e le direttive per rispettare i requisiti di sicurezza e compliance definite in azienda.

    • Caratteristiche Richieste

    • Laurea magistrale in ambito STEM.
    • Massimo 3 anni di esperienza nell’ambito.
    • Conoscenza di almeno un linguaggio di programmazione tra: python, scala e java (python requisito preferenziale).
    • Buona conoscenza del linguaggio SQL.
    • Buona padronanza della lingua inglese.

    • Gradita la conoscenza di devops/dataops: git, testing automation, ci/cd, shell-scripting.
    • Gradita la conoscenza di databricks e pyspark.
    • Gradita la conoscenza di almeno una delle piattaforme cloud principali: azure, aws, gcp (Azure requisito preferenziale).
    • Gradita la conoscenza di base dei principali principi di modellizzazione e approccio al dato (dwh, datavault, 3nr, star schema, snowflake, data/delta lake, data mesh, etc.).

    Milano

4194918664,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-data-analyst-at-unilever-4194918664?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=Sg8Rb9JPeAvuLN38pTlcfg%3D%3D,Internship Data Analyst,Unilever,"Anderlecht, Brussels Region, Belgium","Internship Data & Analytics
Looking for a challenging internship in the Data & Analytics team, starting in July, August or September 2025? It’s time to apply!

At Unilever, we share one simple purpose: To make sustainable living commonplace. Through our powerhouse brands such as Dove, Axe and Lipton, we are creating a bright future for our business and our planet – and you can be part of it!

We believe that companies with purpose last, people with purpose thrive and brands with purpose grow.  We meet every day needs for nutrition, hygiene and personal care with brands that help people feel good, look good and get more out of life.

When joining Unilever in Belgium, you will get the opportunity to have an impact on a leading-edge company and our outstanding brands. During this internship you will get real responsibilities that will provide you with a good insight into the organisation and support your personal development.

Our Data & Analytics team ensures that Unilever makes data-driven decisions to optimize product availability, supply chain efficiency, and consumer insights across global markets. During this internship, you will gain a deep understanding of how advanced analytics supports business operations, identify market trends through data, and learn how to transform raw information into actionable strategies that drive product success in a fast-paced consumer goods environment
Your Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities Could Be (amongst Others)
Collecting and cleaning up data to ensure quality is up to standard
Thinking collectively on how to present the analysis best towards our business colleagues and external stakeholders

You must be enrolled as a Bachelor or Master student from a University, Business School or equivalent during the entire internship. Your studies must have an analytic component. For example: courses on Statistics, Market Assessment, Marketing research or Marketing intelligence.
You are available for a minimum of 3 months and ideally for 6 months (37 hours a week).
You are fluent in English + Dutch or French.
You are a team player with a strong sense of responsibility.
You are a self-starter, able to work autonomously.
You are a pro-active and dynamic person, able to anticipate the needs of your team.
You are curious, eager to learn new things and to explore new ideas and approaches to solving challenges.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills and feel comfortable with data analysis.
You are able to work with a diversity of people and teams.
You are familiar with MS office tools in particular Excel.
Experience with Power BI / Tableau is a big plus!
You can successfully identify all Unilever iced tea products while blindfolded in a taste test (we won't actually test this, but impressive if true!)
An outstanding chance to bring our unique purpose to life!
An opportunity to take a look behind the scenes at one of the biggest FMCG-corporations in the world.
An opportunity to learn from a variety of concrete projects.
A wealth of experience, where you will be at the heart of the business.
Lots of responsibility, but also good guidance during your internship.
To apply, please send your CV and a motivation letter where your preferred internship topics, internship duration and ideal start date are highlighted.
We look forward to meeting you!

Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

Looking for a challenging internship in the Data &
column3:
Analytics team, starting in July, August or September 2025? It’s time to apply! 

Who are we?

 

At Unilever, we share one simple purpose: To make sustainable living commonplace. Through our powerhouse brands such as Dove, Axe and Lipton, we are creating a bright future for our business and our planet – and you can be part of it!

 

We believe that companies with purpose last, people with purpose thrive and brands with purpose grow.  We meet every day needs for nutrition, hygiene and personal care with brands that help people feel good, look good and get more out of life.

 

Main Purpose Of The Internship

 

When joining Unilever in Belgium, you will get the opportunity to have an impact on a leading-edge company and our outstanding brands. During this internship you will get real responsibilities that will provide you with a good insight into the organisation and support your personal development.

Our Data &
column4:
Analytics team ensures that Unilever makes data-driven decisions to optimize product availability, supply chain efficiency, and consumer insights across global markets. During this internship, you will gain a deep understanding of how advanced analytics supports business operations, identify market trends through data, and learn how to transform raw information into actionable strategies that drive product success in a fast-paced consumer goods environment

 

Your Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities Could Be (amongst Others)

 

  • Market data analysis
  • Promotional follow-up and analysis
  • Collecting and cleaning up data to ensure quality is up to standard
  • Thinking collectively on how to present the analysis best towards our business colleagues and external stakeholders
  • Update &
column5:
creation of new reports

 

 

What We Ask

 

  • You must be enrolled as a Bachelor or Master student from a University, Business School or equivalent during the entire internship. Your studies must have an analytic component. For example: courses on Statistics, Market Assessment, Marketing research or Marketing intelligence.
  • You are available for a minimum of 3 months and ideally for 6 months (37 hours a week).
  • You are fluent in English + Dutch or French.
  • You are a team player with a strong sense of responsibility.
  • You are a self-starter, able to work autonomously.
  • You are a pro-active and dynamic person, able to anticipate the needs of your team.
  • You are curious, eager to learn new things and to explore new ideas and approaches to solving challenges.
  • You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills and feel comfortable with data analysis.
  • You are able to work with a diversity of people and teams.
  • You are familiar with MS office tools in particular Excel.
  • Experience with Power BI / Tableau is a big plus!
  • You can successfully identify all Unilever iced tea products while blindfolded in a taste test (we won't actually test this, but impressive if true!)

 

 

What We Offer

 

  • An outstanding chance to bring our unique purpose to life!
  • An opportunity to take a look behind the scenes at one of the biggest FMCG-corporations in the world.
  • An opportunity to learn from a variety of concrete projects.
  • A wealth of experience, where you will be at the heart of the business.
  • Lots of responsibility, but also good guidance during your internship.

 

 

EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE?

 

To apply, please send your CV and a motivation letter where your preferred internship topics, internship duration and ideal start date are highlighted.

 

We look forward to meeting you! 

Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

4233042425,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-decathlon-4233042425?position=2&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=S%2FWYu0ngReA%2BIUHV%2FWCuaA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Decathlon,"Evere, Brussels Region, Belgium","Decathlon is accelerating its digital transformation with the mission of becoming the digital sports platform that allows customers to discover our world through a wide range of sports-centric experiences.
To strengthen our team in Belgium we are looking for a Data Analyst who will work within an enthusiastic, ambitious and welcoming Data & AI team.
As a Data Analyst at Decathlon, you will work closely with the marketing, e-commerce and digital teams to provide strategic insights that will drive business decisions and optimize results.
Intuit, collect and challenge analytical needs.
Precisely understand business issues and translate them analytically.
Collect the gain/value estimate and challenge the relevance of each subject to be addressed.
Prevent and identify risks, biases, incompleteness of the analysis.
Formulate hypotheses and propose reasoning validating or invalidating these hypotheses.
Create new indicators/tables adapted to the subject.
Return results in a graphic form allowing the business to explore the answer.
Return analyses with clarity and transparency:
Synthesize information to make them accessible.
Present the results of the analyses in the form of data visualizations used by the business/requester.
Suggest and support the implementation of recommendations.
Document, share your work with your peers to make it reusable, replicable, adaptable.

As Data Analyst, you are rigorous, with a sense of organization and the ability to self-motivate and work independently. You are open and communicative, and have the ability to synthesize and create reports. You are proactive in making recommendations and hypotheses.
a bachelor or master degree in engineering, informatics or statistics with a specialization in data engineering, big data or data science.
at least 3 years' experience in a data analyst position. You're passionate about digital and have an analytical mind and a real appetite for numbers.
the knowledge in most common programming languages for data analysis (SQL, Python, SAS).
the proficiency in at least one dashboarding tool (Tableau, Google Data Studio / Looker Studio, Power BI etc...).
An experience with at least one of the main Cloud Environments (GCP, AWS, Azure).
Language : fluency in French and have a B2 level of English, important in the international context of this role. A basic knowledge of Dutch would be a plus.
the knowledge of AB testing strategy and logic
an experience with DataBricks and also a transformation tool like DBT.

Decathlon is accelerating its digital transformation with the mission of becoming the digital sports platform that allows customers to discover our world through a wide range of sports-centric experiences.


To strengthen our team in Belgium we are looking for a Data Analyst who will work within an enthusiastic, ambitious and welcoming Data &
column2:
AI team.


As a Data Analyst at Decathlon, you will work closely with the marketing, e-commerce and digital teams to provide strategic insights that will drive business decisions and optimize results.


Your main responsibilities will be :

Identification of business analytical problems:

  • Intuit, collect and challenge analytical needs.
  • Precisely understand business issues and translate them analytically.
  • Collect the gain/value estimate and challenge the relevance of each subject to be addressed.

Implement a rigorous exploratory approach:

  • Identify relevant data sources available.
  • Prevent and identify risks, biases, incompleteness of the analysis.
  • Formulate hypotheses and propose reasoning validating or invalidating these hypotheses.

Solve analytical problems:

  • Extract then transform the data.
  • Create new indicators/tables adapted to the subject.
  • Return results in a graphic form allowing the business to explore the answer.

Return analyses with clarity and transparency:

  • Synthesize information to make them accessible.
  • Present the results of the analyses in the form of data visualizations used by the business/requester.
  • Suggest and support the implementation of recommendations.
  • Document, share your work with your peers to make it reusable, replicable, adaptable.


Your profile

As Data Analyst, you are rigorous, with a sense of organization and the ability to self-motivate and work independently. You are open and communicative, and have the ability to synthesize and create reports. You are proactive in making recommendations and hypotheses.


You have also :

  • a bachelor or master degree in engineering, informatics or statistics with a specialization in data engineering, big data or data science.
  • at least 3 years' experience in a data analyst position. You're passionate about digital and have an analytical mind and a real appetite for numbers.
  • the knowledge in most common programming languages for data analysis (SQL, Python, SAS).
  • the proficiency in at least one dashboarding tool (Tableau, Google Data Studio / Looker Studio, Power BI etc...).
  • An experience with at least one of the main Cloud Environments (GCP, AWS, Azure).
  • Language : fluency in French and have a B2 level of English, important in the international context of this role. A basic knowledge of Dutch would be a plus.


And a plus would be :

  • the knowledge of AB testing strategy and logic
  • an experience with DataBricks and also a transformation tool like DBT.


Ready to join us ?

4219190752,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-cleeven-4219190752?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=uOW2C9bB1FDZeEtk%2Bml3bA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,CLEEVEN,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"!Join a Dynamic and Exciting Team at Cleeven!

Are you ready to be part of a fast-growing, ambitious company where innovation meets impact? Do you want to take part in cutting-edge data projects and accelerate your career in a collaborative, energetic environment?
At Cleeven, we believe that your growth drives our success. Join us and become a key player in projects that matter — in a company that invests in your development every step of the way.
Cleeven is an international engineering consulting firm built on two core principles:
OUR MISSION: To enhance self-awareness and the awareness of those around us.
OUR BELIEF: The excellence of European engineers and data professionals should power Europe’s leadership in technology and innovation.
We work hand-in-hand with our clients to deliver data-driven insights, cutting-edge technologies, and sustainable performance improvements.
YOUR ROLE AS A DATA ANALYST

As a Data Analyst at Cleeven, you will contribute to high-impact data initiatives across financial and industrial sectors. You’ll play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights. Your responsibilities will include:
Requirement analysis: Understand and synthesize functional and technical needs.
Data asset analysis: Evaluate available datasets, identify gaps, and define data strategies.
Statistical modeling: Define models (PCA, logistic regression, random forest, etc.) tailored to business challenges.
Data sourcing: Collect, structure, and consolidate data from various internal and external sources.
Tool implementation: Work with tools and languages such as R, Python, SAS, SPSS to implement models.
Performance optimization: Fine-tune algorithms for accuracy and efficiency.
Result interpretation: Present findings in a clear, actionable manner for stakeholders.
Tech watch: Stay current on Big Data, machine learning, and statistical innovation.
Solution qualification: Participate in validating data-driven solutions for production deployment.
You’re curious, analytical, and solution-oriented — and ready to put data at the heart of decision-making.
Master’s degree in a relevant field
Fluent in English + Dutch and/or French (trilingual is a major asset)
Experience with data tools such as Python, R, SQL, SAS, Power BI, Tableau...
Familiar with statistical methods and machine learning fundamentals
Autonomous, adaptable, and a collaborative team player
A first experience in the financial sector is a plus
Your journey at Cleeven is more than a project — it’s a path to your potential. Here’s how we support you:
Cleeven Coaching Program: Optional one-on-one coaching tailored to your development goals
Monthly Project Follow-Ups: Regular discussions with your manager to track progress and provide support
Boost Your Skills: Bi-monthly expert sessions to build your technical and analytical skills
Social Events: From networking evenings to off-site gatherings, we foster connection and community
With Cleeven, become who you are!""

!Join a Dynamic and Exciting Team at Cleeven!


Are you ready to be part of a fast-growing, ambitious company where innovation meets impact? Do you want to take part in cutting-edge data projects and accelerate your career in a collaborative, energetic environment?


At Cleeven, we believe that your growth drives our success. Join us and become a key player in projects that matter — in a company that invests in your development every step of the way.


WHO ARE WE ?


Cleeven is an international engineering consulting firm built on two core principles:

  • OUR MISSION: To enhance self-awareness and the awareness of those around us.
  • OUR BELIEF: The excellence of European engineers and data professionals should power Europe’s leadership in technology and innovation.


We work hand-in-hand with our clients to deliver data-driven insights, cutting-edge technologies, and sustainable performance improvements.


YOUR ROLE AS A DATA ANALYST


As a Data Analyst at Cleeven, you will contribute to high-impact data initiatives across financial and industrial sectors. You’ll play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Requirement analysis: Understand and synthesize functional and technical needs.
  • Data asset analysis: Evaluate available datasets, identify gaps, and define data strategies.
  • Statistical modeling: Define models (PCA, logistic regression, random forest, etc.) tailored to business challenges.
  • Data sourcing: Collect, structure, and consolidate data from various internal and external sources.
  • Tool implementation: Work with tools and languages such as R, Python, SAS, SPSS to implement models.
  • Performance optimization: Fine-tune algorithms for accuracy and efficiency.
  • Result interpretation: Present findings in a clear, actionable manner for stakeholders.
  • Tech watch: Stay current on Big Data, machine learning, and statistical innovation.
  • Solution qualification: Participate in validating data-driven solutions for production deployment.


WHO YOU ARE


You’re curious, analytical, and solution-oriented — and ready to put data at the heart of decision-making.

Your ideal profile:

  • Master’s degree in a relevant field
  • Fluent in English + Dutch and/or French (trilingual is a major asset)
  • Experience with data tools such as Python, R, SQL, SAS, Power BI, Tableau...
  • Familiar with statistical methods and machine learning fundamentals
  • Autonomous, adaptable, and a collaborative team player
  • A first experience in the financial sector is a plus


WHAT’S HAPPENING AT CLEEVEN?


Your journey at Cleeven is more than a project — it’s a path to your potential. Here’s how we support you:

  • Cleeven Coaching Program: Optional one-on-one coaching tailored to your development goals
  • Monthly Project Follow-Ups: Regular discussions with your manager to track progress and provide support
  • Boost Your Skills: Bi-monthly expert sessions to build your technical and analytical skills
  • Social Events: From networking evenings to off-site gatherings, we foster connection and community


""With Cleeven, become who you are!""

WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.

In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data
HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:
You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis

You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You are fluent in French and English

4234245670,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-at-recurv-4234245670?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=F3WPWfk9Q7ONhWHoQCNdPg%3D%3D,Business Data Analyst,recurv,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"FREELANCE: Data-Expert met business skills

Are you a meticulous individual passionate about ensuring data quality and governance? Do you have an affinity for shaping the way information is managed and presented in today's dynamic business landscape? If the challenge of streamlining and refining both structured and unstructured data resonates with you, then our Data Steward role might just be the opportunity you're looking for!

Our client is embarking on a mission to harness the power of information. We're on the lookout for a dedicated Data Steward to steer this initiative, ensuring structured and unstructured data remains accurate, relevant, and consistent. This position goes beyond mere oversight
column2: it involves a diverse range of responsibilities, from resolving information incidents to setting quality benchmarks, thereby integrating you with various departments across the organization.

column1: A unique opportunity to deepen your skills in information management and governance
Thrive in a role that places you at the heart of data quality and lifecycle processes
Establish a significant and enduring impact within a large corporate
Enjoy the flexibility of 2 remote work days per week
Champion information governance and be a pivotal voice in crucial councils
Efficiently address and rectify information incidents, upholding supreme quality standards
Dictate the rhythm of the information lifecycle, from its inception to its eventual archiving
Collaborate with a variety of stakeholders, imparting knowledge on information-centric best practices
Authenticate the integrity of the information model, managing inquiries and validations
Cultivate and enhance the internal information ecosystem
Solid experience in information management or a role of similar nature
An analytical prowess complemented by effective problem-solving skills
Proficiency in understanding information classification, its lifecycle, and overarching governance
Strong communication abilities, both in written and spoken forms, in Dutch and English
A genuine passion for continuous improvement and learning
An academic background in Information Management, Data Science, or related fields
Acquaintance with contemporary data tools and applications
This role is open to both freelancers and people seeking a role as a consultant on recurv's payroll. If this role excites you, don't hesitate – apply or connect with us!

FREELANCE: Data-Expert met business skills


Are you a meticulous individual passionate about ensuring data quality and governance? Do you have an affinity for shaping the way information is managed and presented in today's dynamic business landscape? If the challenge of streamlining and refining both structured and unstructured data resonates with you, then our Data Steward role might just be the opportunity you're looking for!


Our client is embarking on a mission to harness the power of information. We're on the lookout for a dedicated Data Steward to steer this initiative, ensuring structured and unstructured data remains accurate, relevant, and consistent. This position goes beyond mere oversight
column2:
it involves a diverse range of responsibilities, from resolving information incidents to setting quality benchmarks, thereby integrating you with various departments across the organization.


What's in it for you?

  • A unique opportunity to deepen your skills in information management and governance
  • Thrive in a role that places you at the heart of data quality and lifecycle processes
  • Establish a significant and enduring impact within a large corporate
  • Enjoy the flexibility of 2 remote work days per week
  • Long-term contract and assignment


What you'll do

  • Champion information governance and be a pivotal voice in crucial councils
  • Efficiently address and rectify information incidents, upholding supreme quality standards
  • Dictate the rhythm of the information lifecycle, from its inception to its eventual archiving
  • Collaborate with a variety of stakeholders, imparting knowledge on information-centric best practices
  • Authenticate the integrity of the information model, managing inquiries and validations
  • Cultivate and enhance the internal information ecosystem


Who you are

Must-haves:

  • Solid experience in information management or a role of similar nature
  • An analytical prowess complemented by effective problem-solving skills
  • Proficiency in understanding information classification, its lifecycle, and overarching governance
  • Strong communication abilities, both in written and spoken forms, in Dutch and English
  • A genuine passion for continuous improvement and learning


Nice-to-haves:

  • An academic background in Information Management, Data Science, or related fields
  • Acquaintance with contemporary data tools and applications



This role is open to both freelancers and people seeking a role as a consultant on recurv's payroll. If this role excites you, don't hesitate – apply or connect with us!


Questions? Contact:

📩 buna@recurv.be

ALTEN is a world leader in engineering and technology consulting, with over 57 000 employees in more than 30 countries. We support major companies in their innovation, R&D, and digital transformation projects across sectors such as automotive, aerospace, energy, finance, life sciences, and telecommunications.

Present in Belgium for over 25 years, ALTEN Belgium operates from its offices in Brussels and Antwerp. Today, with a team of 700 consultants ALTEN Belgium offers a wide range of expertise across Engineering, Life Sciences, and IT fields. From Automotive to Railway, and Medtech to Agrifood, our experts deploy their knowledge to provide innovative solutions in a dynamic and forward-thinking environment.
Apply now and take part in innovative and impactful projects at ALTEN Belgium!

Job Title

Data Analyst / Dataiku – ALTEN Belgium


About the Role

As part of our ongoing growth, we are looking for a Data Analyst to join our teams and work on client projects located in Antwerp.

  • Design, build, and automate data workflows and analytics pipelines using Dataiku (DSS).​
  • Support internal teams and citizen data scientists in effective Dataiku utilization.​
  • Promote best practices in workflow structure, code quality, and governance.​
  • Manage and enhance our AWS-hosted Dataiku platform.​
  • Develop and maintain automation pipelines, integrations, and reusable components.​
  • Monitor and refine platform usability and performance.​
  • Collaborate with cloud, infrastructure, MLOps, and data governance teams.​
  • Assist in deploying ML pipelines into production alongside data science teams.​
  • Work with support teams to resolve issues and improve user experience.​
  • Create comprehensive guides, documentation, and tutorials.​
  • Contribute to the development of an internal knowledge base on analytics and Dataiku usage.

​

Your Profile

  • 3+ years in data science, analytics, or data platform roles.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.​
  • Hands-on experience with Dataiku DSS.
  • Proficient in Python, with working knowledge of Git and Terraform.
  • Good understanding of AWS infrastructure and cloud deployments.
  • Comfortable with automation, platform monitoring, and support.
  • Experience with MLOps, DevOps, or ML pipeline deployment.
  • Familiarity with platform governance and performance tuning.
  • Exposure to enterprise data environments and integration work.
  • Clear communicator across technical and non-technical teams.
  • Problem-solver with a proactive mindset.
  • Team player with a drive to learn and improve.


Working Conditions

  • Permanent contract with an attractive salary package
  • Company car with fuel card
  • Representation fees
  • Meal vouchers
  • Mobile phone subscription
  • Group insurance &
column2:
healthcare insurance
  • Possibility of remote work
  • 20 legal vacation days + 12 compensatory days

We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst Consultant to work within the Program Management Life Department of one of our blue chip client in insurance industry. This team is crucial for managing projects and tools that enhance the efficiency of operational activities. A key challenge they face is effectively managing and representing increasing volumes of data.

The cconsultant will support a newly launched workflow tool that requires expertise in Power BI to gather and visualize the necessary information for Operations teams. The role will involve several upcoming projects where data collection, analysis, and the presentation of insights will be essential for maintaining focus and driving performance.

Collaboration with Operations departments and IT colleagues is vital, as reconciling diverse interests will be a significant aspect of the role. We are looking for a Data Analyst and Power BI expert who will translate operational data into analytical models, elevate the data skills of team members, and play a pivotal role in conceptualizing data architecture.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand data needs and provide tailored solutions.
Gather, analyze, and interpret complex data sets to deliver actionable insights.
Develop and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports to visualize data and support informed decision-making.
Ensure data quality and integrity through regular verifications and validation processes.
Propose and implement initiatives to enhance awareness of data analytics within the department.
Identify and implement analytics models based on operational data.
Support and mentor one or two colleagues in the Process & Organisation team.
Assist in establishing the conceptual architecture for data management.
Apply AI solutions to improve the creation of sophisticated and insightful Power BI dashboards.
Ability to work independently and meet tight deadlines
Awareness of technological trends in the BI field
Senior profile with concrete experience in data analysis and Power BI
Deep understanding of data analytics and visualization techniques
Experience in the insurance or financial industry
Mastery of Power BI, including advanced features like Power Query and DAX
Experience with time series modeling (e.g., ARIMA) in Power BI
Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or Business), with an emphasis on data analysis.
Native-level proficiency in Dutch and French, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Being part of a dynamic, energetic, and opportunity-filled company
Gaining valuable professional experience within a fast-growing company
Continuous learning, with extensive training in both technical and soft skills
A workplace where everyone feels respected, valued, and free to be themselves
An attractive salary and benefits package

Morrison Finance is a European-based leading consultancy company. We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst Consultant to work within the Program Management Life Department of one of our blue chip client in insurance industry. This team is crucial for managing projects and tools that enhance the efficiency of operational activities. A key challenge they face is effectively managing and representing increasing volumes of data.

The cconsultant will support a newly launched workflow tool that requires expertise in Power BI to gather and visualize the necessary information for Operations teams. The role will involve several upcoming projects where data collection, analysis, and the presentation of insights will be essential for maintaining focus and driving performance.

Collaboration with Operations departments and IT colleagues is vital, as reconciling diverse interests will be a significant aspect of the role. We are looking for a Data Analyst and Power BI expert who will translate operational data into analytical models, elevate the data skills of team members, and play a pivotal role in conceptualizing data architecture.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand data needs and provide tailored solutions.
  • Gather, analyze, and interpret complex data sets to deliver actionable insights.
  • Develop and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports to visualize data and support informed decision-making.
  • Ensure data quality and integrity through regular verifications and validation processes.
  • Propose and implement initiatives to enhance awareness of data analytics within the department.
  • Identify and implement analytics models based on operational data.
  • Support and mentor one or two colleagues in the Process &
column2:
Organisation team.
  • Assist in establishing the conceptual architecture for data management.
  • Apply AI solutions to improve the creation of sophisticated and insightful Power BI dashboards.


    • Required Knowledge and Experience


    Personal Skills (Soft Skills):

    • Structured, conscientious, and flexible
    • Hands-on approach
    • Excellent communication skills
    • Team player
    • Critical and analytical thinking
    • Ability to work independently and meet tight deadlines
    • Strong documentation skills
    • Awareness of technological trends in the BI field


    Business Experience Required :

    • Senior profile with concrete experience in data analysis and Power BI
    • Deep understanding of data analytics and visualization techniques
    • Experience in the insurance or financial industry


    Technical Experience Required:

    • Proficiency in MS Office 365
    • Mastery of Power BI, including advanced features like Power Query and DAX
    • Data analysis and modeling skills
    • Expertise in data visualization techniques

    Preferable:

    • Knowledge of Python
    • Familiarity with Copilot M365
    • Experience with time series modeling (e.g., ARIMA) in Power BI
    • Understanding of Azure Cognitive Services


    Level of Education

    Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or Business), with an emphasis on data analysis.


    Language Requirement

    • Native-level proficiency in Dutch and French, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
    • Fluent in English


    What We Offer:

    • Being part of a dynamic, energetic, and opportunity-filled company
    • Gaining valuable professional experience within a fast-growing company
    • Continuous learning, with extensive training in both technical and soft skills
    • A workplace where everyone feels respected, valued, and free to be themselves
    • Inspiring and supportive colleagues
    • Forward-looking, highly accessible leadership
    • A flexible work schedule
    • An attractive salary and benefits package

4230592199,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-zartis-4230592199?position=8&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=d4YwVdw0xlM5jb%2BK%2FBBeRw%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Zartis,European Union,"The company and our mission:
Zartis is a digital solutions provider working across technology strategy, software engineering, and product development.

We partner with firms across financial services, MedTech, media, logistics technology, renewable energy, EdTech, e-commerce, and more. Our engineering hubs in EMEA and LATAM are full of talented professionals delivering business success and digital improvement across application development, software architecture, CI/CD, business intelligence, QA automation, and new technology integrations.
We are looking for a Data Analyst to work on a project in the home energy optimization industry.

Our teammates are talented people that come from a variety of backgrounds. We’re committed to building an inclusive culture based on trust and innovation which creates a good work environment that helps enrich the product.
You will be part of a distributed team developing new technologies to solve real business problems.

Our client is a climate-tech startup on a mission to make rooftop solar more effective and affordable building a platform that optimizes home energy storage using real-time data and machine learning to reduce carbon emissions lower costs and make solar accessible to more households recently closed its seed round and rolling out to early users offering a remote-first setup with flexibility a small and ambitious team where early hires have real ownership and impact.
We are looking for someone proactive with strong communication skills and attention to detail, motivated by climate impact and data-driven solutions.
We're looking for a Data Analyst to join our client’s founding team and take a leading role in how we manage, interpret, and leverage data across our client’s platform.

You'll work closely with engineering, product, and leadership to monitor and refine our optimisation models, deliver insights to enhance customer outcomes, and drive strategic decision-making. As one of our client’s first data-focused hires, you'll have significant autonomy and influence. Youʼll work with the Head of Product to define best practices for data analysis and monitoring, design performance metrics, and work across technical and business domains to ensure that data remains a core strength of our client company.
Leading the analysis of large, complex time-series datasets from a range of sources (energy storage systems, home appliances, environmental data).
Monitoring the performance of our optimisation and forecasting models, proactively identifying opportunities for improvement.
Designing, implementing, and owning key performance indicators KPIs to track customer outcomes and system performance.
Rapidly diagnosing and investigating customer-facing or system issues using a data-driven approach.
Supporting and enhancing the development of new models for forecasting, optimisation, and predictive analytics.
Collaborating closely with engineering and product teams to turn analysis into action.
Providing input into business and product strategy based on data insights and emerging trends.
Helping to shape data processes, tooling, and culture as we scale.
Ideally, 4 years of experience in a data analysis, data science, or analytics engineering role.
Advanced SQL skills and extensive experience working with relational databases (e.g., Cloud SQL, BigQuery).
Proficient in Python for data analysis Pandas, NumPy, Jupyter, etc.).
Significant experience working with complex time-series datasets.
Strong understanding of either linear optimisation techniques or machine learning for predictive analytics.
Demonstrated ability to translate complex datasets into actionable insights for technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving instincts and an intuitive grasp of real-world system behaviours reflected in data.
Self-directed and comfortable taking ownership in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment.
Excellent communication skills and a collaborative, low-ego approach.
Motivated by climate impact and passionate about building real-world solutions.
Experience working in energy systems/utilities or with smart/IoT devices.
Experience in early-stage startups or small cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with cloud-native data tooling (Google Cloud Platform preferred).
Experience establishing data monitoring and reporting frameworks from Scratch.
WFH allowance: Monthly payment as financial support for remote working.
Career Growth: We have established a career development program accessible for all employees with a 360º feedback that will help us to guide you in your career progression.

Training: For Tech training at Zartis, you have time allocated during the week at your disposal. You can request from a variety of options, such as online courses (from Pluralsight and Educative.io, for example), English classes, books, conferences, and events.
Mentoring Program: You can become a mentor in Zartis or you can receive mentorship, or both.

Zartis Wellbeing Hub (Kara Connect): A platform that provides sessions with a range of specialists, including mental health professionals, nutritionists, physiotherapists, fitness coaches, and webinars with such professionals as well.
Multicultural working environment: We organize tech events, webinars, parties, and activities to do online team-building games and contests.

The company and our mission:


Zartis is a digital solutions provider working across technology strategy, software engineering, and product development.


We partner with firms across financial services, MedTech, media, logistics technology, renewable energy, EdTech, e-commerce, and more. Our engineering hubs in EMEA and LATAM are full of talented professionals delivering business success and digital improvement across application development, software architecture, CI/CD, business intelligence, QA automation, and new technology integrations.


We are looking for a Data Analyst to work on a project in the home energy optimization industry.



The project:


Our teammates are talented people that come from a variety of backgrounds. We’re committed to building an inclusive culture based on trust and innovation which creates a good work environment that helps enrich the product.

You will be part of a distributed team developing new technologies to solve real business problems.

Our client is a climate-tech startup on a mission to make rooftop solar more effective and affordable building a platform that optimizes home energy storage using real-time data and machine learning to reduce carbon emissions lower costs and make solar accessible to more households recently closed its seed round and rolling out to early users offering a remote-first setup with flexibility a small and ambitious team where early hires have real ownership and impact.


We are looking for someone proactive with strong communication skills and attention to detail, motivated by climate impact and data-driven solutions.


The Role:


We're looking for a Data Analyst to join our client’s founding team and take a leading role in how we manage, interpret, and leverage data across our client’s platform.


You'll work closely with engineering, product, and leadership to monitor and refine our optimisation models, deliver insights to enhance customer outcomes, and drive strategic decision-making. As one of our client’s first data-focused hires, you'll have significant autonomy and influence. Youʼll work with the Head of Product to define best practices for data analysis and monitoring, design performance metrics, and work across technical and business domains to ensure that data remains a core strength of our client company.


What you will do:


  • Leading the analysis of large, complex time-series datasets from a range of sources (energy storage systems, home appliances, environmental data).
  • Monitoring the performance of our optimisation and forecasting models, proactively identifying opportunities for improvement.
  • Designing, implementing, and owning key performance indicators KPIs to track customer outcomes and system performance.
  • Rapidly diagnosing and investigating customer-facing or system issues using a data-driven approach.
  • Supporting and enhancing the development of new models for forecasting, optimisation, and predictive analytics.
  • Collaborating closely with engineering and product teams to turn analysis into action.
  • Providing input into business and product strategy based on data insights and emerging trends.
  • Helping to shape data processes, tooling, and culture as we scale.


What you will bring:


  • Ideally, 4 years of experience in a data analysis, data science, or analytics engineering role.
  • Advanced SQL skills and extensive experience working with relational databases (e.g., Cloud SQL, BigQuery).
  • Proficient in Python for data analysis Pandas, NumPy, Jupyter, etc.).
  • Significant experience working with complex time-series datasets.
  • Strong understanding of either linear optimisation techniques or machine learning for predictive analytics.
  • Demonstrated ability to translate complex datasets into actionable insights for technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Strong problem-solving instincts and an intuitive grasp of real-world system behaviours reflected in data.
  • Self-directed and comfortable taking ownership in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment.
  • Excellent communication skills and a collaborative, low-ego approach.
  • Motivated by climate impact and passionate about building real-world solutions.


Nice to Have:


  • Experience working in energy systems/utilities or with smart/IoT devices.
  • Experience in early-stage startups or small cross-functional teams.
  • Familiarity with cloud-native data tooling (Google Cloud Platform preferred).
  • Experience establishing data monitoring and reporting frameworks from Scratch.


What we offer:


  • 100% Remote Work
  • WFH allowance: Monthly payment as financial support for remote working.
  • Career Growth: We have established a career development program accessible for all employees with a 360º feedback that will help us to guide you in your career progression.
  • Training: For Tech training at Zartis, you have time allocated during the week at your disposal. You can request from a variety of options, such as online courses (from Pluralsight and Educative.io, for example), English classes, books, conferences, and events.
  • Mentoring Program: You can become a mentor in Zartis or you can receive mentorship, or both.
  • Zartis Wellbeing Hub (Kara Connect): A platform that provides sessions with a range of specialists, including mental health professionals, nutritionists, physiotherapists, fitness coaches, and webinars with such professionals as well.
  • Flexible Working schedule.
  • Multicultural working environment: We organize tech events, webinars, parties, and activities to do online team-building games and contests.

Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions.
As a consultant you will have the opportunity to be part of Nexeo:
International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)

The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.
Understand the day-to-day issues that the bank faces
Performs cleansing of data quality issues through the analysi
Monitors the data quality based on data quality dashboards, supports redesign & upgrade
Contributes to designing, monitoring and reporting on common reference tools
Contributes to raising awareness of the importance of data quality
Will be involved in all the topics related to Customer Data
Work in collaboration with other technical teams to share data
Industrialize the process to run define periodicity
Document the project (functional and technical part)
Contribute to the achievement of the team objectives
At least 3 years of experience in Data Analysis (focus data quality & data governance)
Understand data lifecycle and data usage
Good experience working with SQL Queries & SAS
English Fluent & French or Dutch native

4232864585,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analist-at-vlaanderen-connect-4232864585?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=ANAg7zNc3AhgvtASA8SH3w%3D%3D,Data-analist,Vlaanderen connect.,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Jouw toekomstige job
Als Data Analsyst bij het DataTeam van het Departement Omgeving help je mee met het doorvertalen van business vereisten naar concrete rapporterings- en dashboardoplossingen (voornamelijk in Qlik).

Je ondersteunt de business met het opstellen van projectdefinities en voert hierbij zowel business als functionele analyses uit, met als focus het uitklaren van het rapporteringsluik van de projecten. Je voert hiervoor een adequate, gestructureerde en coherente doorvertaling uit van de vereisten in overeenstemming met de standaarden, architectuurkeuzes en specificaties van bestaande applicaties.

Op basis van deze analyses ontwerp je dashboards, maak je wijzigingen aan bepaalde applicaties, stel je rapporten op… die vervolgens door business gebruikt kunnen worden om (beleids)wijzigingen door te voeren en/of data voor de burger ter beschikking te stellen.
Je werkt bij Team Digitalisering van het departement Omgeving.

Het departement Omgeving staat garant voor een kwaliteitsvolle leefomgeving met respect voor mens, dier en ecosysteem. We maken milieu-ecologische en ruimtelijke afwegingen en ontwikkelingskeuzes in het belang van de Vlaamse samenleving. We streven naar een duurzame omgang met diverse natuurlijke hulpbronnen in een koolstofarme, energiezuinige, klimaatintelligente samenleving. We realiseren een sterke band tussen ecologische, sociale en economische dimensies.

Team Digitalisering staat binnen het departement Omgeving in voor het digitaliseren van dienstverlening en data. Dat doen we door het opzetten van overkoepelende informatiesystemen, referentie- en kruispuntdatabanken, interactieve loketten voor gegevensuitwisseling en het uitbouwen van een geïntegreerde ICT-infrastructuur. Als teamlid van het Dataplatform werk je samen met verschillende sub-teams binnen Team Digitalisering en potentiële afnemers van data binnen en buiten de organisatie.
Team Digitalisering heeft een 100-tal medewerkers die gebaseerd zijn in Brussel.

Binnen de het digitaliseringsteam is het Datateam verantwoordelijk voor het co-creëren van transformatieve dataproducten (ETL, linked open data,…) voor alle businessdomeinen. We bestrijken het volledige bereik van Departement Omgeving: data-analyses op het vlak van beleidsvorming, toekenning van vergunningen, monitoring en handhaving zijn aan de orde. We staan aan het begin van de invoering van AI en machine learning.
Je werkt in Brussel, op wandelafstand van het station Brussel Noord. Momenteel is het Herman Teirlinckgebouw onze standplaats
> 3 jaar ervaring in een gelijkaardige functie met kennis van volgende zaken:
QlikSense (of QlikView of eventueel Tableau en andere visualisatietooling )
Qlik Expression Syntax (Set Analysis), Client-Managed server architectuur componenten, security rules, Vizlib... of gelijkaardige componenten binnen een ander framweork
Kennis van R en R-shiny is een plus
Wat jij van ons mag verwachten
Vlaanderen connect biedt een contract van 38 uur voor onbepaalde duur en een competitief salarispakket met:
Een bonussysteem op basis van vast te leggen doelstellingen
28 dagen verlof en extra wettelijke feestdagen (11/07, 02/11 en 15/11).
Tegemoetkoming in de kosten van schoolvakantieopvang

Op basis van deze analyses ontwerp je dashboards, maak je wijzigingen aan bepaalde applicaties, stel je rapporten op… die vervolgens door business gebruikt kunnen worden om (beleids)wijzigingen door te voeren en/of data voor de burger ter beschikking te stellen.


Jouw toekomstig team

Het departement Omgeving staat garant voor een kwaliteitsvolle leefomgeving met respect voor mens, dier en ecosysteem. We maken milieu-ecologische en ruimtelijke afwegingen en ontwikkelingskeuzes in het belang van de Vlaamse samenleving. Jouw talenten en vaardigheden

  • >
column2:
3 jaar ervaring in een gelijkaardige functie met kennis van volgende zaken:
  • QlikSense (of QlikView of eventueel Tableau en andere visualisatietooling )
  • Qlik Expression Syntax (Set Analysis), Client-Managed server architectuur componenten, security rules, Vizlib... of gelijkaardige componenten binnen een ander framweork
  • SQL, postgreSQL, PgAdmin...
  • JavaScript en/of Python (of andere programeertaal)
  • Jira, Confluence
  • Git, Bamboo/Jenkins
  • Kennis van R en R-shiny is een plus


    • Wat jij van ons mag verwachten

    Vlaanderen connect biedt een contract van 38 uur voor onbepaalde duur en een competitief salarispakket met:

    • Een aantrekkelijke bruto verloning
    • Een bonussysteem op basis van vast te leggen doelstellingen
    • 28 dagen verlof en extra wettelijke feestdagen (11/07, 02/11 en 15/11).
    • Een mobiliteitsbudget
    • Maaltijdcheques van 8 euro/dag (eigen bijdrage 1,09 euro/dag)
    • Een forfaitaire onkostenvergoeding
    • Een hospitalisatieverzekering (je kan gezinsleden aansluiten)
    • Een groepsverzekering
    • Een arbeidsongevallenverzekering
    • Een opleidingsbudget
    • Een laptop
    • Een smartphone met abonnementsformule
    • Flexibele werkuren
    • Thuiswerkmiddelen en mogelijkheden tot thuiswerk
    • Tegemoetkoming in de kosten van schoolvakantieopvang

4223343569,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-harry-hope-belgium-4223343569?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=A3fkIQg0QYIB1nJts8XToQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Harry Hope. Belgium,"Brabant, Walloon Region, Belgium","Notre client est une entreprise bien établie dans le secteur aéronautique.
En tant que Data Analyst, vous serez au cœur de la valorisation de la donnée au sein de l’organisation. Vos missions incluront :
Création et maintenance de rapports et dashboards Power BI (visualisations avancées, nouvelles sources de données)
Amélioration continue des rapports existants (pertinence, performance, fiabilité)
Transformation de données issues de sources multiples
Traduction des données en insights accessibles et exploitables pour les équipes métiers
Prise en charge d’analyses ponctuelles (campagnes marketing, performance d’outils internes, etc.)
Interprétation des besoins business en solutions data-driven
Bachelier ou master, avec une première expérience dans l’analyse de données
Compétences solides en structuration, traitement et interprétation de données
Bon esprit d’analyse, capacité à vulgariser les résultats complexes
Langues : français, et bonne maîtrise de l’anglais
Esprit collaboratif, orientation solution, autonomie et fiabilité

Notre client est une entreprise bien établie dans le secteur aéronautique.


Description du poste :

En tant que Data Analyst, vous serez au cœur de la valorisation de la donnée au sein de l’organisation. Vos missions incluront :

  • Création et maintenance de rapports et dashboards Power BI (visualisations avancées, nouvelles sources de données)
  • Amélioration continue des rapports existants (pertinence, performance, fiabilité)
  • Transformation de données issues de sources multiples
  • Traduction des données en insights accessibles et exploitables pour les équipes métiers
  • Prise en charge d’analyses ponctuelles (campagnes marketing, performance d’outils internes, etc.)
  • Interprétation des besoins business en solutions data-driven


Profil recherché :

  • Bachelier ou master, avec une première expérience dans l’analyse de données
  • Bonne maîtrise de Power BI
  • Compétences solides en structuration, traitement et interprétation de données
  • Bon esprit d’analyse, capacité à vulgariser les résultats complexes
  • Langues : français, et bonne maîtrise de l’anglais
  • Esprit collaboratif, orientation solution, autonomie et fiabilité
