Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :

  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

4237031466,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-senior-h-f-at-extia-4237031466?position=37&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=UoxnwXcOkEvdrQNaGZtPlg%3D%3D,Data Analyst Senior (H/F),Extia,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !
Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.
Vous serez notamment en charge de :
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises
Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 5 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :
Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,

Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.
Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération
Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui

  • Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
  • Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
  • Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous

Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 5 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :

  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas &
column2:
Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

Create and manage BI and analytics solutions that turn data into knowledge and translate business needs to technical specifications
Design, build and deploy BI solutions (e.g. reporting tools)
Maintain and support data analytics platforms (e.g. MicroStrategy)
Create tools to store data (e.g. OLAP cubes)
Evaluate and improve existing BI systems
Collaborate with teams to integrate systems
Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses
Create visualizations and reports for requested projects
Proven experience as a BI Developer or Data Scientist
Background in data warehouse design (e.g. dimensional modeling) and data mining
In-depth understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing (OLAP) and ETL (Extract, transform, load) framework
Familiarity with BI technologies (e.g. Microsoft Power BI, Oracle BI)
Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative
Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant

Description:

  • Create and manage BI and analytics solutions that turn data into knowledge and translate business needs to technical specifications
  • Design, build and deploy BI solutions (e.g. reporting tools)
  • Maintain and support data analytics platforms (e.g. MicroStrategy)
  • Create tools to store data (e.g. OLAP cubes)
  • Conduct unit testing and troubleshooting
  • Evaluate and improve existing BI systems
  • Collaborate with teams to integrate systems
  • Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses
  • Create visualizations and reports for requested projects
  • Develop and update technical documentation


Profile:

  • Proven experience as a BI Developer or Data Scientist
  • Industry experience is preferred
  • Background in data warehouse design (e.g. dimensional modeling) and data mining
  • In-depth understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing (OLAP) and ETL (Extract, transform, load) framework
  • Familiarity with BI technologies (e.g. Microsoft Power BI, Oracle BI)
  • Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
  • Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative
  • Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
  • BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant

4165278033,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analytics-lead-at-semetis-4165278033?position=40&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=xP7f9goJ%2Fvp7tcfyTXEOJw%3D%3D,Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead,Semetis,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"📄 Type: Full-time | 📊 Experience: Mid-Senior (4-7 years experience)

At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.
Translate complex data into actionable insights for marketing and business decisions.
Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.
4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn’t be offered.

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data—we turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium’s leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.

This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn’t just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.
If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.
Full job description & application details here.
Ready to make an impact? Let’s talk.

📄 Type: Full-time | 📊 Experience: Mid-Senior (4-7 years experience)


At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence &
column2:

Your Mission:

  • Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
  • Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
  • Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
  • Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.


What You Bring:

  • 4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
  • Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
  • Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
  • Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
  • Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
  • Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn’t be offered.


Why Join Semetis?

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data—we turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium’s leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.


This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn’t just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.


If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.

4233360682,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analyst-at-dataroots-a-talan-company-4233360682?position=41&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=buTYo7p3IrsPSLf8Ixtidg%3D%3D,Junior Data Analyst,"dataroots, a Talan company",Louvain Metropolitan Area,"🤖 The Job

As a Junior Data Analyst at Dataroots, you'll embark on a journey to become a key player in a team bridging the gap between business and data teams. Under the guidance of experienced data consultants, you'll gain hands-on experience in translating business needs into tangible data and AI-driven solutions. You'll learn to gather business requirements from clients, identify and assess the necessary data, and build or collaborate to build and deploy effective data solutions.

During a training period, we'll equip you with the skills you need to become a proficient Data Analyst. You'll learn to embrace a role that will extend beyond technical expertise as you translate complex outcomes into business impact, presenting results to stakeholders in clear and understandable terms. Along the way, you'll contribute to developing the right capabilities and governance structures within organisations, ensuring that data solutions deliver sustainable long-term value.
Assist clients in bridging the gap between business and data teams
Help translate business needs into concrete data and AI-driven requirements
Gather business requirements from clients and identify relevant data sources
Build and deploy effective data models
Crunch the numbers, deep dive into the data, spot opportunities, understand what is going on to support the decision making
Translate technical outcomes into business impact and present results to stakeholders
Contribute to developing data governance frameworks and capabilities within organisations
🎉 What you can expect at Dataroots?

Dataroots, a vibrant and dynamic data consulting company founded in 2016, stands out with its unique expertise in the data realm. We are committed to nurturing a culture that prioritises team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing, and outstanding customer experiences, which has fuelled our sustained and robust growth. As a Data Analyst at Dataroots, you'll be an essential part of our mission, playing a key role in developing and implementing data-driven solutions for our clients.
You have worked for 1,5 - 2 years in the data field in a professional setting.
You are excited about the potential of data, AI, and digital to solve real-world problems.
You have either a business degree and a technical affinity or a technical degree and a business affinity.
You are curious and possess a healthy dose of drive and ambition.
You have a good overview of the (big-)data ecosystem and know how different components fit in a data engineering or machine learning solution.
You have a first experience (+-1,5-2 years) with data visualisation tools like PowerBI or Tableau, as well as programming languages such as SQL, Python, and/or dbt, in a work project.
You understand how to collect and identify business requirements and translate these into functional requirements and acceptance criteria.
You are developing your technical ability and soft skills to align both technical and business stakeholders and drive change.
You have a can-do attitude, you take ownership of the project to ensure timely delivery & scalable solution through strong project management capabilities.
You know how to build storylines and translate complex solutions into clear & understandable content and context and you are constantly developing your skills in this area.
You speak English fluently and either Dutch or French.
Competitive salary package with benefits including a company car & fuel card or mobility budget, hospitalisation insurance, group insurance, high-end laptop, and smartphone.
Personal & team training budget for continuous professional development.
Innovation budget for involvement in exciting open-source projects.
Team Buildings, gatherings, and sports initiatives to foster team spirit.
Ready for a new chapter as a Junior Data Analyst at Dataroots? Great! Apply now! 🎉

4235098499,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-xelor-4235098499?position=42&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=lT%2FiUl%2FLK%2F1XicH%2FrgWdBg%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analyst,Xelor,"Flemish Region, Belgium","Ben jij iemand die graag in data duikt zoals anderen in een zwembad springen?
Zit jij ’s ochtends al koffie te drinken met dashboards en denk je in grafieken, trends en inzichten? Dan zou jij wel eens onze volgende BI-held(in) kunnen zijn.
Je verzamelt data uit verschillende bronnen en tovert die om tot inzichten waar onze business écht iets aan heeft.
Je bouwt, optimaliseert en onderhoudt dashboards.
Je werkt nauw samen met collega’s van alle afdelingen: van marketing tot finance – iedereen wil jouw data-skills benutten.
Je vertaalt complexe cijfers naar glasheldere visuals en aanbevelingen die leiden tot slimme beslissingen.
Een analytisch brein met liefde voor BI-tools (Power BI, Tableau, SQL, you name it).
Je denkt in patronen, verbanden en “wat zegt dit nu écht?”.
Je vindt het leuk om samen met anderen te bouwen aan verbetering, niet alleen aan rapporten.
Je bent nieuwsgierig, leergierig en altijd op zoek naar het ‘waarom’.
En als je ook nog strategisch kan meedenken? Bonuspunten.
✅ Een uitdagende, verantwoordelijke functie in een innovatieve omgeving
Liever als freelancer aan de slag? Dat kan uiteraard ook!

Ben jij iemand die graag in data duikt zoals anderen in een zwembad springen?

Zit jij ’s ochtends al koffie te drinken met dashboards en denk je in grafieken, trends en inzichten? Dan zou jij wel eens onze volgende BI-held(in) kunnen zijn.


Jouw Rol

  • Je verzamelt data uit verschillende bronnen en tovert die om tot inzichten waar onze business écht iets aan heeft.
  • Je bouwt, optimaliseert en onderhoudt dashboards.
  • Je werkt nauw samen met collega’s van alle afdelingen: van marketing tot finance – iedereen wil jouw data-skills benutten.
  • Je vertaalt complexe cijfers naar glasheldere visuals en aanbevelingen die leiden tot slimme beslissingen.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een analytisch brein met liefde voor BI-tools (Power BI, Tableau, SQL, you name it).
  • Je denkt in patronen, verbanden en “wat zegt dit nu écht?”.
  • Je vindt het leuk om samen met anderen te bouwen aan verbetering, niet alleen aan rapporten.
  • Je bent nieuwsgierig, leergierig en altijd op zoek naar het ‘waarom’.
  • En als je ook nog strategisch kan meedenken? Bonuspunten.


Wat biedt Xelor jou?

✅ Een uitdagende, verantwoordelijke functie in een innovatieve omgeving

4238222842,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/csrd-analyst-data-analyst-at-acensi-4238222842?position=43&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=jpaVi8XfboVz51WYXF94ew%3D%3D,CSRD Analyst - Data Analyst,ACENSI,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"ACENSI is looking for a CSRD Analyst for one of their client based in Brussels :
Our client is part of the 1st wave of the implementation of the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD) and the company published it’s first CSRD-compliant report in March 2025.
In 2025 the Sustainability reporting team is focusing on improving and stabilizing the reporting processes, governance and data quality.

As part of this team, the consultant will support the Group Sustainability reporting manager in autonomously leading three key streams. The consultant will work closely with stakeholders from various business departments (Finance, Controlling, HR, Sustainability, Infrastructure, Asset Management, IT), with the external auditors and with the external consultants that act as advisors.
- The consultant will be part of the Group Sustainability reporting team, under the coordination of the project manager and the project lead
- The consultant will have a Group transversal role, acting as a connector across the two main entities of the company.
1. PM and ESRS data technical expert for the digital stream :
Support the IT/data team in modelling the data in accordance with the quantitative datapoints from Environment (E1, E4, E5) , Social (S1, S2) and Governance (G1)
Contribute to definition of standard operating procedures and related documentation
Together with the project team, drive consensus on proposed solutions across business and IT
Ensure full compliance with the ESRS guidance when the data engineers are modelling the data in the data pipelines
Remain up to date with the ESRS simplification coming from the Omnibus that can impact the data modelling
Stakeholders engagement: ensure that all the interested parties and consulted/informed and kept updated with the progress of the stream
column2: discover synergies with other ongoing digital initiatives

column1: Collaborate with the auditors in the context of the limited assurance activities
2. Drive the connectivity project and Taxonomy improvements :
Enhance and create new internal documentation for the Taxonomy methodology of retrieving Turnover/CAPEX/OPEX
Lead implementation and create a Group-wide methodology for retrieving CAPEX/OPEX linked to sustainability actions (MDR-A from ESRS2) across E1, E4, E5 and S1, S2
Lead implementation and create a Group-wide methodology for the phased-in disclosure requirements related to anticipated financial effects (For example, E1-9).
3. Lead improvements for governance-related matters for the 2025 audit :
In collaboration mode with the Group Risk Management team and other stakeholders create a uniform inventory of (ESG) Group policies
Support the Group-wide implementation of a due diligence process
Direct experience and knowledge of ESG reporting frameworks such as ESRS. GRI, SASB, TCFD
Good knowledge of French and Dutch, fluency in English. German is a plus
Previous experience with external (ESG or financial) assurance (experience in a consultancy company is preferred)
Previous experience with implementing digital/IT projects, specifically for ESG is a plus
A Master degree, preferably in the fields of finance, environmental science, engineering, economics, sustainability management or similar
Analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to process data, analyze information, think critically
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational and project management/ time management skills to handle reporting requirements
Excellent communication skills and the ability to convey complex sustainability information effectively
Reliable, well organised, analytical and result driven with high standards or ethics and professionalism
Collaborative team player, but also with high levels of autonomy and accountability for your own work
A genuine passion for sustainability and a desire to drive positive change.
Location: Brussels, with occasionally travel to Berlin
Important: if the consultant will work in Belgium, for non-EU candidates, please present candidates who comply with the following criteria:
Possess a work permit allowing the individual to work in Belgium.
Hold a valid residence permit confirming the right of residence in Belgium.

ACENSI is looking for a CSRD Analyst for one of their client based in Brussels :


Service description :

Our client is part of the 1st wave of the implementation of the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD) and the company published it’s first CSRD-compliant report in March 2025.

In 2025 the Sustainability reporting team is focusing on improving and stabilizing the reporting processes, governance and data quality.

As part of this team, the consultant will support the Group Sustainability reporting manager in autonomously leading three key streams. The consultant will work closely with stakeholders from various business departments (Finance, Controlling, HR, Sustainability, Infrastructure, Asset Management, IT), with the external auditors and with the external consultants that act as advisors.


Key responsibilities and workstreams :


- The consultant will be part of the Group Sustainability reporting team, under the coordination of the project manager and the project lead

1. PM and ESRS data technical expert for the digital stream :

  • Lead implementation and create a Group-wide methodology for retrieving CAPEX/OPEX linked to sustainability actions (MDR-A from ESRS2) across E1, E4, E5 and S1, S2
  • Lead implementation and create a Group-wide methodology for the phased-in disclosure requirements related to anticipated financial effects (For example, E1-9).


3. Lead improvements for governance-related matters for the 2025 audit :

  • In collaboration mode with the Group Risk Management team and other stakeholders create a uniform inventory of (ESG) Group policies

    • Requirements

    • Minimum 5-6 years of professional experience

    • Good knowledge of French and Dutch, fluency in English. German is a plus
    • Previous experience with external (ESG or financial) assurance (experience in a consultancy company is preferred)
    • Previous experience with implementing digital/IT projects, specifically for ESG is a plus

  • Detail-oriented with excellent organizational and project management/ time management skills to handle reporting requirements
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to convey complex sustainability information effectively
  • Reliable, well organised, analytical and result driven with high standards or ethics and professionalism

4237572867,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-governance-analyst-at-euroclear-4237572867?position=46&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=EIdmqTdhUP6gRuR5z7F3Rg%3D%3D,Data Governance Analyst,Euroclear,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Job Opportunity: Security Analyst – Data Governance Tribe (CISO Division)
Location: Brussels, Belgium | Hybrid Work model 8 days per month in the office

At Euroclear, we power the world’s financial markets by delivering secure, efficient, and reliable infrastructure. Security is not just a function here—it’s embedded in everything we do. As part of our dedication to safeguarding critical financial services, we’re looking for a Security Analyst to join our Data Protection Governance team within the CISO (Cyber Information Security Office) Division.

As a Security Analyst in the Data Governance Tribe, you will help shape and carry out our cybersecurity standards, contribute to developing new security policies, and ensure our data protection systems are resilient, inclusive, and future-ready. You’ll collaborate closely with internal Audit, Risk, and Business units to maintain a safe and secure digital ecosystem.

We believe in teams with varied strengths and value outstanding perspectives. This role is open to candidates from all backgrounds who are passionate about cybersecurity and eager to make a tangible impact.
Provide expert analysis and support for security architecture, operations, and controls
Evaluate and improve data protection technologies and governance frameworks
Conduct risk assessments and participate in investigations, forensic analysis, and incident responses
Design and implement security monitoring solutions and data loss prevention strategies
Collaborate across teams to ensure flawless integration of security into new technologies and projects
Support the evolution of cloud and email security solutions
We’re looking for a blend of skills and experience. If you have some or all of the following, we’d love to hear from you:
Solid understanding of infrastructure or application security domains
Experience with Microsoft 365, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive, Intune, Azure Information Protection, or similar tools
Knowledge of McAfee ePO, endpoint protection, secure email gateways, CASB/DLP tools, and SIEM solutions
Technical knowledge in networking, system administration (Windows, Active Directory), and vulnerability assessment
Comfort with scripting or programming (PowerShell, Python, SQL, etc.)
Familiarity with standards like CISM, CISSP, ISO/IEC 27001/02, SOX, NIST, GDPR
Critical thinking and analytical mindset with a solution-oriented approach
Good communication skills—able to tailor messages to both technical and non-technical audiences
A collaborative spirit—able to work across cultures, disciplines, and geographies
A passion for continuous learning and adapting in a fast-paced environment
Drive, curiosity, and a hands-on mentality
Flexibility: We support work-life balance through hybrid work models and adaptable schedules.
Purposeful: Join a team that plays a crucial role in protecting the global financial ecosystem.
Growth: We offer continuous learning opportunities and clear paths for career advancement.
Are you ready to help shape the future of digital trust and security at Euroclear? Apply now and bring your whole self to work

Embark on your new adventure at Euroclear, and work at the heart of the global capital markets. We connect over 2,000 financial institutions across the globe. As an open and resilient infrastructure, we contribute to the stability of the financial markets. We help clients cut through complexity, lower costs, and mitigate risks of financial transactions. At Euroclear, we have the clear ambition to use our key role to facilitate and accelerate a sustainable global financial system.
Work closely with inspiring, supportive and engaged colleagues from more than 80 different countries.
Practice your talents in a highly professional international environment.
Join a learning and development environment with an emphasis on knowledge sharing and training.
Find your own optimal balance within our hybrid working model, where you can connect at the office and also benefit from remote working.
Great Place to Work for All

We are committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates diversity and strives to be a Great Place to Work for All. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment, regardless of any aspect that makes them unique (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, pregnancy, disability, …). If you need any specific accommodation due to disability or any other reason, you can let the recruiter know during your application process.

As a global critical financial infrastructure, the protection of Euroclear information and assets is fundamental to the companys’ business. Security is at the core of our services, firmly embedded in the management systems and processes of the company. You will be joining our Chief Information Security Office (CISO) in charge of putting in place the required controls to adequately and effectively protect our information assets.

Job Opportunity: Security Analyst – Data Governance Tribe (CISO Division)

Location: Brussels, Belgium | Hybrid Work model 8 days per month in the office


Who We Are


At Euroclear, we power the world’s financial markets by delivering secure, efficient, and reliable infrastructure. Security is not just a function here—it’s embedded in everything we do. As part of our dedication to safeguarding critical financial services, we’re looking for a Security Analyst to join our Data Protection Governance team within the CISO (Cyber Information Security Office) Division.


About the Role


As a Security Analyst in the Data Governance Tribe, you will help shape and carry out our cybersecurity standards, contribute to developing new security policies, and ensure our data protection systems are resilient, inclusive, and future-ready. You’ll collaborate closely with internal Audit, Risk, and Business units to maintain a safe and secure digital ecosystem.


We believe in teams with varied strengths and value outstanding perspectives. This role is open to candidates from all backgrounds who are passionate about cybersecurity and eager to make a tangible impact.


Your Mission


In this role, you will:


  • Provide expert analysis and support for security architecture, operations, and controls
  • Evaluate and improve data protection technologies and governance frameworks
  • Conduct risk assessments and participate in investigations, forensic analysis, and incident responses
  • Design and implement security monitoring solutions and data loss prevention strategies
  • Collaborate across teams to ensure flawless integration of security into new technologies and projects
  • Support the evolution of cloud and email security solutions

What You Bring


We’re looking for a blend of skills and experience. If you have some or all of the following, we’d love to hear from you:


  • Solid understanding of infrastructure or application security domains
  • Experience with Microsoft 365, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive, Intune, Azure Information Protection, or similar tools
  • Knowledge of McAfee ePO, endpoint protection, secure email gateways, CASB/DLP tools, and SIEM solutions
  • Technical knowledge in networking, system administration (Windows, Active Directory), and vulnerability assessment
  • Comfort with scripting or programming (PowerShell, Python, SQL, etc.)
  • Familiarity with standards like CISM, CISSP, ISO/IEC 27001/02, SOX, NIST, GDPR

Your Superpowers


  • Critical thinking and analytical mindset with a solution-oriented approach
  • Good communication skills—able to tailor messages to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • A collaborative spirit—able to work across cultures, disciplines, and geographies
  • A passion for continuous learning and adapting in a fast-paced environment
  • Drive, curiosity, and a hands-on mentality

Why Join Us?


  • Flexibility: We support work-life balance through hybrid work models and adaptable schedules.
  • Purposeful: Join a team that plays a crucial role in protecting the global financial ecosystem.
  • Growth: We offer continuous learning opportunities and clear paths for career advancement.

Your Next Step


Are you ready to help shape the future of digital trust and security at Euroclear? Apply now and bring your whole self to work


Why join us


Embark on your new adventure at Euroclear, and work at the heart of the global capital markets. We connect over 2,000 financial institutions across the globe. As an open and resilient infrastructure, we contribute to the stability of the financial markets. We help clients cut through complexity, lower costs, and mitigate risks of financial transactions. At Euroclear, we have the clear ambition to use our key role to facilitate and accelerate a sustainable global financial system.


What We Offer


  • Work closely with inspiring, supportive and engaged colleagues from more than 80 different countries.
  • Practice your talents in a highly professional international environment.
  • Join a learning and development environment with an emphasis on knowledge sharing and training.
  • Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits.

New ways of working


Find your own optimal balance within our hybrid working model, where you can connect at the office and also benefit from remote working.


Great Place to Work for All


We are committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates diversity and strives to be a Great Place to Work for All. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment, regardless of any aspect that makes them unique (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, pregnancy, disability, …). If you need any specific accommodation due to disability or any other reason, you can let the recruiter know during your application process.


About the team


As a global critical financial infrastructure, the protection of Euroclear information and assets is fundamental to the companys’ business. Security is at the core of our services, firmly embedded in the management systems and processes of the company. You will be joining our Chief Information Security Office (CISO) in charge of putting in place the required controls to adequately and effectively protect our information assets.

4231513816,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-data-kwaliteit-at-laco-4231513816?position=47&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=KCWr55GCXt4bJ91DMyaEvg%3D%3D,Data Analyst - Data Kwaliteit,LACO,"Flemish Region, Belgium","Wij zoeken een Data Analyst - Data Kwaliteit expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.

Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega’s centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.

Heb jij de bovennatuurlijke gave om ruwe data om te zetten in goud? Ben je gepassioneerd door data en overtuigd dat datakwaliteit dé sleutel is om organisaties waarde uit hun data te laten halen? Dan heeft LACO een data-gedreven avontuur op maat voor jou!

Als onze Data Analyst / Data Kwaliteit Expert ben jij de Sherlock Holmes van cijfers: je ontrafelt bedrijfsvereisten alsof het aanwijzingen in een mysterie zijn. Je bouwt niet alleen inzichten op, maar vormt ook strategische data-oplossingen die bedrijven naar succes leiden.
Als Data Analyst / Data Kwaliteit Expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:
Verzamelen en analyseren van data uit verschillende bronnen om inconsistenties en trends te identificeren
Signaleren van datakwaliteitsproblemen en de impact ervan op de business
Schoonmaken van data en het achterhalen van de oorzaken van kwaliteitsproblemen
Opzetten van Power BI dashboards om datakwaliteit te monitoren
Samenwerken met stakeholders en verschillende teams rond data kwaliteit en dataplatformen
Ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI rapporten en dashboards volgens de behoeften van de business
Identificeren van oorzaken van datakwaliteitsproblemen en implementeren van oplossingen.
Op de hoogte blijven van de nieuwste technologieën en best practices binnen data-analyse en datakwaliteit
Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding
Je bent communicatief sterk en gewend om met business stakeholders samen te werken
Je hebt een analytische mindset en kan business vereisten vertalen naar data-oplossingen
Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met datakwaliteit projecten
Je hebt uitgebreide kennis van Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage en Reporting Governance
Je hebt een sterke kennis van SQL
Je hebt ervaring met Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en Star Schemas (Kimball)
Ervaring hebt met Master Data Management.
Bekend bent met datakwaliteitstools zoals Azure Purview, Collibra, Informatica of Soda.
Kennis hebt van Python, Spark, PySpark, Spark SQL.
Ervaring met security protocollen zoals Column Level Security (CLS) en Object Level Security.
We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carrière verder te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, …
Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!
Neem contact op met onze recruiters en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

Wij zoeken een Data Analyst - Data Kwaliteit expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!


Over LACO

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data &

AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.


Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega’s centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.


Heb jij de bovennatuurlijke gave om ruwe data om te zetten in goud? Ben je gepassioneerd door data en overtuigd dat datakwaliteit dé sleutel is om organisaties waarde uit hun data te laten halen? Dan heeft LACO een data-gedreven avontuur op maat voor jou!

Als onze Data Analyst / Data Kwaliteit Expert ben jij de Sherlock Holmes van cijfers: je ontrafelt bedrijfsvereisten alsof het aanwijzingen in een mysterie zijn. Je bouwt niet alleen inzichten op, maar vormt ook strategische data-oplossingen die bedrijven naar succes leiden.


Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst / Data Kwaliteit Expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

  • Verzamelen en analyseren van data uit verschillende bronnen om inconsistenties en trends te identificeren
  • Signaleren van datakwaliteitsproblemen en de impact ervan op de business
  • Schoonmaken van data en het achterhalen van de oorzaken van kwaliteitsproblemen
  • Ontwikkelen en implementeren van datakwaliteitscontroles
  • Opzetten van Power BI dashboards om datakwaliteit te monitoren
  • Samenwerken met stakeholders en verschillende teams rond data kwaliteit en dataplatformen
  • Ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI rapporten en dashboards volgens de behoeften van de business
  • Identificeren van oorzaken van datakwaliteitsproblemen en implementeren van oplossingen.
  • Op de hoogte blijven van de nieuwste technologieën en best practices binnen data-analyse en datakwaliteit


Jouw vaardigheden

  • Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding
  • Je bent communicatief sterk en gewend om met business stakeholders samen te werken
  • Je hebt een analytische mindset en kan business vereisten vertalen naar data-oplossingen
  • Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met datakwaliteit projecten
  • Je hebt uitgebreide kennis van Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage en Reporting Governance
  • Je hebt een sterke kennis van SQL
  • Je hebt ervaring met Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en Star Schemas (Kimball)


Bonuspunten als je …

  • Ervaring hebt met Master Data Management.
  • Bekend bent met datakwaliteitstools zoals Azure Purview, Collibra, Informatica of Soda.
  • Kennis hebt van Python, Spark, PySpark, Spark SQL.
  • Ervaring met security protocollen zoals Column Level Security (CLS) en Object Level Security.


Ons aanbod

  • We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
  • Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
  • Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carrière verder te ontwikkelen.
  • Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
  • Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, …


Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!

Neem contact op met onze recruiters en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.

4236560004,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/bi-data-analyst-for-an-ecommerce-company-363-at-remotivate-4236560004?position=48&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=H4uhSTFVT4wy6IXDkqkwGA%3D%3D,BI Data Analyst for an Ecommerce Company [363],Remotivate,European Union,"About the Company:

The CGK Linens is a fast-growing e-commerce company selling across Amazon and other platforms. They thrive in a fast-paced, results-driven environment where data is at the heart of their decision-making. As they scale, they’re looking for a sharp and proactive BI Data Analyst to lead their data operations and elevate their business intelligence capabilities.

We are seeking a highly analytical and communicative BI Data Analyst with hands-on experience working with Amazon Seller Central data. You will play a critical role in shaping the company’s data strategy and reporting infrastructure. This is a high-impact role where you’ll bridge technical and non-technical teams, ensuring data is clean, accurate, and actionable.
This is a Full-Time remote role.
We are looking for a BI Data Analyst specifically with these requirements:
3+ years of experience in a BI/Data Analyst or similar role
Experience with Amazon Seller Central data is a strong plus
Proficiency in SQL, Google Sheets/Excel, and data visualization tools (Power BI or Tableau)
Experience working with APIs, ETL pipelines, and data integration tools
Excellent communication skills – able to explain complex data to non-technical stakeholders
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
Highly organized with strong attention to detail
Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):
Owning and managing the company’s end-to-end data analytics efforts
Cleaning, structuring, and maintaining data from Amazon and other platforms
Building dashboards and creating insightful visualizations in Tableau or Power BI
Translating business needs into technical requirements and data-driven solutions
Collaborating with cross-functional teams – including marketing, operations, and finance
Ensuring data accuracy and consistency across reporting
Identifying trends and patterns to uncover growth opportunities
Proactively recommending actionable insights that drive results
Be part of a company that values autonomy, ownership, and results
Opportunity to shape and lead the BI strategy in a fast-growing company
Work alongside a strategic, cross-functional team
This Position Is Perfect For You If…
You thrive on structuring and analyzing data.
You enjoy working with complex datasets, especially from platforms like Amazon Seller Central, and take pride in cleaning, organizing, and transforming raw data into meaningful insights.
You’re skilled at building clear, actionable dashboards using tools like Power BI or Tableau, helping teams make informed decisions at a glance.
You take ownership of your work, double-check your outputs, and are always thinking ahead, identifying opportunities, fixing data gaps, and suggesting better ways to report.
Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.
Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon

About the Company:

The CGK Linens is a fast-growing e-commerce company selling across Amazon and other platforms. They thrive in a fast-paced, results-driven environment where data is at the heart of their decision-making. As they scale, they’re looking for a sharp and proactive BI Data Analyst to lead their data operations and elevate their business intelligence capabilities.


About the Role:

We are seeking a highly analytical and communicative BI Data Analyst with hands-on experience working with Amazon Seller Central data. You will play a critical role in shaping the company’s data strategy and reporting infrastructure. This is a high-impact role where you’ll bridge technical and non-technical teams, ensuring data is clean, accurate, and actionable.

This is a Full-Time remote role.


We are looking for a BI Data Analyst specifically with these requirements:

  • 3+ years of experience in a BI/Data Analyst or similar role
  • Experience with Amazon Seller Central data is a strong plus
  • Proficiency in SQL, Google Sheets/Excel, and data visualization tools (Power BI or Tableau)
  • Experience working with APIs, ETL pipelines, and data integration tools
  • Excellent communication skills – able to explain complex data to non-technical stakeholders
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
  • Highly organized with strong attention to detail


Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):

  • Owning and managing the company’s end-to-end data analytics efforts
  • Cleaning, structuring, and maintaining data from Amazon and other platforms
  • Building dashboards and creating insightful visualizations in Tableau or Power BI
  • Translating business needs into technical requirements and data-driven solutions
  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams – including marketing, operations, and finance
  • Ensuring data accuracy and consistency across reporting
  • Identifying trends and patterns to uncover growth opportunities
  • Proactively recommending actionable insights that drive results


Growth Opportunities/Perks:

  • Location-independent role – work from anywhere
  • Be part of a company that values autonomy, ownership, and results
  • Opportunity to shape and lead the BI strategy in a fast-growing company
  • Work alongside a strategic, cross-functional team


This Position Is Perfect For You If…


You thrive on structuring and analyzing data.

You enjoy working with complex datasets, especially from platforms like Amazon Seller Central, and take pride in cleaning, organizing, and transforming raw data into meaningful insights.


You're a visual storyteller.

You’re skilled at building clear, actionable dashboards using tools like Power BI or Tableau, helping teams make informed decisions at a glance.


You’re proactive and detail-oriented.

You take ownership of your work, double-check your outputs, and are always thinking ahead, identifying opportunities, fixing data gaps, and suggesting better ways to report.



Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.


Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon

4223481194,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-reporting-analyst-at-recurv-4223481194?position=50&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=TO1JdusWEUQC0%2FtqRMKvSQ%3D%3D,Data Reporting Analyst,recurv,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"Freelance Opportunity: Data Reporting Specialist

Are you passionate about transforming data into insights that drive real business decisions? We’re looking for a data-savvy professional with strong Qlik experience to help shape the future of reporting and analytics in an evolving environment. You’ll collaborate across departments, build meaningful dashboards, and contribute to smarter decision-making at every level of the organization.
Develop insightful dashboards and reports using Qlik tailored to business priorities.
Translate stakeholder input into structured data solutions and reporting frameworks.
Validate data outputs to ensure quality, reliability, and user trust.
Guide users in the adoption and value of reporting products.
Document your work to ensure transparency and consistency across the BI landscape.
Apply ITIL and SDLC concepts in a pragmatic, real-world manner.
Hands-on experience with Qlik (Sense, View or equivalent).
Strong communication skills—comfortable working with both business and technical stakeholders.
Fluent in English, with a solid command of Dutch or French.
Structured yet flexible, with the ability to work on multiple initiatives in a dynamic setting.
Enthusiastic, self-driven, and not afraid to take initiative.
Be part of a broader transformation toward a data-driven way of working
Contribute directly to how data supports decision-making across teams
Work in a forward-thinking environment that values initiative and learning
Enjoy a mix of structure and flexibility in your day-to-day tasks
See the tangible impact of your work through visible results
Collaborate closely with both business and IT stakeholders
Benefit from growth opportunities in a supportive and evolving context

Freelance Opportunity: Data Reporting Specialist


Are you passionate about transforming data into insights that drive real business decisions? We’re looking for a data-savvy professional with strong Qlik experience to help shape the future of reporting and analytics in an evolving environment. You’ll collaborate across departments, build meaningful dashboards, and contribute to smarter decision-making at every level of the organization.


Your Role:

  • Develop insightful dashboards and reports using Qlik tailored to business priorities.
  • Translate stakeholder input into structured data solutions and reporting frameworks.
  • Validate data outputs to ensure quality, reliability, and user trust.
  • Guide users in the adoption and value of reporting products.
  • Document your work to ensure transparency and consistency across the BI landscape.
  • Apply ITIL and SDLC concepts in a pragmatic, real-world manner.


Your Profile:

  • Hands-on experience with Qlik (Sense, View or equivalent).
  • Strong communication skills—comfortable working with both business and technical stakeholders.
  • Fluent in English, with a solid command of Dutch or French.
  • Structured yet flexible, with the ability to work on multiple initiatives in a dynamic setting.
  • Enthusiastic, self-driven, and not afraid to take initiative.


For you:

  • Be part of a broader transformation toward a data-driven way of working
  • Contribute directly to how data supports decision-making across teams
  • Work in a forward-thinking environment that values initiative and learning
  • Enjoy a mix of structure and flexibility in your day-to-day tasks
  • See the tangible impact of your work through visible results
  • Collaborate closely with both business and IT stakeholders
  • Benefit from growth opportunities in a supportive and evolving context


Interested? buna@recurv.be

4226657199,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-reporting-analyst-at-bakker-partners-4226657199?position=52&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=b65e6YkjA80hV0qZJM5C7A%3D%3D,Business Reporting Analyst,Bakker & Partners,"Zaventem, Flemish Region, Belgium","For our client, a renowned international company based in the Zaventem / Diegem region, we are currently looking for a Business Reporting Analyst.

The Business reporting analyst supports the finance department as well as the senior management and management team, by structuring the business information related to the different business processes throughout the organization. He/she has the objective to coordinate and structure the different data streams to present the information in a logical, transparent, well defined and efficient way. The performance controller has accountability for the reporting environment and in this sense has to make a proper analysis of the environment and make recommendations for improvements and implement them.

She/he is responsible for the management reporting set-up within the controlling department and supports the financial reporting process from a corporate point of view in terms of providing the right data sets needed to fulfill the corporate requirements
The business reporting analyst is keen on searching to optimize the reporting process in terms of preparation and availability/access to it.
Transforming the available information streams into usable business steering information by means of transparent, structured and easy to understand management reporting

Set-up of specific standard reports in a logic presentation and including description of reporting and definition of variables, starting with a clear analysis of the reporting needs and considering corporate reporting requirements
Search for synergies within the department to streamline information delivery, optimize the reporting processes to avoid possible errors.

Assist in defining and describing the different fields used within reporting and setting up a KPI library in a structured and well-defined way. By doing this, supporting the data quality process and assuring that correct data usage is embedded within the department and organization
You hold a University degree in Economics, Finance or Management.
You have at least 5 years of hands-on experience in business analysis, data analysis or corporate reporting.
Experience with Power BI, SAP BPC and/or SAS are assets.
You feel comfortable in complex and fast paced international environment.
You have experience in analyzing information needs of the business/finance and translation them in useful and fancy reporting.
You can handle situations that require analytical thinking, interpretation and judgment to continuously optimize solutions.
You are IT-savvy and are an experienced user of reporting tools.
You have strong planning & organization skills.
You are stress resistant and are able to meet tight deadlines.

Our client offers a challenging and exciting role that will allow you to make your mark. You will get the opportunity to join an ambitious company that enjoys a solid reputation in its market. The context is one of finance and business transformation, allowing people with a sense of initiative to have a real impact on the business.

For our client, a renowned international company based in the Zaventem / Diegem region, we are currently looking for a Business Reporting Analyst.


Role


The Business reporting analyst supports the finance department as well as the senior management and management team, by structuring the business information related to the different business processes throughout the organization. He/she has the objective to coordinate and structure the different data streams to present the information in a logical, transparent, well defined and efficient way. The performance controller has accountability for the reporting environment and in this sense has to make a proper analysis of the environment and make recommendations for improvements and implement them.



Key responsibilities


  • She/he is responsible for the management reporting set-up within the controlling department and supports the financial reporting process from a corporate point of view in terms of providing the right data sets needed to fulfill the corporate requirements
  • The business reporting analyst is keen on searching to optimize the reporting process in terms of preparation and availability/access to it.
  • Transforming the available information streams into usable business steering information by means of transparent, structured and easy to understand management reporting
  • Set-up of specific standard reports in a logic presentation and including description of reporting and definition of variables, starting with a clear analysis of the reporting needs and considering corporate reporting requirements
  • Search for synergies within the department to streamline information delivery, optimize the reporting processes to avoid possible errors.
  • Assist in defining and describing the different fields used within reporting and setting up a KPI library in a structured and well-defined way. By doing this, supporting the data quality process and assuring that correct data usage is embedded within the department and organization



Requirements for the role


  • You hold a University degree in Economics, Finance or Management.
  • You have at least 5 years of hands-on experience in business analysis, data analysis or corporate reporting.
  • Experience with Power BI, SAP BPC and/or SAS are assets.
  • You feel comfortable in complex and fast paced international environment.
  • You have experience in analyzing information needs of the business/finance and translation them in useful and fancy reporting.
  • You can handle situations that require analytical thinking, interpretation and judgment to continuously optimize solutions.
  • You are IT-savvy and are an experienced user of reporting tools.
  • You have strong planning &
column2:
organization skills.
  • You are stress resistant and are able to meet tight deadlines.



    • Offer


    Our client offers a challenging and exciting role that will allow you to make your mark. You will get the opportunity to join an ambitious company that enjoys a solid reputation in its market. The context is one of finance and business transformation, allowing people with a sense of initiative to have a real impact on the business.

4237573861,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analyst-at-iogp-europe-4237573861?position=53&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=vZUKC%2BElGAu6BrgM72oBVw%3D%3D,Junior Data Analyst,IOGP Europe,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"IOGP Europe is recruiting a person who is currently pursuing or has recently completed a degree in data science, statistics, environmental studies or a related field who is highly motivated and interested in the energy industry.
This person will work closely with the all teams to analyze and visualize data, helping to make it more impactful while identifying underlying trends and patterns.
Support policy, outreach and communication teams with relevant data to support advocacy towards external stakeholders.
Analyze and visualize data to identify trends and patterns.
Collect and organize datasets from reliable industry, governmental and EU/international institutional (Eurostat, IEA, OECD, World Bank etc.) sources.
Collaborate with team members to ensure data accuracy and relevance.
Prepare and format sections of the annual statistical report.
Monitor emerging trends in energy production, imports, and emissions.
Coordinate with the IOGP Secretariat in London to ensure alignment in data analysis
Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Data Science, Statistics, Environmental Studies, Energy Engineering, or a related field.
Languages: Fluent in English. Knowledge of other European languages is an asset.
Proficient in data analysis tools such as Excel, Python, or similar software.
Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.
Strong research and analytical skills with attention to detail.
Interest in energy and environmental topics, including oil and gas, CCS, hydrogen, and GHG emissions.
Ability to communicate findings effectively in written and verbal formats.
Analytical and quantitative skills, including strong skills in data processing.
Interaction with IOGP Europe member companies and organizations
CIP allowance of €1,700 per month + a social advantages: ticket restaurant, Mobib monthly subscription pass, telephone plan, laptop, free access to fitness room in the office
Very enjoyable international and young team ambience
If you think that you want be part of this passionate and friendly team, please send your resume with a cover letter to show your motivations to: recruitment-europe@iogp.org by 6th June 2025.

IOGP Europe is recruiting a person who is currently pursuing or has recently completed a degree in data science, statistics, environmental studies or a related field who is highly motivated and interested in the energy industry.


This person will work closely with the all teams to analyze and visualize data, helping to make it more impactful while identifying underlying trends and patterns.


Key responsibilities mix:

  • Support policy, outreach and communication teams with relevant data to support advocacy towards external stakeholders.
  • Analyze and visualize data to identify trends and patterns.
  • Collect and organize datasets from reliable industry, governmental and EU/international institutional (Eurostat, IEA, OECD, World Bank etc.) sources.
  • Collaborate with team members to ensure data accuracy and relevance.
  • Prepare and format sections of the annual statistical report.
  • Monitor emerging trends in energy production, imports, and emissions.
  • Coordinate with the IOGP Secretariat in London to ensure alignment in data analysis


Qualifications:

  • Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Data Science, Statistics, Environmental Studies, Energy Engineering, or a related field.
  • Languages: Fluent in English. Knowledge of other European languages is an asset.
  • Skills:
  • Proficient in data analysis tools such as Excel, Python, or similar software.
  • Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.
  • Strong research and analytical skills with attention to detail.
  • Interest in energy and environmental topics, including oil and gas, CCS, hydrogen, and GHG emissions.
  • Ability to communicate findings effectively in written and verbal formats.
  • Analytical and quantitative skills, including strong skills in data processing.
column2:
What we offer

  • Experience in EU-oriented advocacy work
  • Interaction with IOGP Europe member companies and organizations
  • Room for initiative and growth
  • CIP allowance of €1,700 per month + a social advantages: ticket restaurant, Mobib monthly subscription pass, telephone plan, laptop, free access to fitness room in the office
column3: • Very enjoyable international and young team ambience
column4:
