4233962473,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/especialista-datos-y-mis-at-scotiabank-4233962473?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=TzNJypx31wjv8ugzn5AoVA%3D%3D&trackingId=x8%2FF8bOn1GxETG3x%2BKz11g%3D%3D,Especialista Datos Y Mis,Scotiabank,"Mex, Vaud, Switzerland","ID de la solicitud: 225567
Únase a un equipo ganador con un propósito claro, comprometido con el logro de resultados en una cultura inclusiva y de alto desempeño.
POR PROYECTO DE 12 MESES CON POSIBILIDAD DE EXTENDERSE A 30

Soportar los procesos operativos del HUB MX emitiendo reportes confiables que aseguren la comunicación y difusión de la información para la toma de decisiones y garantiza que las estrategias de negocios, planes e iniciativas se lleven a cabo o se cumplan de conformidad con las normas, políticas y procedimientos internos vigentes.
Explotar el Dataware House que contiene la información de los países de CA.

Diseñar, atender y documentar la solicitud de informes / reportes / desarrollos / métricas requeridas por los usuarios / áreas internas y externas del HUB MX, garantizando la calidad, utilidad y SLA establecidos.
Entender las necesidades del negocio y clientes internos para convertirlas en necesidades funcionales que permitan el desarrollo de soluciones automatizadas.
Generar documentación de solicitud de proyectos originados en el HUB MX con el alcance, requisitos y especificaciones funcionales utilizando la metodología PMO.
Atender la solicitud de informes / reportes / desarrollos / métricas requeridas por los usuarios / áreas internas y externas del HUBMX, garantizando la calidad, utilidad y SLA establecidos.
Atender el BAU y operación diaria, solución de problemas y atención a usuarios que dependan de la reportería de MIS en los SLA´s establecidos.

Validar el proceso de extracción de la información y preparación de reportes mediante pruebas selectivas, realizando cruces de información entre sistemas, aplicativos, bases de datos y otras fuentes de información cuando se considere necesario.
Asegurar que se cumple con los requisitos mínimos de integridad, confiabilidad y corrección de las fuentes de información para la elaboración de los reportes.
Generar KPI’s y Dashboards de acuerdo con los procesos operativos.
Lic. o Ing. en Sistemas, Informática, TI, Actuario o afín
Conocimiento y/o experiencia en SQL, Python, Power BI, Excel (indispensable)
Habilidad para crear bases de datos y su explotación
Disponibilidad los sábados en cierre de mes
Desarrollo profesional y crecimiento dentro del grupo Scotiabank
Zona de trabajo: Lorenzo Boturini, Cuauhtémoc – 100% presencial (disponibilidad los sábados en cierre de mes)
Agradecemos tu interés. Sin embargo, únicamente las personas seleccionadas para entrevista serán contactadas
Ubicación(s): México : Ciudad de México : Cuauhtémoc

Scotiabank es un banco líder en las Américas. Inspirándonos en nuestro propósito corporativo, “por nuestro futuro”, ayudamos a nuestros clientes, sus familias y sus comunidades a lograr el éxito a través de una completa gama de asesoría, productos y servicios en los sectores de banca personal y comercial, gestión patrimonial, banca privada, corporativa y de inversión, y mercados de capital.

En Scotiabank, valoramos las habilidades y experiencias únicas que cada persona aporta al Banco y nos hemos comprometido a crear y mantener un entorno inclusivo y accesible para todos. Si necesitas algún tipo de adaptación (como, por ejemplo, un lugar accesible para la entrevista, documentos en formato alternativo, un intérprete en lengua de señas o tecnología de asistencia, entre otras cosas) durante el proceso de reclutamiento y selección, indícalo a nuestro equipo de Reclutamiento. Si necesitas apoyo técnico, haz clic aquí. Los candidatos deben postularse directamente en línea si desean ser tomados en cuenta para este puesto. Agradecemos a todos los candidatos por su interés en esta oportunidad profesional en Scotiabank, pero solo nos comunicaremos con aquellos que hayan sidoseleccionados para una entrevista.

ID de la solicitud: 225567

Únase a un equipo ganador con un propósito claro, comprometido con el logro de resultados en una cultura inclusiva y de alto desempeño.

ESPECIALISTA DATOS Y MIS

POR PROYECTO DE 12 MESES CON POSIBILIDAD DE EXTENDERSE A 30

Propósito

Soportar los procesos operativos del HUB MX emitiendo reportes confiables que aseguren la comunicación y difusión de la información para la toma de decisiones y garantiza que las estrategias de negocios, planes e iniciativas se lleven a cabo o se cumplan de conformidad con las normas, políticas y procedimientos internos vigentes.

Actividades

  • Explotar el Dataware House que contiene la información de los países de CA.
  • Diseñar, atender y documentar la solicitud de informes / reportes / desarrollos / métricas requeridas por los usuarios / áreas internas y externas del HUB MX, garantizando la calidad, utilidad y SLA establecidos.
  • Entender las necesidades del negocio y clientes internos para convertirlas en necesidades funcionales que permitan el desarrollo de soluciones automatizadas.
  • Generar documentación de solicitud de proyectos originados en el HUB MX con el alcance, requisitos y especificaciones funcionales utilizando la metodología PMO.
  • Atender la solicitud de informes / reportes / desarrollos / métricas requeridas por los usuarios / áreas internas y externas del HUBMX, garantizando la calidad, utilidad y SLA establecidos.
  • Atender el BAU y operación diaria, solución de problemas y atención a usuarios que dependan de la reportería de MIS en los SLA´s establecidos.
  • Validar el proceso de extracción de la información y preparación de reportes mediante pruebas selectivas, realizando cruces de información entre sistemas, aplicativos, bases de datos y otras fuentes de información cuando se considere necesario.
  • Asegurar que se cumple con los requisitos mínimos de integridad, confiabilidad y corrección de las fuentes de información para la elaboración de los reportes.
  • Generar KPI’s y Dashboards de acuerdo con los procesos operativos.

Requisitos

  • Lic. o Ing. en Sistemas, Informática, TI, Actuario o afín
  • Conocimiento y/o experiencia en SQL, Python, Power BI, Excel (indispensable)
  • Inglés intermedio/avanzado (indispensable)
  • Habilidad para crear bases de datos y su explotación
  • Atención al detalle
  • Disponibilidad los sábados en cierre de mes

Ofrecemos

  • Sueldo competitivo
  • Contratación directa con la Institución
  • Prestaciones Superiores a la Ley
  • Desarrollo profesional y crecimiento dentro del grupo Scotiabank

Zona de trabajo: Lorenzo Boturini, Cuauhtémoc – 100% presencial (disponibilidad los sábados en cierre de mes)

Agradecemos tu interés. Sin embargo, únicamente las personas seleccionadas para entrevista serán contactadas

Ubicación(s): México : Ciudad de México : Cuauhtémoc

Scotiabank es un banco líder en las Américas. Inspirándonos en nuestro propósito corporativo, “por nuestro futuro”, ayudamos a nuestros clientes, sus familias y sus comunidades a lograr el éxito a través de una completa gama de asesoría, productos y servicios en los sectores de banca personal y comercial, gestión patrimonial, banca privada, corporativa y de inversión, y mercados de capital.

En Scotiabank, valoramos las habilidades y experiencias únicas que cada persona aporta al Banco y nos hemos comprometido a crear y mantener un entorno inclusivo y accesible para todos. Si necesitas algún tipo de adaptación (como, por ejemplo, un lugar accesible para la entrevista, documentos en formato alternativo, un intérprete en lengua de señas o tecnología de asistencia, entre otras cosas) durante el proceso de reclutamiento y selección, indícalo a nuestro equipo de Reclutamiento. Si necesitas apoyo técnico, haz clic aquí. Los candidatos deben postularse directamente en línea si desean ser tomados en cuenta para este puesto. Agradecemos a todos los candidatos por su interés en esta oportunidad profesional en Scotiabank, pero solo nos comunicaremos con aquellos que hayan sidoseleccionados para una entrevista.

Bist du ein erfahrener Data Engineer mit einer Leidenschaft für Daten und technische Innovation? Wir von Scigility unterstützen Unternehmen mit Strategie, Expertise und Umsetzung, eine datengetriebene Kultur zu etablieren. Dafür suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine:n Data Engineer, der moderne Data Solutions entwickelt und unsere Kunden in der digitalen Transformation begleitet. Bei Scigility setzen wir auf Zusammenarbeit und modernste Technologien. Wenn du bereit bist, dein Wissen einzubringen und innovative Datenprodukte zu gestalten, dann werde Teil unseres dynamischen Teams!

Möchtest du Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams sein, deine Ideen einbringen und Verantwortung übernehmen? Als Data Engineer entwickelst du skalierbare Datenpipelines, optimierst Datenarchitekturen und ermöglichst Kunden, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen.
Du bist für das Design, die Implementierung und Optimierung von Datenarchitekturen, Pipelines und Data Products zur Sicherstellung effizienter Analyse- und Transformationsprozesse zuständig.
Du wendest Ingestion Patterns und Best Practices in der Datenverarbeitung erfolgreich an.
Du verantwortest die technische Qualität, Implementierung und Optimierung von Testing-Strategien für Datenpipelines und -modelle.
Du bist zuständig für das Stakeholder-Management und die Kommunikation von Risiken, Herausforderungen und Lösungsansätzen.
Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Kunden hinsichtlich Anforderungsanalyse und technischer Umsetzung zusammen.
Du schulst und befähigst unsere Kunden-Teams zur effektiven Nutzung der entwickelten Lösungen.
Du stellst eine umfassende Dokumentation und den Wissenstransfer innerhalb des Teams sicher.
Du leistest einen wertvollen Beitrag zur Weiterentwicklung unseres internen Frameworks und der Verbesserung der Projektstandards und Best Practices.
Was dich zur idealen Besetzung macht:
Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Mindestens 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder Software Engineer mit Fokus auf Datenverarbeitung
Kenntnisse in Big Data- und verteilten Systemen wie Spark, Kafka, Flink, und Trino
Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Optimierung von Datenpipelines (Batch und Streaming) mit Technologien wie Airflow, Meltano oder NiFi
Erfahrung mit Cloud-Technologien, idealerweise in mehr als einer Plattform (Azure, AWS, GCP, Cloudera) und sowohl On-Prem- als auch Cloud-Umgebungen
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten, Problemlösungskompetenz und eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe
Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations-, Teamfähigkeiten und Stakeholder Management Skills
Bereitschaft, vor Ort beim Kunden zu arbeiten
Sehr gute Deutsch- (C2) und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Französisch von Vorteil
Erfahrung in der Beratung und im Umgang mit Kundenprojekten
Kenntnisse im Bereich Data Governance, Compliance und regulatorischen Anforderungen
Erfahrung mit Container- und Orchestrierungstechnologien wie OpenShift, Kubernetes oder Docker
Software-Engineering-Hintergrund, Erfahrung mit weiteren Sprachen wie Java, Scala sind ein Plus
🚀 Bereit für die nächste Herausforderung? Werde Teil von Scigility und gestalte die Zukunft der Datenarchitektur mit uns!

Data Engineer

Zürich/Fribourg


Bist du ein erfahrener Data Engineer mit einer Leidenschaft für Daten und technische Innovation? Wir von Scigility unterstützen Unternehmen mit Strategie, Expertise und Umsetzung, eine datengetriebene Kultur zu etablieren. Dafür suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine:n Data Engineer, der moderne Data Solutions entwickelt und unsere Kunden in der digitalen Transformation begleitet. Bei Scigility setzen wir auf Zusammenarbeit und modernste Technologien. Wenn du bereit bist, dein Wissen einzubringen und innovative Datenprodukte zu gestalten, dann werde Teil unseres dynamischen Teams!



So schaffst du Mehrwert

Möchtest du Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams sein, deine Ideen einbringen und Verantwortung übernehmen? Als Data Engineer entwickelst du skalierbare Datenpipelines, optimierst Datenarchitekturen und ermöglichst Kunden, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen.


Deine Hauptaufgaben:

  • Du bist für das Design, die Implementierung und Optimierung von Datenarchitekturen, Pipelines und Data Products zur Sicherstellung effizienter Analyse- und Transformationsprozesse zuständig.
  • Du wendest Ingestion Patterns und Best Practices in der Datenverarbeitung erfolgreich an.
  • Du verantwortest die technische Qualität, Implementierung und Optimierung von Testing-Strategien für Datenpipelines und -modelle.
  • Du bist zuständig für das Stakeholder-Management und die Kommunikation von Risiken, Herausforderungen und Lösungsansätzen.
  • Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Kunden hinsichtlich Anforderungsanalyse und technischer Umsetzung zusammen.
  • Du schulst und befähigst unsere Kunden-Teams zur effektiven Nutzung der entwickelten Lösungen.
  • Du stellst eine umfassende Dokumentation und den Wissenstransfer innerhalb des Teams sicher.
  • Du leistest einen wertvollen Beitrag zur Weiterentwicklung unseres internen Frameworks und der Verbesserung der Projektstandards und Best Practices.


Was dich zur idealen Besetzung macht:

  • Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
  • Mindestens 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder Software Engineer mit Fokus auf Datenverarbeitung
  • Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse in Python
  • Kenntnisse in Big Data- und verteilten Systemen wie Spark, Kafka, Flink, und Trino
  • Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Optimierung von Datenpipelines (Batch und Streaming) mit Technologien wie Airflow, Meltano oder NiFi
  • Erfahrung mit Cloud-Technologien, idealerweise in mehr als einer Plattform (Azure, AWS, GCP, Cloudera) und sowohl On-Prem- als auch Cloud-Umgebungen
  • Starke analytische Fähigkeiten, Problemlösungskompetenz und eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe
  • Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations-, Teamfähigkeiten und Stakeholder Management Skills
  • Bereitschaft, vor Ort beim Kunden zu arbeiten
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- (C2) und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Französisch von Vorteil



Optionale Superkräfte:

  • Erfahrung in der Beratung und im Umgang mit Kundenprojekten
  • Kenntnisse im Bereich Data Governance, Compliance und regulatorischen Anforderungen
  • Erfahrung mit Container- und Orchestrierungstechnologien wie OpenShift, Kubernetes oder Docker
  • Software-Engineering-Hintergrund, Erfahrung mit weiteren Sprachen wie Java, Scala sind ein Plus


🚀 Bereit für die nächste Herausforderung? Werde Teil von Scigility und gestalte die Zukunft der Datenarchitektur mit uns!

4234993558,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-analytics-intern-6-months-at-mcm-worldwide-4234993558?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=TzNJypx31wjv8ugzn5AoVA%3D%3D&trackingId=Wjaq6w5C5fiLB0MuTWPrtw%3D%3D,Digital Analytics Intern (6-months),MCM WORLDWIDE,"Zug, Switzerland","ABOUT MCM (MODERN CREATION MÜNCHEN):

MCM is a luxury lifestyle goods and fashion house founded in 1976 with an attitude defined by the cultural Zeitgeist and its German heritage with a focus on functional innovation, including the use of cutting-edge techniques. Today, through its association with music, art, travel and technology, MCM embodies the bold, rebellious and aspirational. Always with an eye on the disruptive, the driving force behind MCM centers on revolutionizing classic design with futuristic materials. Appealing to the 21st Century Global Nomad generation - dreamers, creatives and digital natives - MCM’s millennial and Gen Z audience is genderless, ageless, empowered and unconstrained by rules and boundaries.
MCM is currently distributed online and in 650 stores worldwide including Munich, Berlin, Zurich, London, Paris, New York, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Beijing, Seoul, Tokyo, Middle East and more.

With a highly collaborative workforce working from offices and stores around the world, MCM established a multinational/multicultural organization. To uphold the culture & value of MCM, we intend to fulfil our corporate social responsibility by implementing the following values and to comply with high degree of legitimacy and ethical standards.

Our employees make the best efforts to become high-performing individuals who reflect the diversity of the communities in which we work and live. MCM’s commitment to diversity and inclusion includes recruiting and retaining employees from diverse backgrounds and experiences, creating awareness of diversity issues and benefits, and fostering a supportive environment where inclusivity is expected and prioritized. We have zero tolerance in any form of harassment, insultation, ostracization or groundless defamation of any other person.

As a Digital Analytics Intern at MCM, you'll work closely with the Head of Data Excellence to analyze digital data and help enhance MCM's online presence, marketing strategies, and user experience. In collaboration with the marketing, product, and data teams, you will track and evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs), generate actionable insights, and contribute to the optimization of digital campaigns. Your work will directly support MCM in making data-driven decisions that shape the future of the brand’s digital engagement.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various digital sources (e.g. Google Analytics 4, social media, CRM systems and others).
Assist in tracking and reporting website performance in terms of traffic, engagement and conversion.
Collaborate with teams to implement tagging and tracking solutions using tools like Google Tag Manager.
Create dashboards and visual reports to communicate insights effectively.
Monitor and identify trends, patterns, and opportunities to enhance digital performance.
Assist in competitor and industry benchmarking analysis.
Support A/B testing initiatives and provide recommendations based on findings.
Currently pursuing a degree in Marketing, Business Analytics, Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
Basic understanding of Digital Analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager or Adobe Analytics (preferred but not required).
Good proficiency in Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets
Basic experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI).
Detail-oriented with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Strong communication skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Knowledge of SQL, Python, or R is a plus but not required.
Knowledge and experience of foundational web technologies (e.g. HTML5, CSS, JavaScript) is a plus but not required.
Hands-on experience with real-world digital analytics projects.
Exposure to industry-leading analytics tools and best practices.
Mentorship and networking opportunities within the industry.
A chance to contribute to meaningful digital strategy decisions.
Sound like your kind of challenge? Step into the future with MCM and apply now!

Experience &

4235364632,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-marketplace-coordinator-napapijri-at-napapijri-4235364632?position=19&pageNum=0&refId=TzNJypx31wjv8ugzn5AoVA%3D%3D&trackingId=3kYC1zsA9d29NEOepZaf5w%3D%3D,Digital Marketplace Coordinator (Napapijri),Napapijri,"Stabio, Ticino, Switzerland","Napapijri is looking for an exceptional Digital Marketplace Coordinator to join our Digital Strategic Account team based in Stabio, Switzerland.

For over 30 years, Napapijri has pioneered the future of fashion. From our Italian beginnings, innovating outdoor apparel in the shadow of Monte Bianco, to tackling nature’s most challenging environments on polar expeditions, our desire to lead the way is what makes us who we are. As a premium outdoor lifestyle brand, we provide an urban outdoor aesthetic combined with functionality and comfort for an eco-conscious consumer.

You as a Digital Marketplace Coordinator will be responsible for the end-to-end catalogue onboarding and maintenance process for some of our primary Digital Marketplaces (Zalando, Aboutyou, Veepee). You will also be supporting sales campaign order entry management and off-price deals execution.

You will be fundamental in getting Napapijri products available to sell on external platforms in timely manner, actively overseeing sample and imagery flows as well as identifying optimisation opportunities. You will make the difference by working closely with internal and external partners, building strong business relationships.

Furthermore, in this role you will be key supporting Napapijri HQ salesforce during sales campaign through sales order entry, materials preparation and ad hoc reporting. Finally, you will also support Digital off-price business execution from operational activities to order management.
How You Will Make a Difference
Holistically manage the assortments onboarding process throughout the entire lifecycle of products (onboarding, offboarding, seasonal retagging, etc.)
Overseeing the sample and imagery process for Digital Accounts across both concession and wholesale model
Optimize the assortments visibility across different Marketplace platforms.

Build a strong and close collaboration with all relevant counterparts/stakeholders within the organization as well as external stakeholders to enable a fast and smooth product onboarding flow to maximize the inventory window.
Improve existing processes, tools, reporting and implement new ones in support of the day-to-day business.
Napapijri HQ Sales team support during sales campaign. From reporting to order entry management
Support on off price business management, from stocklist generation to shipments execution
You should be comfortable prioritizing your own workload, detailed oriented and have a passion for optimization, with:
Analytical and commercial mindset, great attention to detail.
Strong MS Office proficiency (especially MS Excel), familiarity with BI systems is a plus (IBM Cognos, SAP Business Objects).
Strong organisational skills, proactive attitude, ability to work cross-functionally in fast-paced environments.
2-3 year experience in digital operations, business analysis, planning or sales support roles would be preferrable.

A formal education and subsequent University bachelor’s or master’s degree in business management or engineering are nice to have, but we are most interested in your overall experience, professional achievements and motivation.

VF is a global apparel company connecting people to the lifestyles they cherish through our family of iconic brands. At the heart of our journey lies our purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It’s the reason we come to work every day. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Learn more at vfc.com

We’re in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That’s why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we’re the total package.
A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together
Be part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi brand, multi countries organization
On site gym offering health and well-being initiatives
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands
Break out areas offering complimentary hot drinks

As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.
As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, VF is committed to support disadvantaged groups whilst providing equal opportunities for both VF associates and applicants alike.
If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

Napapijri is looking for an exceptional Digital Marketplace Coordinator to join our Digital Strategic Account team based in Stabio, Switzerland.

For over 30 years, Napapijri has pioneered the future of fashion. From our Italian beginnings, innovating outdoor apparel in the shadow of Monte Bianco, to tackling nature’s most challenging environments on polar expeditions, our desire to lead the way is what makes us who we are. As a premium outdoor lifestyle brand, we provide an urban outdoor aesthetic combined with functionality and comfort for an eco-conscious consumer.

Let’s Talk About The Role

You as a Digital Marketplace Coordinator will be responsible for the end-to-end catalogue onboarding and maintenance process for some of our primary Digital Marketplaces (Zalando, Aboutyou, Veepee). You will also be supporting sales campaign order entry management and off-price deals execution.

You will be fundamental in getting Napapijri products available to sell on external platforms in timely manner, actively overseeing sample and imagery flows as well as identifying optimisation opportunities. You will make the difference by working closely with internal and external partners, building strong business relationships.

Furthermore, in this role you will be key supporting Napapijri HQ salesforce during sales campaign through sales order entry, materials preparation and ad hoc reporting. Finally, you will also support Digital off-price business execution from operational activities to order management.

How You Will Make a Difference

You will achieve this by:

  • Holistically manage the assortments onboarding process throughout the entire lifecycle of products (onboarding, offboarding, seasonal retagging, etc.)
  • Overseeing the sample and imagery process for Digital Accounts across both concession and wholesale model
  • Optimize the assortments visibility across different Marketplace platforms.
  • Build a strong and close collaboration with all relevant counterparts/stakeholders within the organization as well as external stakeholders to enable a fast and smooth product onboarding flow to maximize the inventory window.
  • Improve existing processes, tools, reporting and implement new ones in support of the day-to-day business.
  • Napapijri HQ Sales team support during sales campaign. From reporting to order entry management
  • Support on off price business management, from stocklist generation to shipments execution

Skills For Success

You should be comfortable prioritizing your own workload, detailed oriented and have a passion for optimization, with:

  • Analytical and commercial mindset, great attention to detail.
  • Strong MS Office proficiency (especially MS Excel), familiarity with BI systems is a plus (IBM Cognos, SAP Business Objects).
  • Strong organisational skills, proactive attitude, ability to work cross-functionally in fast-paced environments.
  • 2-3 year experience in digital operations, business analysis, planning or sales support roles would be preferrable.

A formal education and subsequent University bachelor’s or master’s degree in business management or engineering are nice to have, but we are most interested in your overall experience, professional achievements and motivation.

VF is a global apparel company connecting people to the lifestyles they cherish through our family of iconic brands. At the heart of our journey lies our purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It’s the reason we come to work every day. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Learn more at vfc.com

What’s In It For You

We’re in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That’s why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we’re the total package.

  • A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do
  • An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together
  • Be part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi brand, multi countries organization
  • On site gym offering health and well-being initiatives
  • A discount card with 50% on all VF brands
  • Break out areas offering complimentary hot drinks

Free to Be, Inclusion &
column2:
Diversity

As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.

As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, VF is committed to support disadvantaged groups whilst providing equal opportunities for both VF associates and applicants alike.

If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

4236856702,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-consultant-artificial-intelligence-data-ai-insights-focus-at-deloitte-4236856702?position=21&pageNum=0&refId=TzNJypx31wjv8ugzn5AoVA%3D%3D&trackingId=KYAuGs%2Bg8d%2FANy52Xh5Yzg%3D%3D,Business Analyst/ Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data (AI & Insights Focus),Deloitte,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Job Description
You bring ambition, we provide opportunities.
Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.
How You Can Make An Impact
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars
Design data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent
Passionate individuals looking to make a career in Consulting
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems
Business-IT Translator: Proficient in leading requirement analysis and acting as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions
Technical design: Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
Familiarity with Python. Experience with R is a plus
First practical experience with Generative AI, AI, Machine Learning and/or Analytics solutions is recommended
Experience with data science workbench tools such as Snowflake, Databricks and Dataiku is a plus

column2: fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders

column1: First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .
We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.
If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch

We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria
column2: don’t hold yourself back – apply today.

Experience working with structured and unstructured data at scale.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop, optimize, and manage large-scale data pipelines using Cloudera tools (Impala, Hive, Spark, HDFS, Sqoop).
  • Work with large datasets to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data efficiently.
  • Perform data wrangling, cleansing, and performance tuning of queries.
  • Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and application teams to deliver robust data solutions.
  • Implement data governance, security, and best practices in data engineering processes.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot job performance and data quality issues.
  • Automate workflows and data pipelines using Unix shell scripting.

Divbrands is a global, remote-working e-commerce company. We focus on data-driven decision-making to launch unique D2C apparel brands to specific audiences across the globe. Because of our intense research and targeting process, we only launch when we know a brand will succeed. With divbranders from different countries, we embody a company culture that is vibrant, diverse, playful, and performance-driven.

We research, develop, and build our own brands online. We specialize in creative production with regional creative hubs that make agile, data-backed creatives that convert sales. Each brand, product, and piece of creative content is ""glocalised"" for our various local, regional, and nationally diverse customers around the globe. We believe that online shopping behaviour never stays the same.

Consumers face a rapidly changing social, economic, and retail environment, demanding that brands become versatile, data-based, and driven by actual user behaviour. Divbrands has been doing this for over seven years - our mission is to achieve the most satisfying e-commerce experience for the modern shopper, wherever they might be.
We are looking for a Data Engineer to:
Collaborate on the design, development, and optimization of scalable data pipelines, data warehouses, and lakes, ensuring data quality, governance, and alignment with business needs.
Act as a technical reference for the team, offering expertise in data architecture, pipeline optimization, and scalability challenges, driving data quality best practices.

We are looking for people with experience working with orchestration and data ingestion tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, Prefect) and proficiency in data transformation using DBT. Additionally knowledge of distributed data processing frameworks like Apache Spark and experience with Databricks is a plus.

As a Data Engineer, you will help maintain the architecture, development, and optimization of scalable data pipelines, data warehouses, and data lakes that form the backbone of our analytics infrastructure. You'll act as a technical reference, solving complex data challenges and ensuring that our systems are both robust and scalable. You will play a critical role in maintaining the integrity and reliability of our datasets, enabling the business to make data-driven decisions confidently.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to translate business needs into actionable analytical datasets. You'll drive the adoption of cutting-edge tools and frameworks, improving efficiency and maintainability across the data engineering function.
Our big data processing and storage are powered by Google Cloud and Databricks
We manage data ingestion and orchestration with Apache Airflow, Airbyte and Fivetran.
Data transformation is handled through DBT
Our infrastructure is hosted on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
For this role we expect someone with at least 2 years of hands-on experience in data engineering or similar roles.
Advanced skills in Python and SQL, with the ability to write efficient queries and scripts for data manipulation.
Expertise with DBT for data transformation.
Experience with orchestration pipeline tools such as Apache Airflow, Prefect.
Familiarity with cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
Strong knowledge of database design principles and modern data architectures. Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and services like Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake, or ClickHouse.
Experience with Databricks and with distributed data processing frameworks such as Apache Spark, Dask, Flink, or similar is a plus
Experience with Docker and Terraform is a plus
Good communication skills to effectively interact with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Problem-solving ability, with a focus on finding innovative and scalable solutions.
Competitive salary with regular performance evaluations
Highly skilled colleagues to learn from
Training and development towards cloud certification (professional level)
Apply for the position here. We expect you to send a CV and GitHub link. We might ask for other materials during the process.
How long is the contract for? This is a full-time permanent contract with a trial period of 6 months.
What does the process look like?
Initially, you'll have a screening interview with our HR team, followed by an interview with the Head of Data.
Next, you'll complete a live test, which should take no more than 40 minutes. Finally, you will have a concluding interview with the CTO.
We expect the process to take 2-3 weeks. We try to keep it lean and straightforward.
Can I expect feedback if not considered?
Unfortunately, at least during the initial stages, we can't give feedback to everyone who applies.
Do you work with external recruiters or outsourcing agencies?
No. Please refrain from sending us an offer for your services.

About Us

Divbrands is a global, remote-working e-commerce company. We focus on data-driven decision-making to launch unique D2C apparel brands to specific audiences across the globe. Because of our intense research and targeting process, we only launch when we know a brand will succeed. With divbranders from different countries, we embody a company culture that is vibrant, diverse, playful, and performance-driven.

We research, develop, and build our own brands online. We specialize in creative production with regional creative hubs that make agile, data-backed creatives that convert sales. Each brand, product, and piece of creative content is ""glocalised"" for our various local, regional, and nationally diverse customers around the globe. We believe that online shopping behaviour never stays the same.

Consumers face a rapidly changing social, economic, and retail environment, demanding that brands become versatile, data-based, and driven by actual user behaviour. Divbrands has been doing this for over seven years - our mission is to achieve the most satisfying e-commerce experience for the modern shopper, wherever they might be.

In a nutshell:

We are looking for a Data Engineer to:

  • Collaborate on the design, development, and optimization of scalable data pipelines, data warehouses, and lakes, ensuring data quality, governance, and alignment with business needs.
  • Act as a technical reference for the team, offering expertise in data architecture, pipeline optimization, and scalability challenges, driving data quality best practices.
  • We are looking for people with experience working with orchestration and data ingestion tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, Prefect) and proficiency in data transformation using DBT. Additionally knowledge of distributed data processing frameworks like Apache Spark and experience with Databricks is a plus.


What will you do?

As a Data Engineer, you will help maintain the architecture, development, and optimization of scalable data pipelines, data warehouses, and data lakes that form the backbone of our analytics infrastructure. You'll act as a technical reference, solving complex data challenges and ensuring that our systems are both robust and scalable. You will play a critical role in maintaining the integrity and reliability of our datasets, enabling the business to make data-driven decisions confidently.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to translate business needs into actionable analytical datasets. You'll drive the adoption of cutting-edge tools and frameworks, improving efficiency and maintainability across the data engineering function.

What's the stack?

  • Programming languages: Python and SQL
  • Our big data processing and storage are powered by Google Cloud and Databricks
  • We manage data ingestion and orchestration with Apache Airflow, Airbyte and Fivetran.
  • Data transformation is handled through DBT
  • Our infrastructure is hosted on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).


Desired Skills and qualifications:

For this role we expect someone with at least 2 years of hands-on experience in data engineering or similar roles.

Technical Skills:

  • Advanced skills in Python and SQL, with the ability to write efficient queries and scripts for data manipulation.
  • Expertise with DBT for data transformation.
  • Experience with orchestration pipeline tools such as Apache Airflow, Prefect.
  • Familiarity with cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
  • Strong knowledge of database design principles and modern data architectures. Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and services like Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake, or ClickHouse.
  • Experience with Databricks and with distributed data processing frameworks such as Apache Spark, Dask, Flink, or similar is a plus
  • Experience with Docker and Terraform is a plus


Soft Skills:

  • Good communication skills to effectively interact with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Problem-solving ability, with a focus on finding innovative and scalable solutions.


What's in it for me?

  • Fully remote
  • Competitive salary with regular performance evaluations
  • High-growth e-commerce career &

    Apply for the position here. We expect you to send a CV and GitHub link. We might ask for other materials during the process.

    FAQ

    • How long is the contract for? This is a full-time permanent contract with a trial period of 6 months.
    • What does the process look like?


    Initially, you'll have a screening interview with our HR team, followed by an interview with the Head of Data.

    Next, you'll complete a live test, which should take no more than 40 minutes. Finally, you will have a concluding interview with the CTO.

    We expect the process to take 2-3 weeks. We try to keep it lean and straightforward.

    • Can I expect feedback if not considered?


    Unfortunately, at least during the initial stages, we can't give feedback to everyone who applies.

    • Do you work with external recruiters or outsourcing agencies?


    No. Please refrain from sending us an offer for your services.

Il/elle joue un rôle clé dans la réussite des projets en assurant la liaison entre les utilisateurs finaux et les équipes techniques.
Renforcement de l’équipe de Business Analyst dans le cadre de projets prioritaire dans la stratégie de transformation digitale de l’entreprise.

Maîtrise des outils bureautiques (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
Connaissance des outils de gestion de projet (JIRA, Confluence, Trello…).

Afin de renforcer l'équipe Dynamic 365 CRM de notre client, et également des outils web collaboratifs, nous recherchons un/e Business Analyst Junior, dont la mission principale sera d’accompagner les équipes métiers et techniques dans l’analyse, la formalisation et l’optimisation des processus et des besoins fonctionnels.

Il/elle joue un rôle clé dans la réussite des projets en assurant la liaison entre les utilisateurs finaux et les équipes techniques.

Objectif de la mission :

Renforcement de l’équipe de Business Analyst dans le cadre de projets prioritaire dans la stratégie de transformation digitale de l’entreprise.

Responsabilités

  • Recueillir, analyser et formaliser les besoins métiers.
  • Participer à la rédaction des cahiers des charges fonctionnels.
  • Contribuer à la modélisation des processus métiers (BPMN, UML…).
  • Collaborer avec les équipes de développement pour assurer la bonne compréhension des besoins.
  • Participer aux phases de tests (rédaction de cas de tests, exécution, suivi des anomalies).
  • Accompagner les utilisateurs lors de la phase de recette et de déploiement.
  • Assurer une veille fonctionnelle et technologique sur les outils et méthodes d’analyse.

Requirements

  • Connaissance des méthodes d’analyse fonctionnelle (UML, BPMN…).
  • Maîtrise des outils bureautiques (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
  • Connaissance des outils de gestion de projet (JIRA, Confluence, Trello…).
  • Notions en SQL ou outils de BI (un plus).

Educations et Certifications

  • Bac +3 à Bac +5 en informatique, gestion, systèmes d’information ou école de commerce.
  • Une première expérience (stage ou alternance) en tant que BA ou dans un rôle similaire est un plus.

4235447029,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/cat-data-and-tools-analyst-6-month-contract-at-partnerre-4235447029?position=27&pageNum=0&refId=TzNJypx31wjv8ugzn5AoVA%3D%3D&trackingId=k7YKdwyEiAJFgKqzdiq5zw%3D%3D,Cat Data and Tools Analyst (6 month contract),PartnerRe,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","PartnerRe is a leading, privately owned, multi-line global reinsurer with a reputation of financial stability and strength, and a commitment to rebuilding businesses and communities after risk events around the world.

Our mission is to continue to be a financially stable and predictable business partner, supporting our clients with solutions tailored to their needs, delivering superior returns to our owner, providing rewarding opportunities for our people and making a positive contribution to society. To achieve this, we live by our values of Integrity, Performance, Collaboration, Straightforward Communication and Respect and Care.

Core to The PartnerRe Experience is our global nature. No matter where you sit in the company, you are part of something bigger. Our teams represent our truly international mindset, forging connections across office locations and all levels of the organization and building a network of mutual success. The result is a day-to-day experience that will allow you to:
Connect with a community of experts
View Home - PartnerRe Experience e-book to find out more about what it’s like to work at PartnerRe.
We are always looking for bright, proactive individuals to join our team!
Please follow our Careers page for all updates on new positions. We look forward to receiving your application.
PartnerRe is an equal opportunities employer.
Please join our company LinkedIn Page for all updates on new positions that are coming live.

The position is within the Cat Tools and Technology team, which is part of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office responsible for research, modeling, pricing, and portfolio analytics of natural catastrophes (Cat).
The Tools and Technology team is leading the developments of all the Cat applications in collaboration with IT to drive innovation and efficiency in managing risk of natural catastrophes.
This temporary role supports the Cat Tools and Technology team in ongoing projects focusing on improving the reporting and analytics capabilities of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office unit.
In more detail your main tasks are to:
Enhance our existing reporting dashboard to improve efficiency and accuracy in assessing data quality and drivers of portfolio changes.
Replace existing Excel reports and integrate them into R Shiny dashboard.
Automate the production of existing reports through R Markdown.
The role will be based in Zurich.
You are passionate to apply your strong quantitative skills to the development of tools supporting the automation of processes and delivering business solutions.
The ideal candidate would have the following qualifications and personal qualities:
Master degree in computer science, data science, natural sciences (Climatology, Hydrology, Seismology, or similar), or a related quantitative field
Strong programming skills in R or Python and knowledge in databases (e.g., SQL or Snowflake)
Knowledge of R Shiny and R Markdown is a plus
Interest in data manipulation and data visualization
Pro-active, solution oriented with a high level of self initiative
Ability to work well in a team and to contribute towards common goals

PartnerRe provides a working environment in which diversity is valued, where all employees feel welcome, respected, and empowered to perform at their best. We invite you to learn more about D&I at PartnerRe.

PartnerRe is a leading, privately owned, multi-line global reinsurer with a reputation of financial stability and strength, and a commitment to rebuilding businesses and communities after risk events around the world.

Our mission is to continue to be a financially stable and predictable business partner, supporting our clients with solutions tailored to their needs, delivering superior returns to our owner, providing rewarding opportunities for our people and making a positive contribution to society. To achieve this, we live by our values of Integrity, Performance, Collaboration, Straightforward Communication and Respect and Care.

Core to The PartnerRe Experience is our global nature. No matter where you sit in the company, you are part of something bigger. Our teams represent our truly international mindset, forging connections across office locations and all levels of the organization and building a network of mutual success. The result is a day-to-day experience that will allow you to:

Shape your own career

Grow in a supportive environment

Connect with a community of experts

Make an impact

View Home - PartnerRe Experience e-book to find out more about what it’s like to work at PartnerRe.

We are always looking for bright, proactive individuals to join our team!

Please follow our Careers page for all updates on new positions. We look forward to receiving your application.

PartnerRe is an equal opportunities employer.

Please join our company LinkedIn Page for all updates on new positions that are coming live.



Job Description

About this job:

The position is within the Cat Tools and Technology team, which is part of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office responsible for research, modeling, pricing, and portfolio analytics of natural catastrophes (Cat).

The Tools and Technology team is leading the developments of all the Cat applications in collaboration with IT to drive innovation and efficiency in managing risk of natural catastrophes.



About the role:

This temporary role supports the Cat Tools and Technology team in ongoing projects focusing on improving the reporting and analytics capabilities of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office unit.

In more detail your main tasks are to:

  • Enhance our existing reporting dashboard to improve efficiency and accuracy in assessing data quality and drivers of portfolio changes.
  • Replace existing Excel reports and integrate them into R Shiny dashboard.
  • Automate the production of existing reports through R Markdown.

The role will be based in Zurich.



Qualifications

About you:

You are passionate to apply your strong quantitative skills to the development of tools supporting the automation of processes and delivering business solutions.

The ideal candidate would have the following qualifications and personal qualities:

  • Master degree in computer science, data science, natural sciences (Climatology, Hydrology, Seismology, or similar), or a related quantitative field
  • Strong programming skills in R or Python and knowledge in databases (e.g., SQL or Snowflake)
  • Knowledge of R Shiny and R Markdown is a plus
  • Interest in data manipulation and data visualization
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Pro-active, solution oriented with a high level of self initiative
  • Ability to work well in a team and to contribute towards common goals
  • Proficient (written and verbal) in English

Additional Information





PartnerRe provides a working environment in which diversity is valued, where all employees feel welcome, respected, and empowered to perform at their best. We invite you to learn more about D&
column2:
I at PartnerRe.

Thank you,

PartnerRe Hiring Team

4238536499,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/it-business-analyst-at-swissma-s%C3%A0rl-4238536499?position=30&pageNum=0&refId=TzNJypx31wjv8ugzn5AoVA%3D%3D&trackingId=zYLXNLHk3GHesMDP7XU06w%3D%3D,IT Business Analyst,swissma Sàrl,"Wollerau, Schwyz, Switzerland","﻿Über uns

Wir sind ein spezialisiertes IT-Consulting-Unternehmen mit Fokus auf Begleitung & Umsetzung anspruchsvoller Digitalisierungsprojekte in der öffentlichen Verwaltung sowie bei Banken und Versicherungen. Wir arbeiten professionell, verlässlich und innovativ. Für ein spannendes Projekt in der öffentlichen Verwaltung suchen wir zwei erfahrene Business Analyst:innen / Requirements Engineers, die Lust haben, sich weiterzuentwickeln, zu gestalten und zu bewegen.

Als Business Analyst:in / Requirements Engineer analysierst du die Anforderungen unserer Kunden, planst und begleitest die Umsetzung und sorgst für eine effiziente Kommunikation zwischen Fachbereichen / Stakeholdern und IT. Dabei übernimmst du gemeinsam mit deinem Team u. a. folgende Aufgaben:
•   Erhebung, Analyse und Dokumentation fachlicher und technischer Anforderungen
•   Planung und Moderation von Workshops, Durchführung von Stakeholder-Interviews
•   Erstellung von Konzepten, Modellen, Entscheidgrundlagen & Projektdokumentationen nach etablierten Standards
•   Übersetzung von Business-Anforderungen in ICT-spezifische Anforderungen
•   Mitarbeit bei der Konzeption und Entwicklung von Lösungsvarianten
•   Begleitung der Umsetzung der designten Prozesse inklusive Qualitätssicherung durch Testing
•   Anwenden von Human Centered Design (HCD) Ansätzen zur Sicherstellung der Kundenzentrierung
•   Unterstützung bei Change-Management-Massnahmen, Schulungen und Rollouts
•   Aufbereitung und Präsentation von Ergebnissen gegenüber verschiedenen Zielgruppen
•   Förderung einer kooperativen, zielorientierten Arbeitsweise mit allen Beteiligten
•   Hochschul- oder Fachhochschulabschluss in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Betriebswirtschaft oder vergleichbar
•   Mind. 3 Jahre Erfahrung als Business Analyst:in / Requirements Engineer in IT-Projekten
•   Mind. 2 Jahre Erfahrung im öffentlichen Sektor und/oder in Grossbetrieben
•   Fundierte Kenntnisse Modellierung & Dokumentation (z.B. UML, BPMN, Innovator, Jira, Confluence)
•   Erfahrung mit agilen, hybriden und klassischen Methoden wie Scrum, Kanban, SAFe, Hermes (mit Zertifizierung)
•   Analytische Denkweise, strukturierte Arbeitsweise und hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein
•   Englisch und / oder Französischkenntnisse auf mind. B2-Niveau
•   Hohe Selbstständigkeit & Verlässlichkeit – unser Arbeitsmodell basiert auf Eigenverantwortung, Wertschätzung und Vertrauen.
•   Mitwirkung an Schlüsselprojekten in der öffentlichen Verwaltung, bei Banken oder Versicherungen
•   Zugang zu einem spannenden Netzwerk & unserer Community of Practices
•   Sehr viel Freiheit in der Aufgabenerfüllung mit Raum für Eigeninitiative
•   Zusammenarbeit auf Augenhöhe in interdisziplinären Teams
•   Flexibles Arbeiten – remote und vor Ort beim Kunden (1-2 Tage pro Woche)
•   Persönliche Weiterentwicklung durch Trainings und Zertifizierungen (z. B. IREB, SAFe)
Wenn du Lust hast auf spannende Projekte, Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, viel Freiraum und ein anregendes Netzwerk – dann sende uns deine Unterlagen inkl. Verfügbarkeit. Wir melden uns!

column1: As a Junior BI Manager/Expert, you will contribute to the design, implementation, and optimization of business intelligence solutions. You will work closely with data engineers, analysts, and business stakeholders to build reliable, scalable, and insightful BI systems.
Design and develop data models and structures in BI/DWH systems
Monitor and maintain data quality, consistency, and availability
Prepare and visualize data insights for management and business units
Support implementation of ETL pipelines and reporting frameworks
Participate in agile project teams delivering data-driven initiatives
Contribute to technical documentation and data flow mapping
Collaborate with business users to understand requirements and refine solutions
We are looking for a curious and structured individual with a strong interest in data and analytics.
University degree in Business Informatics, Computer Science, Data Science, or similar
Initial experience or training in data modeling, BI platforms, or data warehouses
Familiarity with tools like Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, or similar
Understanding of ETL processes, SQL, and data management concepts
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving mindset
Business-oriented approach with clear communication skills
Self-motivated, team-oriented, and willing to learn
Permanent position in a dynamic consulting firm
Exposure to major Swiss clients and industries

Junior Business Intelligence Manager / Expert



Company: Cleeven IT

Location: Switzerland (hybrid / client-site depending on project)

Contract Type: Permanent, Full-Time

Languages Required: English (C1 or higher)
column2:
German

Eligibility: EU citizens/residents only



Your Responsibilities



As a Junior BI Manager/Expert, you will contribute to the design, implementation, and optimization of business intelligence solutions. You will work closely with data engineers, analysts, and business stakeholders to build reliable, scalable, and insightful BI systems.


Key Tasks:


  • Design and develop data models and structures in BI/DWH systems
  • Monitor and maintain data quality, consistency, and availability
  • Prepare and visualize data insights for management and business units
  • Support implementation of ETL pipelines and reporting frameworks
  • Participate in agile project teams delivering data-driven initiatives
  • Contribute to technical documentation and data flow mapping
  • Collaborate with business users to understand requirements and refine solutions



Your Profile


We are looking for a curious and structured individual with a strong interest in data and analytics.


Qualifications:


  • University degree in Business Informatics, Computer Science, Data Science, or similar
  • Initial experience or training in data modeling, BI platforms, or data warehouses
  • Familiarity with tools like Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, or similar
  • Understanding of ETL processes, SQL, and data management concepts
  • Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving mindset
  • Business-oriented approach with clear communication skills
  • Self-motivated, team-oriented, and willing to learn




What We Offer



  • Permanent position in a dynamic consulting firm
  • Exposure to major Swiss clients and industries
  • Multicultural and collaborative team environment

4237766935,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/environmental-data-analyst-internship-1-august-2025-12-months-in-basel-at-roche-4237766935?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=TzNJypx31wjv8ugzn5AoVA%3D%3D&trackingId=A6896fnJlMNsI7Ylh8DpAA%3D%3D,"Environmental Data Analyst Internship (1 August 2025, 12 months in Basel)",Roche,"Basel, Basel, Switzerland","At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love.

Global chemical and environmental regulations play a vital role in every stage of a product’s lifecycle, from development and manufacturing to usage and disposal. At Roche Pharma Technical Operations, we are uniting our expertise and expanding our capabilities to ensure strong compliance with these important regulations.

Join a dynamic, international team at the forefront of product environmental compliance. As an intern, you will actively support data management processes related to Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) within the Pharma Division.

You’ll gain hands-on experience by contributing to ongoing projects, helping to shape global processes, and transforming data into meaningful insights. Based on your interests and growth, you may even take ownership of specific tasks and workstreams. This is more than just an internship — it’s a launchpad into the world of global pharmaceutical operations.
Contribute to activities and projects focused on EHS data management and product compliance
Support team workshops and collaborative sessions
Create and maintain internal data repositories and communication tools
Help design and optimize global procedures and processes

You are enrolled or have completed your Bachelor’s or Master’s degree at a university within the past 12 months prior to the start date, preferably in the field of Environmental or Life Sciences, Chemistry, Biology, Pharmacy, or a related field
Interest in data analytics or data science
Ability to work with cross-functional and international teams
Knowledge in environmental or chemical regulations is a plus
Strong communication and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for details
Curious mindset, self-starter attitude, and comfort with ambiguity and managing multiple priorities
Familiarity with Lean, Six Sigma, or Agile methodologies is a plus
Ability to present complex information in a clear, visual way and excellent spoken and written English
column2: German is a plus

column1: Your complete application includes the following documents:
A Current CV and a Motivation Letter

Due to regulations, non-EU/EFTA citizens must provide a certificate from the university stating that an internship is mandatory as part of the application documents, and must be continuously enrolled in their university program for the whole duration of this internship

If you are proud of contributing and feel you have the dedication to teamwork and innovation that we are seeking, then Roche is the organization for you. Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference to patients’ lives. If you want to work in a passionate team, make your mark & improve lives, apply now!

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.
Let’s build a healthier future, together.
Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love.

That’s what makes us Roche.

About Us
Global chemical and environmental regulations play a vital role in every stage of a product’s lifecycle, from development and manufacturing to usage and disposal. At Roche Pharma Technical Operations, we are uniting our expertise and expanding our capabilities to ensure strong compliance with these important regulations.

The Opportunity:

Join a dynamic, international team at the forefront of product environmental compliance. As an intern, you will actively support data management processes related to Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) within the Pharma Division.

You’ll gain hands-on experience by contributing to ongoing projects, helping to shape global processes, and transforming data into meaningful insights. Based on your interests and growth, you may even take ownership of specific tasks and workstreams. This is more than just an internship — it’s a launchpad into the world of global pharmaceutical operations.

Key Responsibilities/Tasks:

  • Contribute to activities and projects focused on EHS data management and product compliance
  • Support team workshops and collaborative sessions
  • Collect, structure, and analyse data
  • Create and maintain internal data repositories and communication tools
  • Help design and optimize global procedures and processes

Who You are:

  • You are enrolled or have completed your Bachelor’s or Master’s degree at a university within the past 12 months prior to the start date, preferably in the field of Environmental or Life Sciences, Chemistry, Biology, Pharmacy, or a related field

Furthermore, You are/ You have:

  • Interest in data analytics or data science
  • Ability to work with cross-functional and international teams
  • Knowledge in environmental or chemical regulations is a plus
  • Strong communication and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for details
  • Curious mindset, self-starter attitude, and comfort with ambiguity and managing multiple priorities
  • Familiarity with Lean, Six Sigma, or Agile methodologies is a plus
  • Ability to present complex information in a clear, visual way and excellent spoken and written English
column2:
German is a plus

Your complete application includes the following documents:

  • A Current CV and a Motivation Letter
  • Due to regulations, non-EU/EFTA citizens must provide a certificate from the university stating that an internship is mandatory as part of the application documents, and must be continuously enrolled in their university program for the whole duration of this internship

Administrative data:

  • Start date: 1 August
  • Duration: 12 months, full-time (40 hours/ week)
  • Location: Basel

4236860042,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-consultant-artificial-intelligence-data-ai-insights-focus-at-deloitte-4236860042?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=TzNJypx31wjv8ugzn5AoVA%3D%3D&trackingId=qwLU5zoRD5lEkmdvttfwPg%3D%3D,Business Analyst/ Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data (AI & Insights Focus),Deloitte,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","Job Description
You bring ambition, we provide opportunities.
Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.
How You Can Make An Impact
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars
Design data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent
Passionate individuals looking to make a career in Consulting
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems
Business-IT Translator: Proficient in leading requirement analysis and acting as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions
Technical design: Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
Familiarity with Python. Experience with R is a plus
First practical experience with Generative AI, AI, Machine Learning and/or Analytics solutions is recommended
Experience with data science workbench tools such as Snowflake, Databricks and Dataiku is a plus

column2: fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders

column1: First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .
We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.
If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch

We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria
column2: don’t hold yourself back – apply today.

serenIT est une agence de recrutement/placement de spécialistes IT
Notre objectif est de concilier professionnalisme et éthique.
Dans le cadre de nos activités de recrutement, nous recherchons pour notre client, un(e)

As a Master Data Specialist, you will play a crucial role in overseeing and optimizing the organization's master data management processes. You will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of master data across various systems, platforms and regions. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to establish and enforce data governance standards, drive data quality initiatives, and implement best practices for master data management.
You will be in charge of:
Develop and implement global master data management strategies, policies, and procedures to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across the organization.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify master data requirements and establish data governance frameworks.
Drive continuous improvement initiatives to optimize master data processes, workflows, and systems.
Monitor data quality metrics and performance indicators to identify areas for improvement and take corrective actions as needed.
Coordinate both data migration & systems integration projects and ensure smooth implementations.
Provide training and support to end-users on master data management best practices and tools.
Stay updated on industry trends, regulations, and emerging technologies related to master data management.
Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and IT teams to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Academic degree related to IT or similar qualification.
Depth knowledge of master data management regarding to various systems (Salesforce, Centrix, Anaplan, Power BI…) and ERP (SAP S/4 HANA).
Proven experience (5 years) in master data management, data governance, or a related role.
Experience with data modeling, metadata management, and data profiling.
Strong communication skills and ability to present complex IT issues in a way that is appropriate for the target group and to win others over to your plans – fluent in French and English.
You must be eligible to work in Switzerland (i.e. Swiss or EU citizen or valid Swiss work permit)
Pour tout renseignement et/ou envoi de candidature : cedric.gerber[at]serenit-ets.ch ou linkedin

Merci de ne pas postuler si vous n’êtes pas de nationalité suisse, européenne ou au bénéfice d’un permis de travail CH

  • Provide training and support to end-users on master data management best practices and tools.

column4:
Profile:

  • Academic degree related to IT or similar qualification.
  • Depth knowledge of master data management regarding to various systems (Salesforce, Centrix, Anaplan, Power BI…) and ERP (SAP S/4 HANA).
  • Proven experience (5 years) in master data management, data governance, or a related role.
  • Experience with data modeling, metadata management, and data profiling.
  • Analytical mindset with problem-solving abilities.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to present complex IT issues in a way that is appropriate for the target group and to win others over to your plans – fluent in French and English.
  • Project Management experience preferred.
