column1: Please note that in order to be considered for this position, candidates must have work authorization in Switzerland, be a graduate from a bachelor or masters in 2024-2025 and speak English and German. All applications that do not meet these minimum requirements will not be considered for this program.
We offer you an exciting professional career in one of the leading and fastest-growing multinational telecommunication companies
Personal Development is ensured through training and workshop opportunities throughout the first six months
Firsthand experience in customer engagement and new technology innovation
Challenging and diverse assignments that enable you to develop your personal and professional strengths continuously
Mentor/Buddy Program: A mentor that will guide you through both business and intercultural development
After onboarding, internal networking activities with other fresh Graduates take place regularly

Huawei is a leading global information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices provider. With integrated solutions across four key domains – telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services – we are committed to bringing digital to every person, home, and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

At Huawei, innovation focuses on customer needs. We invest heavily in basic research, concentrating on technological breakthroughs that drive the world forward. We have over 207,000 employees and operate in more than 170 countries and regions.

Huawei's end-to-end portfolio of products, solutions, and services is competitive and secure. Through open collaboration with ecosystem partners, we create lasting value for our customers, working to empower people, enrich home life, and inspire innovation in organizations of all shapes and sizes.

Start your career with Huawei’s Fresh Graduate Program

 Job Title:

Zurich, Switzerland

You will be part of the Huawei Switzerland Delivery &

Graduate Program in Switzerland:

We offer you an exciting professional career in one of the leading and fastest-growing multinational telecommunication companies

Personal Development is ensured through training and workshop opportunities throughout the first six months

Firsthand experience in customer engagement and new technology innovation

Challenging and diverse assignments that enable you to develop your personal and professional strengths continuously

Competitive Salary package

After onboarding, internal networking activities with other fresh Graduates take place regularly

About Huawei

Huawei is a leading global information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices provider. With integrated solutions across four key domains – telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services – we are committed to bringing digital to every person, home, and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

At Huawei, innovation focuses on customer needs. We invest heavily in basic research, concentrating on technological breakthroughs that drive the world forward. We have over 207,000 employees and operate in more than 170 countries and regions.

Huawei's end-to-end portfolio of products, solutions, and services is competitive and secure. Through open collaboration with ecosystem partners, we create lasting value for our customers, working to empower people, enrich home life, and inspire innovation in organizations of all shapes and sizes.

4233642067,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/it-support-intern-or-apprentice-for-hq-based-in-geneva-link-for-external-applicants-at-impact-initiatives-4233642067?position=42&pageNum=0&refId=TzNJypx31wjv8ugzn5AoVA%3D%3D&trackingId=xSvKILc%2BvuwfrWpNPg%2Bn%2BQ%3D%3D,"IT support intern or apprentice for HQ, based in Geneva (Link For External Applicants)",IMPACT Initiatives,"Vernier, Geneva, Switzerland","BACKGROUND ON IMPACT AND REACH

IMPACT Initiatives is a humanitarian NGO, based in Geneva, Switzerland. The organisation manages several initiatives, including the REACH Initiative. The IMPACT team comprises specialists in data collection, management and analysis, GIS and remote sensing. IMPACT was launched at the initiative of ACTED, an international NGO whose headquarter is based in Paris and is present in thirty countries. The two organizations have a strong complementarity formalized in a global partnership, enabling IMPACT to benefit from ACTED’s operational support on its fields of intervention.
We are currently looking for a IT support intern or apprentice to support our team in Geneva:
Position: IT support intern or apprentice

The IT support intern / apprentice will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation of our IT systems. Their proactive approach to problem-solving and dedication to IT support will be invaluable to our team.
Provide troubleshooting and support for hardware and software issues.
Manage user accounts and access within Active Directory (AD).
Oversee the configuration and maintenance of SharePoint, Teams, and Planner.
Support end users and process day-to-day JIRA tickets.
The IT support intern / apprentice will:
Serve as the primary contact for IT-related issues concerning laptops and Microsoft applications.
Proactively identify and resolve IT issues.
Provide timely support and troubleshooting for hardware and software problems.
Support end users and manage JIRA tickets effectively.
Set up and configure new laptops for employees.
Ensure all necessary software and security updates are installed.
Perform regular maintenance and troubleshooting of hardware issues.
Manage user accounts and permissions within AD.
Provide timely and effective support to end users.
Address and resolve user issues related to IT systems and applications.
Basic knowledge of IT systems and hardware.
Familiarity with Microsoft applications (SharePoint, Teams, Planner).
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks.
Good communication skills for end-user support.
[OPTIONAL] Understanding of Active Directory (AD) configuration and management.
[OPTIONAL] Experience with JIRA or similar ticketing systems is a plus.

For this position, gross salary is 1’450 CHF monthly (before income tax). NB – IMPACT salaries are strictly determined by our salary grid depending on the grade of the position and the level of education and experience of staff. A contribution to medical insurance of 520 CHF per month is already included in the salary figure.
Insurance covering professional and non-professional accidents throughout the period of employment with IMPACT
Health insurance, life insurance and repatriation assistance in case of field visits/temporary deployments
Enrolment in IMPACT Initiatives Research Foundational Learning Programme within the first 3 months from the start of contract.
Up to 40% of remote work on a weekly basis.

BACKGROUND ON IMPACT AND REACH

IMPACT Initiatives is a humanitarian NGO, based in Geneva, Switzerland. The organisation manages several initiatives, including the REACH Initiative. The IMPACT team comprises specialists in data collection, management and analysis, GIS and remote sensing. IMPACT was launched at the initiative of ACTED, an international NGO whose headquarter is based in Paris and is present in thirty countries. The two organizations have a strong complementarity formalized in a global partnership, enabling IMPACT to benefit from ACTED’s operational support on its fields of intervention.

We are currently looking for a IT support intern or apprentice to support our team in Geneva:

Department: IT/DT

Position: IT support intern or apprentice

Contract duration: 12 months

Location: Geneva

Starting Date: 15/07/2024

INTERNSHIP / APPRENTICESHIP

The IT support intern / apprentice will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation of our IT systems. Their proactive approach to problem-solving and dedication to IT support will be invaluable to our team.

OBJECTIVES

  • Provide troubleshooting and support for hardware and software issues.
  • Manage user accounts and access within Active Directory (AD).
  • Oversee the configuration and maintenance of SharePoint, Teams, and Planner.
  • Support end users and process day-to-day JIRA tickets.

Responsibilities

The IT support intern / apprentice will:

  • Serve as the primary contact for IT-related issues concerning laptops and Microsoft applications.
  • Proactively identify and resolve IT issues.
  • Provide timely support and troubleshooting for hardware and software problems.
  • Support end users and manage JIRA tickets effectively.

SCOPE OF WORK

LAPTOP INSTALLATION AND MAINTENANCE

  • Set up and configure new laptops for employees.
  • Ensure all necessary software and security updates are installed.
  • Perform regular maintenance and troubleshooting of hardware issues.

MICROFOST APPLICATIONS MANAGEMENT

  • Manage user accounts and permissions within AD.
  • Provide support for Microsoft-related issues.

END USER SUPPORT

  • Provide timely and effective support to end users.
  • Address and resolve user issues related to IT systems and applications.

Requirements

  • Basic knowledge of IT systems and hardware.
  • Familiarity with Microsoft applications (SharePoint, Teams, Planner).
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks.
  • Good communication skills for end-user support.
  • Fluency in English is required
  • [OPTIONAL] Understanding of Active Directory (AD) configuration and management.
  • [OPTIONAL] Experience with JIRA or similar ticketing systems is a plus.

Compensation And Benefits

  • For this position, gross salary is 1’450 CHF monthly (before income tax). NB – IMPACT salaries are strictly determined by our salary grid depending on the grade of the position and the level of education and experience of staff. A contribution to medical insurance of 520 CHF per month is already included in the salary figure.
  • Insurance covering professional and non-professional accidents throughout the period of employment with IMPACT
  • Health insurance, life insurance and repatriation assistance in case of field visits/temporary deployments
  • Enrolment in IMPACT Initiatives Research Foundational Learning Programme within the first 3 months from the start of contract.
  • Up to 40% of remote work on a weekly basis.

4234433159,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/market-consumer-insights-specialist-at-nestl%C3%A9-nespresso-sa-4234433159?position=43&pageNum=0&refId=TzNJypx31wjv8ugzn5AoVA%3D%3D&trackingId=gKT6S%2BfMQdVLGXLL80Ji8w%3D%3D,Market & Consumer Insights Specialist,Nestlé Nespresso SA,"La Tour-de-Peilz, Vaud, Switzerland","At Nespresso Switzerland, we believe that we can elevate the world of coffee to drive a positive impact and be a force for good. Voted best employer 2025, we place our people at the heart of our success – all 14,000 of them. To achieve this, we live by four behaviors. We Inspire, we Care, we Act, and we iNnovate. Want to be part of this exciting journey? Join the Nespresso team- Reimagine what coffee can be. Reimagine what you can become.
Exciting opportunities to develop your career your way
Flexible working arrangements - facilitating creativity and collaboration
A culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging where individuality is celebrated, and you can be the real you!
Quality and sustainability at the core of who we are and a critical vision of driving positive change
The opportunity to be part of a B Corp certified company and one of the world’s most trusted brands
Don’t hesitate to connect with us during the recruitment process to learn more.

As a “Market & Consumer Insights Specialist”, you will drive the market's agenda by leveraging consumer and category data and insights to ensure successful brand building, product performance, and the achievement of objectives. By assisting 'generating demand' teams in answering key business questions, you will provide outstanding market analyses and trends. Your expertise will encompass insights through ad hoc research, data visualization, and relevant recommendations that are instrumental in delivering superior understanding of the market, category, consumer, shopper, and brand.
A Day in the Life of a Market & Consumer Insights Specialist
Gather and process data to deliver monthly business reports using Nielsen RMS/CPS and GfK panel data.
Support management with data requests and regular market share/performance analysis updates.
Share and align recommendations with Nestlé in the Market teams.
Translate data from multiple sources into actionable business insights for the teams.
Build product expertise and monitor the competitive environment and brand health/performance.
Implement learning plans aligned with business priorities
column2: propose methodologies and conduct market research with external agencies.

column1: Maintain and optimize Market Research tools to build and share a knowledge base.
Act as the contact point for international market research, including consumer selection and summarizing insights for management.
Develop deep consumer knowledge from internal and external sources and share it with cross-functional stakeholders.
Track consumer feedback and develop actionable insights for the business.
Assist brand builders in understanding core insights of the target audience.
Serve as the voice of the consumer and collaborate with teams to enhance consumer centricity.
University degree in Marketing or equivalent
At least 5-6 years of experience in Consumer and Market Insights (agency and/or client side)
Experience in qualitative and quantitative research techniques
Experience using Nielsen GT/GTC data and consumer panels
Fluent in English & French, any other language is an asset.

Nespresso is committed to the accessibility of its recruitment process. If you require an adaptation during the recruitment process, please do let us know so we can support you effectively. All information will be treated confidentially.

At Nespresso, we’ve built a culture of care and inclusion, making sure everyone can be their bold selves, while growing with the company. We innovate, dare to try, learn and scale up in a fast paced, digital and connected environment. With a diverse workforce made up of over 90 nationalities across 58 countries, you can be a part of an innovative culture, where supportive people help each other. One where anyone is encouraged to challenge the status quo and have an impact on the future for one of the biggest sustainable companies. Whatever your role, you’ll find you can drive real change and spread your enthusiasm. Join the place where you can thrive, you feel, you belong, you are inspired to be and do your best.

At Nespresso Switzerland, we believe that we can elevate the world of coffee to drive a positive impact and be a force for good. 4233729017,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-at-qim-info-4233729017?position=44&pageNum=0&refId=TzNJypx31wjv8ugzn5AoVA%3D%3D&trackingId=u9meL22N6FSjYIqOcAN8jw%3D%3D,Business analyst,Qim info,"Romandy, Valais, Switzerland","Société d’ingénierie informatique et de services du numérique créée en 2004, Qim info est implantée en Suisse 🇨🇭 (Genève, Lausanne, Zurich & Bâle) et en France 🇫🇷 (Annecy, Lyon & Paris). Appartenant au groupe MoOngy, l’entreprise bénéficie aussi d’un réseau de développement international 🌐.

3e entreprise informatique de Suisse romande (ICT Journal), Qim info c’est surtout un ensemble de consultant.e.s capables d’intervenir à tous les niveaux d’un système d’information sur différents métiers (Études & Développement 💻, Fonctionnel 🔧, Infrastructures & Réseaux 🌐, Data 📊, DevOps 🚀...) et différents secteurs d’activités (Banque 🏦, Finance 💰, Assurance 📜, Luxe ✨, Retail 🛍️, Aéronautique ✈️...).
Avec plus de 650 collaborateurs, nous sommes toujours à la recherche de nouveaux talents ! 🌟
Nous recrutons actuellement un Business analyste pour accompagner les équipes de notre client.

Start date: Ideally 01.09.2025 or as soon as possible

The UEFA Academy Programme Coordinator plays a key role in the design, coordination and delivery of educational initiatives across UEFA. This position involves close collaboration with various UEFA divisions and units to ensure that learning programmes are strategically aligned, pedagogically sound and operationally effective.
Acting as the primary liaison between the UEFA Academy and other UEFA divisions/units to co-develop and implement educational programmes
Serving as a learning and development business partner, engaging in frequent consultations with other divisions and units to support the development of educational initiatives

Coordinating the pedagogical and logistical delivery of existing flagship initiatives, including: UEFA Football Law Programme, Fight the Fix, Sustainability in Football compact course and Innovation in Action
Coordinating the creation and delivery of bespoke educational programmes tailored to the needs of external stakeholders (e.g. national associations, clubs, private organisations)
Ensuring each programme is aligned with the UEFA Academy’s standards of excellence and stakeholder expectations
For each programme, the Programme Coordinator's role typically includes:
Co-designing and refining the programme's structure, content and pedagogical approach in cooperation with internal and external partners
Producing support materials and resources for the programme
Overseeing promotion and the recruitment process
Coordinating logistical elements, including venue booking, accommodation, catering, transport and event set-up
Managing the programme's budget, ensuring cost-effectiveness and financial accountability
More generally, optimising the learning journey of programme participants and maximising the impact of the programme on both participants and their organisations
At least three years of experience in vocational education and/or learning and development
Experience in international organisations, ideally in sports
Experience in organising seminars and other types of events
Any other major international language: A strong asset
Knowledge of AI tools and able to use them confidently
Comfortable and energised working in multicultural environments
Ability to handle tight deadlines and stressful situations
Available and willing to travel for official trips
Broad curiosity and eagerness to learn
Highly collaborative and committed to the success of others
Willingness to experiment, take risks and continuously challenge oneself
Want to stay updated on our latest job opportunities, events, and behind-the-scenes insights? Join us on LinkedIn.

UEFA welcomes applications from all, actively working to ensure that we are an inclusive employer that finds the best candidate for our positions, regardless of aspects such as sex, gender identification, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity or nationality.

Job information

Division/Unit: National Associations / UEFA Academy

Contract type: Permanent

Start date: Ideally 01.09.2025 or as soon as possible

Application deadline: 02.06.2025

Main goal

The UEFA Academy Programme Coordinator plays a key role in the design, coordination and delivery of educational initiatives across UEFA. This position involves close collaboration with various UEFA divisions and units to ensure that learning programmes are strategically aligned, pedagogically sound and operationally effective.

Key Responsibilities

Coordinating programmes across divisions

  • Acting as the primary liaison between the UEFA Academy and other UEFA divisions/units to co-develop and implement educational programmes
  • Serving as a learning and development business partner, engaging in frequent consultations with other divisions and units to support the development of educational initiatives
  • Coordinating the pedagogical and logistical delivery of existing flagship initiatives, including: UEFA Football Law Programme, Fight the Fix, Sustainability in Football compact course and Innovation in Action

Developing on-demand education

  • Coordinating the creation and delivery of bespoke educational programmes tailored to the needs of external stakeholders (e.g. national associations, clubs, private organisations)
  • Ensuring each programme is aligned with the UEFA Academy’s standards of excellence and stakeholder expectations

Programme Coordination Responsibilities

For each programme, the Programme Coordinator's role typically includes:

  • Co-designing and refining the programme's structure, content and pedagogical approach in cooperation with internal and external partners
  • Producing support materials and resources for the programme
  • Overseeing promotion and the recruitment process
  • Coordinating logistical elements, including venue booking, accommodation, catering, transport and event set-up
  • Managing the programme's budget, ensuring cost-effectiveness and financial accountability
  • More generally, optimising the learning journey of programme participants and maximising the impact of the programme on both participants and their organisations

Requirements

Experience:

  • At least three years of experience in vocational education and/or learning and development
  • Experience in international organisations, ideally in sports
  • Experience in organising seminars and other types of events

Education:

  • Master’s degree

Languages:

  • English: Proficient
  • French: A strong asset
  • Any other major international language: A strong asset

Other requirements:

  • Knowledge of AI tools and able to use them confidently
  • Excellent presentation skills
  • Strong project management skills
  • Comfortable and energised working in multicultural environments
  • Ability to handle tight deadlines and stressful situations
  • Service-orientated
  • Available and willing to travel for official trips
  • Broad curiosity and eagerness to learn
  • Highly collaborative and committed to the success of others
  • Willingness to experiment, take risks and continuously challenge oneself

Want to stay updated on our latest job opportunities, events, and behind-the-scenes insights? Join us on LinkedIn.

UEFA welcomes applications from all, actively working to ensure that we are an inclusive employer that finds the best candidate for our positions, regardless of aspects such as sex, gender identification, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity or nationality.

Optiml is revolutionizing real estate with our Real Estate Decision Intelligence (REDI) software—a new category of AI-powered technology that helps decarbonize buildings while optimizing asset & portfolio performance.
Since our launch in April 2024, we have been scaling across Europe and the US, receiving significant industry recognition and winning three major PropTech awards, including:
🏆 2024 ULI Europe PropTech of the Year
We are backed by $6M in pre-seed funding from top-tier US and EU funds, including Innovation Endeavors (the fund of former Google CEO Eric Schmidt), Planet A, BitStone, and Kompas.

We are seeking a motivated, independent, and detail-oriented Executive Assistant (Admin / Support) with Accounting background to support our growing ETH Zurich Spin-off. You’ll play a pivotal role in assuring that our company functions as well as our innovative product.

You’d be excited to work in a dynamic, friendly, fast-growing startup. You speak & write in German and English on a professional level. You bring a systems- and process-oriented mindset, excellent organizational skills, and good time management. You want to take responsibility for office operations and accounting, plus a few ad-hoc tasks (e.g. travel coordination, team event organization) that may change on a weekly basis. Your superpower is that you tame the chaos, because you live & breathe structure and never lose the overview. Sounds like you? Read on…

Accounting tasks, including booking of bills /invoices, payments to suppliers, monitoring and reconciliation of bank accounts, expense management, recording and control of cash flows and payments in Xero, etc. → all of this required for the countries of Switzerland, EU countries (e.g. Germany), United Kingdom, and the US
Overseeing the day-to-day operations of Optiml to ensure efficiency in all administrative processes including office management, mail services, HR Admin, coordination with service providers
Data management, e.g. of the company's customer relation management databases in Hubspot
Support in reporting, in the preparation of board and management documents and briefings, coordination of stakeholders, also internationally
Providing personal support to Founders & senior team such as supporting to managing calendars, scheduling appointments and organizing meetings
Supporting in organizing travel arrangements, including booking flights, accommodation and transportation
Planning and coordinating events and social occasions for Optiml team
Professional competence: Accounting background & sound knowledge in the field of business administration (ideally with Xero)
Organization and Time Management: Strong organization and time management skills, proven track record of managing multiple responsibilities and delivering high quality results
Communication: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, especially communicating effectively with various stakeholders in English and German preferred
Discretion and Confidentiality: High level of discretion and ability to handle sensitive information confidentially
Problem solving: Independent, detail-oriented way of thinking and working
column2: ability to solve challenges quickly and effectively

column1: Swiss or EU citizenship (unfortunately due to size, we can’t support non-EU)
Direct impact on sustainability, in an innovative startup from the early days
Fully remote and hybrid options feasible
Flexible working hours on an hourly contract (20-40%, potential to ramp up over time) to accommodate your schedule

Conducete procedure di asilo e di espulsione in conformità con le basi giuridiche nazionali e internazionali e interrogate i richiedenti asilo sui motivi della loro fuga.

La Segreteria di Stato della migrazione (SEM) è competente per le questioni di diritto migratorio in Svizzera. il settore Asilo della SEM esamina e decide sulle domande d'asilo presentate in Svizzera.

La Divisione Procedura d'asilo e Prassi (DPAP) garantisce le informazioni necessarie per una pratica d'asilo uniforme, aggiornata e giuridicamente corretta in relazione ai paesi di origine e alle tematiche specialistiche.
Lavorare per la SvizzeraCi adoperiamo per il modello di successo svizzero e lavoriamo per il benessere della popolazione.
Vivere la diversitàLa concretizzazione delle pari opportunità ci consente di esprimere al meglio le nostre competenze e di contemplare punti di vista differenti.
In forma sul posto di lavoroForniamo supporto e consulenza alle nostre collaboratrici e ai nostri collaboratori sulla tematica della salute fisica e mentale.
Per il momento il posto è limitato fino al 31.12.2025, con possibilità di proroga.

Segreteria di Stato della migrazione SEM, 80-100%, Berna e lavoro a domicilio

Il contributo che può dare

  • Condurre audizioni rilevanti ai fini della procedura d'asilo
  • Redigere decisioni motivate d'asilo e di allontanamento in lingua tedesca
  • Trattare ulteriori compiti nell'ambito della procedura d'asilo e di ricorso (misure istruttorie specifiche al caso, richieste alle ambasciate, diritto di audizione, consultazioni con il Tribunale amministrativo federale, accertamenti d'identità)
  • Gestire la corrispondenza con autorità e organizzazioni esterne all'Amministrazione federale e con i fornitori di servizi per la tutela giuridica nella procedura ampliata

Che cosa La contraddistingue

  • un diploma universitario (laurea, master), preferibilmente in giurisprudenza
  • ottime capacità redazionali e spiccato pensiero analitico e concettuale
  • un comportamento sicuro, elevata motivazione al rendimento e resilienza
  • prontezza di comprensione, capacità di lavorare in modo autonomo e mirato
  • buona conoscenza di una seconda lingua ufficiale e dell'inglese

In sintesi

Conducete procedure di asilo e di espulsione in conformità con le basi giuridiche nazionali e internazionali e interrogate i richiedenti asilo sui motivi della loro fuga.

La migrazione ci riguarda

La Segreteria di Stato della migrazione (SEM) è competente per le questioni di diritto migratorio in Svizzera. il settore Asilo della SEM esamina e decide sulle domande d'asilo presentate in Svizzera.

La Divisione Procedura d'asilo e Prassi (DPAP) garantisce le informazioni necessarie per una pratica d'asilo uniforme, aggiornata e giuridicamente corretta in relazione ai paesi di origine e alle tematiche specialistiche.

Che cosa offriamo

Lavorare per la SvizzeraCi adoperiamo per il modello di successo svizzero e lavoriamo per il benessere della popolazione.

Vivere la diversitàLa concretizzazione delle pari opportunità ci consente di esprimere al meglio le nostre competenze e di contemplare punti di vista differenti.

In forma sul posto di lavoroForniamo supporto e consulenza alle nostre collaboratrici e ai nostri collaboratori sulla tematica della salute fisica e mentale.

Informazioni complementari

Per il momento il posto è limitato fino al 31.12.2025, con possibilità di proroga.

Wir suchen einen MES-Spezialisten, der unser Projektteam langfristig beim Hypercare-Support im Rahmen der Einführung des PharmaSuite MES bei einem weltweit führenden Pharmaunternehmen in Basel unterstützt.

In dieser Festanstellung arbeiten Sie direkt im Produktionsumfeld und helfen dabei, die Systemstabilität und Performance nach dem Go-Live zu sichern. Vorkenntnisse mit PharmaSuite sind nicht erforderlich, jedoch wird fundierte praktische Erfahrung mit anderen Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) sowie ein gutes Verständnis pharmazeutischer Herstellprozesse in einem GMP-regulierten Umfeld erwartet.
Onsite-Unterstützung während der Hypercare-Phase des PharmaSuite MES-Rollouts.
Schnittstelle zwischen IT, Produktion, Qualitätssicherung und Automation.
First- und Second-Level-Support für Anwender im Produktionsumfeld.
Analyse und Behebung von Problemen im Zusammenhang mit Batch-Ausführungen, Datenflüssen und Nutzerinteraktionen.
Unterstützung bei Schulungen, Nutzerunterstützung und Prozessoptimierungen.
Pflege und Unterstützung bei Dokumentations-Updates, Abweichungsberichten und Änderungsprozessen.
Fundierte Erfahrung mit MES-Systemen (z. B. PAS-X, Syncade, Opcenter, Simatic IT).
Vertrautheit mit Electronic Batch Records (EBR) und pharmazeutischen Produktionsprozessen.
Kenntnisse in ISA-95, MES-ERP-Integration und Automatisierungsprozessen.
Analytisches Denkvermögen und eine lösungsorientierte, pragmatische Arbeitsweise.
Ausgezeichnete Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und Teamfähigkeit in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
Fliessende Deutschkenntnisse (mind. C1) und berufliches Englisch sind erforderlich.
Berufserfahrung in der Pharma-, Biotech- oder Chemiebranche.
Kenntnisse in CSV, 21 CFR Part 11 oder Validierungsprozessen.
Eine Festanstellung mit langfristiger Perspektive in einem bedeutenden Pharmaumfeld.
Die Möglichkeit, sich in PharmaSuite MES einzuarbeiten und zu spezialisieren.
Mitarbeit bei einem der weltweit führenden Pharmaunternehmen mit Standort in Basel.
Eine kollegiale Teamkultur, attraktive Vergütung und hervorragende Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten.

MES-Spezialist (PharmaSuite-Projekt – Festanstellung)



Standort: Basel, Schweiz

Vertragsart: Festanstellung, Vollzeit

Branche: Pharma / Life Sciences

Sprachen: Fliessendes Deutsch (C1+), Englisch (Berufsniveau)

Starttermin: Ab sofort oder nach Vereinbarung




Über die Stelle



Wir suchen einen MES-Spezialisten, der unser Projektteam langfristig beim Hypercare-Support im Rahmen der Einführung des PharmaSuite MES bei einem weltweit führenden Pharmaunternehmen in Basel unterstützt.


In dieser Festanstellung arbeiten Sie direkt im Produktionsumfeld und helfen dabei, die Systemstabilität und Performance nach dem Go-Live zu sichern. Vorkenntnisse mit PharmaSuite sind nicht erforderlich, jedoch wird fundierte praktische Erfahrung mit anderen Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) sowie ein gutes Verständnis pharmazeutischer Herstellprozesse in einem GMP-regulierten Umfeld erwartet.




Ihre Aufgaben



  • Onsite-Unterstützung während der Hypercare-Phase des PharmaSuite MES-Rollouts.
  • Schnittstelle zwischen IT, Produktion, Qualitätssicherung und Automation.
  • First- und Second-Level-Support für Anwender im Produktionsumfeld.
  • Analyse und Behebung von Problemen im Zusammenhang mit Batch-Ausführungen, Datenflüssen und Nutzerinteraktionen.
  • Unterstützung bei Schulungen, Nutzerunterstützung und Prozessoptimierungen.
  • Sicherstellung der Einhaltung von GMP/GxP-Vorgaben.
  • Pflege und Unterstützung bei Dokumentations-Updates, Abweichungsberichten und Änderungsprozessen.





Ihr Profil



  • Fundierte Erfahrung mit MES-Systemen (z. B. PAS-X, Syncade, Opcenter, Simatic IT).
  • Vertrautheit mit Electronic Batch Records (EBR) und pharmazeutischen Produktionsprozessen.
  • Kenntnisse in ISA-95, MES-ERP-Integration und Automatisierungsprozessen.
  • Analytisches Denkvermögen und eine lösungsorientierte, pragmatische Arbeitsweise.
  • Ausgezeichnete Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und Teamfähigkeit in einem dynamischen Umfeld.
  • Fliessende Deutschkenntnisse (mind. C1) und berufliches Englisch sind erforderlich.





Wünschenswert (kein Muss)



  • Erfahrung mit Rockwell PharmaSuite MES.
  • Berufserfahrung in der Pharma-, Biotech- oder Chemiebranche.
  • Kenntnisse in CSV, 21 CFR Part 11 oder Validierungsprozessen.





Was wir bieten



  • Eine Festanstellung mit langfristiger Perspektive in einem bedeutenden Pharmaumfeld.
  • Die Möglichkeit, sich in PharmaSuite MES einzuarbeiten und zu spezialisieren.
  • Mitarbeit bei einem der weltweit führenden Pharmaunternehmen mit Standort in Basel.
  • Eine kollegiale Teamkultur, attraktive Vergütung und hervorragende Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten.

Position Summary As a Generative AI Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, building, and deploying AI driven solutions with a focus on generative AI models. This is a remote and freelance opportunity for people residing in Croatia.
You will work closely with cross-functional teams to create tools and systems that improve efficiency, enhance customer experiences, and drive business value.

This role demands a sense of ownership and a strong commitment to developing innovative solutions. You'll be instrumental in driving projects from conception to deployment, ensuring they deliver measurable value to the organization.
Model Customization: Leverage Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques to customize large language models (LLMs) for specific business use cases.
API Integration: Utilize platforms such as AWS Bedrock or OpenAI APIs to implement and integrate LLM-powered solutions into existing systems and workflows.
Solution Development: Design and develop AI-driven applications that enhance decision-making, optimize operations, and improve customer experiences in the maritime industry.
Data Management: Collaborate with data engineers to preprocess and manage data sources used to enhance LLM performance while ensuring compliance with data privacy and security standards.
Performance Optimization: Monitor and optimize LLM deployments to ensure high performance, scalability, and reliability in production environments.
Innovation and Experimentation: Stay informed about the latest advancements in LLMs and generative AI, and identify opportunities to apply new tools and techniques.
Collaboration: Partner with product managers, software engineers, and stakeholders to understand business needs and deliver tailored AI-driven solutions.

Documentation and Communication: Maintain thorough documentation of workflows, configurations, and use cases. Effectively communicate findings and results to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in machine learning and artificial intelligence, with a focus on large language models (LLMs).
Hands-on experience working with LLMs, including fine-tuning, deployment, and evaluation.
Proficiency in using platforms and APIs such as AWS Bedrock, OpenAI, or similar generative AI services.
Familiarity with MLOps practices and tools for version control, model tracking, and deployment pipelines.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a track record of delivering AI-driven solutions in a production environment.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in an agile, multidisciplinary team.
Experience in the maritime or logistics industry.
Familiarity with reinforcement learning and advanced optimization techniques.
Knowledge of maritime-specific datasets and challenges, such as voyage optimization or fuel efficiency modeling.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

We are seeking a passionate and skilled Generative AI Analyst to help us harness the power of cutting-edge AI technologies to create solutions that will revolutionize the industry.

Position Summary As a Generative AI Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, building, and deploying AI driven solutions with a focus on generative AI models. This is a remote and freelance opportunity for people residing in Croatia.

You will work closely with cross-functional teams to create tools and systems that improve efficiency, enhance customer experiences, and drive business value.

This role demands a sense of ownership and a strong commitment to developing innovative solutions. You'll be instrumental in driving projects from conception to deployment, ensuring they deliver measurable value to the organization.

Key Responsibilities

  • Model Customization: Leverage Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques to customize large language models (LLMs) for specific business use cases.
  • API Integration: Utilize platforms such as AWS Bedrock or OpenAI APIs to implement and integrate LLM-powered solutions into existing systems and workflows.
  • Solution Development: Design and develop AI-driven applications that enhance decision-making, optimize operations, and improve customer experiences in the maritime industry.
  • Data Management: Collaborate with data engineers to preprocess and manage data sources used to enhance LLM performance while ensuring compliance with data privacy and security standards.
  • Performance Optimization: Monitor and optimize LLM deployments to ensure high performance, scalability, and reliability in production environments.
  • Innovation and Experimentation: Stay informed about the latest advancements in LLMs and generative AI, and identify opportunities to apply new tools and techniques.
  • Collaboration: Partner with product managers, software engineers, and stakeholders to understand business needs and deliver tailored AI-driven solutions.
  • Documentation and Communication: Maintain thorough documentation of workflows, configurations, and use cases. Effectively communicate findings and results to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Qualifications Required

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of experience in machine learning and artificial intelligence, with a focus on large language models (LLMs).
  • Hands-on experience working with LLMs, including fine-tuning, deployment, and evaluation.
  • Proficiency in using platforms and APIs such as AWS Bedrock, OpenAI, or similar generative AI services.
  • Familiarity with MLOps practices and tools for version control, model tracking, and deployment pipelines.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a track record of delivering AI-driven solutions in a production environment.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in an agile, multidisciplinary team.

Preferred

  • Experience in the maritime or logistics industry.
  • Familiarity with reinforcement learning and advanced optimization techniques.
  • Knowledge of maritime-specific datasets and challenges, such as voyage optimization or fuel efficiency modeling.
  • Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

4236082723,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-ai-internship-f-m-x-80%E2%80%93100%25-6%E2%80%9312-months-at-comparis-ch-ag-4236082723?position=56&pageNum=0&refId=TzNJypx31wjv8ugzn5AoVA%3D%3D&trackingId=Y3O%2F4h%2BblW2P0WCQxrPmng%3D%3D,"Machine Learning / AI Internship (f/m/x) 80–100%, 6–12 Months",comparis.ch AG,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","About Us

comparis.ch is the leading comparison platform in Switzerland. We have been comparing the prices and products of health insurers, other insurance companies, telecom providers and banks for over 25 years and offer the largest Swiss online marketplace for cars and property. Our comprehensive comparisons ensure transparency for our users and help them make the right decisions. With over 80 million visits each year, we rank among the most widely used websites in Switzerland. Four out of five people recognize us as THE independent comparison platform in Switzerland.

Are you curious about machine learning and AI, and want to see how it all works in a real company? We’re looking for an open-minded and motivated intern to join our data team for 6 to 12 months. This is your chance to dive into real projects, bring your own ideas to the table, and learn how AI is used to solve practical problems.
Help develop and improve machine learning models, especially in the area of Generative AI.
Work on a variety of use cases and support the implementation and optimization of ML algorithms.
Get involved in preparing training data: exploring, cleaning, and organizing data so it’s ready for our models.
Play a part in rolling out and shaping AI tools across the company.
Curiosity and a genuine interest in finding data-driven solutions.
Currently studying computer science, data science, or something similar.
Some experience with at least one programming language (like Python, Scala, or Java).
An interest in modern AI models (like large language models) is a plus.
In return, here is what you can expect from us

At Comparis, we believe that empowered employees deliver the best results. We cultivate a culture of transparency, mutual respect and trust. Firm believers in lifelong learning, we are always trying out new things and continuously developing – both as individuals and as a team. We also offer flat hierarchies, considerable autonomy and creative freedom, as well as a skilled and motivated team that will advise and support you in your work and make it easy for you to push your own boundaries. Finally, we offer flexible working hours and the freedom to work from almost anywhere you choose. Whether you're enjoying a workation in the Portuguese Algarve, collaborating from a café in Barcelona, or connecting from a mountain chalet in the Swiss Alps, our diverse team of talented professionals spans across Europe, creating an inclusive and dynamic work environment
Then don't hesitate and apply for our position today. If you have any questions, Daphne, our People Management Lead, will be happy to help. We look forward to receiving your application!
Note for recruiters: For this position, we only consider direct applications.

About Us

comparis.ch is the leading comparison platform in Switzerland. We have been comparing the prices and products of health insurers, other insurance companies, telecom providers and banks for over 25 years and offer the largest Swiss online marketplace for cars and property. Our comprehensive comparisons ensure transparency for our users and help them make the right decisions. With over 80 million visits each year, we rank among the most widely used websites in Switzerland. Four out of five people recognize us as THE independent comparison platform in Switzerland.

Are you curious about machine learning and AI, and want to see how it all works in a real company? We’re looking for an open-minded and motivated intern to join our data team for 6 to 12 months. This is your chance to dive into real projects, bring your own ideas to the table, and learn how AI is used to solve practical problems.

What You Will Do

  • Help develop and improve machine learning models, especially in the area of Generative AI.
  • Work on a variety of use cases and support the implementation and optimization of ML algorithms.
  • Get involved in preparing training data: exploring, cleaning, and organizing data so it’s ready for our models.
  • Play a part in rolling out and shaping AI tools across the company.

What We Expect From You

  • Curiosity and a genuine interest in finding data-driven solutions.
  • Currently studying computer science, data science, or something similar.
  • Some experience with at least one programming language (like Python, Scala, or Java).
  • An interest in modern AI models (like large language models) is a plus.
  • Fluent English skills.

In return, here is what you can expect from us

At Comparis, we believe that empowered employees deliver the best results. We cultivate a culture of transparency, mutual respect and trust. Firm believers in lifelong learning, we are always trying out new things and continuously developing – both as individuals and as a team. We also offer flat hierarchies, considerable autonomy and creative freedom, as well as a skilled and motivated team that will advise and support you in your work and make it easy for you to push your own boundaries. Finally, we offer flexible working hours and the freedom to work from almost anywhere you choose. Whether you're enjoying a workation in the Portuguese Algarve, collaborating from a café in Barcelona, or connecting from a mountain chalet in the Swiss Alps, our diverse team of talented professionals spans across Europe, creating an inclusive and dynamic work environment

Have we triggered your interest?

Then don't hesitate and apply for our position today. If you have any questions, Daphne, our People Management Lead, will be happy to help. We look forward to receiving your application!

Note for recruiters: For this position, we only consider direct applications.

Develop, optimize, and manage large-scale data pipelines using Cloudera tools (Impala, Hive, Spark, HDFS, Sqoop).
Work with large datasets to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data efficiently.
Perform data wrangling, cleansing, and performance tuning of queries.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and application teams to deliver robust data solutions.
Implement data governance, security, and best practices in data engineering processes.
Monitor and troubleshoot job performance and data quality issues.
Automate workflows and data pipelines using Unix shell scripting.
Develop complex SQL/PL-SQL queries for data extraction, reporting, and analysis.
Strong experience with Cloudera/Hadoop ecosystem: Impala, Hive, Spark, HDFS, Sqoop.
Proficiency in Unix/Linux and shell scripting.
Understanding of data architecture and data pipeline orchestration.
Experience working with structured and unstructured data at scale.
Familiarity with performance tuning and optimization in big data environments.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop, optimize, and manage large-scale data pipelines using Cloudera tools (Impala, Hive, Spark, HDFS, Sqoop).
  • Work with large datasets to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data efficiently.
  • Perform data wrangling, cleansing, and performance tuning of queries.
  • Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and application teams to deliver robust data solutions.
  • Implement data governance, security, and best practices in data engineering processes.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot job performance and data quality issues.
  • Automate workflows and data pipelines using Unix shell scripting.
  • Develop complex SQL/PL-SQL queries for data extraction, reporting, and analysis.


🔹 Required Skills:

  • Strong experience with Cloudera/Hadoop ecosystem: Impala, Hive, Spark, HDFS, Sqoop.
  • Proficiency in Unix/Linux and shell scripting.
  • Expertise in SQL and PL/SQL.
  • Understanding of data architecture and data pipeline orchestration.
  • Experience working with structured and unstructured data at scale.
  • Familiarity with performance tuning and optimization in big data environments.

Divbrands is a global, remote-working e-commerce company. We focus on data-driven decision-making to launch unique D2C apparel brands to specific audiences across the globe. Because of our intense research and targeting process, we only launch when we know a brand will succeed. With divbranders from different countries, we embody a company culture that is vibrant, diverse, playful, and performance-driven.

We research, develop, and build our own brands online. We specialize in creative production with regional creative hubs that make agile, data-backed creatives that convert sales. Each brand, product, and piece of creative content is ""glocalised"" for our various local, regional, and nationally diverse customers around the globe. We believe that online shopping behaviour never stays the same.

Consumers face a rapidly changing social, economic, and retail environment, demanding that brands become versatile, data-based, and driven by actual user behaviour. Divbrands has been doing this for over seven years - our mission is to achieve the most satisfying e-commerce experience for the modern shopper, wherever they might be.
We are looking for a Data Engineer to:
Collaborate on the design, development, and optimization of scalable data pipelines, data warehouses, and lakes, ensuring data quality, governance, and alignment with business needs.
Act as a technical reference for the team, offering expertise in data architecture, pipeline optimization, and scalability challenges, driving data quality best practices.

We are looking for people with experience working with orchestration and data ingestion tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, Prefect) and proficiency in data transformation using DBT. Additionally knowledge of distributed data processing frameworks like Apache Spark and experience with Databricks is a plus.

As a Data Engineer, you will help maintain the architecture, development, and optimization of scalable data pipelines, data warehouses, and data lakes that form the backbone of our analytics infrastructure. You'll act as a technical reference, solving complex data challenges and ensuring that our systems are both robust and scalable. You will play a critical role in maintaining the integrity and reliability of our datasets, enabling the business to make data-driven decisions confidently.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to translate business needs into actionable analytical datasets. You'll drive the adoption of cutting-edge tools and frameworks, improving efficiency and maintainability across the data engineering function.
Our big data processing and storage are powered by Google Cloud and Databricks
We manage data ingestion and orchestration with Apache Airflow, Airbyte and Fivetran.
Data transformation is handled through DBT
Our infrastructure is hosted on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
For this role we expect someone with at least 2 years of hands-on experience in data engineering or similar roles.
Advanced skills in Python and SQL, with the ability to write efficient queries and scripts for data manipulation.
Expertise with DBT for data transformation.
Experience with orchestration pipeline tools such as Apache Airflow, Prefect.
Familiarity with cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
Strong knowledge of database design principles and modern data architectures. Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and services like Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake, or ClickHouse.
Experience with Databricks and with distributed data processing frameworks such as Apache Spark, Dask, Flink, or similar is a plus
Experience with Docker and Terraform is a plus
Good communication skills to effectively interact with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Problem-solving ability, with a focus on finding innovative and scalable solutions.
Competitive salary with regular performance evaluations
Highly skilled colleagues to learn from
Training and development towards cloud certification (professional level)
Apply for the position here. We expect you to send a CV and GitHub link. We might ask for other materials during the process.
How long is the contract for? This is a full-time permanent contract with a trial period of 6 months.
What does the process look like?
Initially, you'll have a screening interview with our HR team, followed by an interview with the Head of Data.
Next, you'll complete a live test, which should take no more than 40 minutes. Finally, you will have a concluding interview with the CTO.
We expect the process to take 2-3 weeks. We try to keep it lean and straightforward.
Can I expect feedback if not considered?
Unfortunately, at least during the initial stages, we can't give feedback to everyone who applies.
Do you work with external recruiters or outsourcing agencies?
No. Please refrain from sending us an offer for your services.

About Us

Divbrands is a global, remote-working e-commerce company. We focus on data-driven decision-making to launch unique D2C apparel brands to specific audiences across the globe. Because of our intense research and targeting process, we only launch when we know a brand will succeed. With divbranders from different countries, we embody a company culture that is vibrant, diverse, playful, and performance-driven.

We research, develop, and build our own brands online. We specialize in creative production with regional creative hubs that make agile, data-backed creatives that convert sales. Each brand, product, and piece of creative content is ""glocalised"" for our various local, regional, and nationally diverse customers around the globe. We believe that online shopping behaviour never stays the same.

Consumers face a rapidly changing social, economic, and retail environment, demanding that brands become versatile, data-based, and driven by actual user behaviour. Divbrands has been doing this for over seven years - our mission is to achieve the most satisfying e-commerce experience for the modern shopper, wherever they might be.

In a nutshell:

We are looking for a Data Engineer to:

  • Collaborate on the design, development, and optimization of scalable data pipelines, data warehouses, and lakes, ensuring data quality, governance, and alignment with business needs.
  • Act as a technical reference for the team, offering expertise in data architecture, pipeline optimization, and scalability challenges, driving data quality best practices.
  • We are looking for people with experience working with orchestration and data ingestion tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, Prefect) and proficiency in data transformation using DBT. Additionally knowledge of distributed data processing frameworks like Apache Spark and experience with Databricks is a plus.


What will you do?

As a Data Engineer, you will help maintain the architecture, development, and optimization of scalable data pipelines, data warehouses, and data lakes that form the backbone of our analytics infrastructure. You'll act as a technical reference, solving complex data challenges and ensuring that our systems are both robust and scalable. You will play a critical role in maintaining the integrity and reliability of our datasets, enabling the business to make data-driven decisions confidently.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to translate business needs into actionable analytical datasets. You'll drive the adoption of cutting-edge tools and frameworks, improving efficiency and maintainability across the data engineering function.

What's the stack?

  • Programming languages: Python and SQL
  • Our big data processing and storage are powered by Google Cloud and Databricks
  • We manage data ingestion and orchestration with Apache Airflow, Airbyte and Fivetran.
  • Data transformation is handled through DBT
  • Our infrastructure is hosted on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).


Desired Skills and qualifications:

For this role we expect someone with at least 2 years of hands-on experience in data engineering or similar roles.

Technical Skills:

  • Advanced skills in Python and SQL, with the ability to write efficient queries and scripts for data manipulation.
  • Expertise with DBT for data transformation.
  • Experience with orchestration pipeline tools such as Apache Airflow, Prefect.
  • Familiarity with cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
  • Strong knowledge of database design principles and modern data architectures. Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and services like Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake, or ClickHouse.
  • Experience with Databricks and with distributed data processing frameworks such as Apache Spark, Dask, Flink, or similar is a plus
  • Experience with Docker and Terraform is a plus


Soft Skills:

  • Good communication skills to effectively interact with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Problem-solving ability, with a focus on finding innovative and scalable solutions.


What's in it for me?

  • Fully remote
  • Competitive salary with regular performance evaluations
  • High-growth e-commerce career &

4239597263,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-junior-80%25-100%25-at-it-advanced-consulting-sa-4239597263?position=4&pageNum=2&refId=ILBFkecQy%2FRxtrgGk2wGmw%3D%3D&trackingId=0jYJ9LNuHV0PxntigwDUYQ%3D%3D,Business Analyst Junior (80% - 100%),IT Advanced Consulting SA,"Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland","Afin de renforcer l'équipe Dynamic 365 CRM de notre client, et également des outils web collaboratifs, nous recherchons un/e Business Analyst Junior, dont la mission principale sera d’accompagner les équipes métiers et techniques dans l’analyse, la formalisation et l’optimisation des processus et des besoins fonctionnels.
Il/elle joue un rôle clé dans la réussite des projets en assurant la liaison entre les utilisateurs finaux et les équipes techniques.
Renforcement de l’équipe de Business Analyst dans le cadre de projets prioritaire dans la stratégie de transformation digitale de l’entreprise.
Recueillir, analyser et formaliser les besoins métiers.
Participer à la rédaction des cahiers des charges fonctionnels.
Contribuer à la modélisation des processus métiers (BPMN, UML…).
Collaborer avec les équipes de développement pour assurer la bonne compréhension des besoins.
Participer aux phases de tests (rédaction de cas de tests, exécution, suivi des anomalies).
Accompagner les utilisateurs lors de la phase de recette et de déploiement.
Assurer une veille fonctionnelle et technologique sur les outils et méthodes d’analyse.
Connaissance des méthodes d’analyse fonctionnelle (UML, BPMN…).
Maîtrise des outils bureautiques (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
Connaissance des outils de gestion de projet (JIRA, Confluence, Trello…).
Notions en SQL ou outils de BI (un plus).
Bac +3 à Bac +5 en informatique, gestion, systèmes d’information ou école de commerce.
Une première expérience (stage ou alternance) en tant que BA ou dans un rôle similaire est un plus.

Afin de renforcer l'équipe Dynamic 365 CRM de notre client, et également des outils web collaboratifs, nous recherchons un/e Business Analyst Junior, dont la mission principale sera d’accompagner les équipes métiers et techniques dans l’analyse, la formalisation et l’optimisation des processus et des besoins fonctionnels.

Il/elle joue un rôle clé dans la réussite des projets en assurant la liaison entre les utilisateurs finaux et les équipes techniques.

Objectif de la mission :

Renforcement de l’équipe de Business Analyst dans le cadre de projets prioritaire dans la stratégie de transformation digitale de l’entreprise.

Responsabilités

  • Recueillir, analyser et formaliser les besoins métiers.
  • Participer à la rédaction des cahiers des charges fonctionnels.
  • Contribuer à la modélisation des processus métiers (BPMN, UML…).
  • Collaborer avec les équipes de développement pour assurer la bonne compréhension des besoins.
  • Participer aux phases de tests (rédaction de cas de tests, exécution, suivi des anomalies).
  • Accompagner les utilisateurs lors de la phase de recette et de déploiement.
  • Assurer une veille fonctionnelle et technologique sur les outils et méthodes d’analyse.

Requirements

  • Connaissance des méthodes d’analyse fonctionnelle (UML, BPMN…).
  • Maîtrise des outils bureautiques (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
  • Connaissance des outils de gestion de projet (JIRA, Confluence, Trello…).
  • Notions en SQL ou outils de BI (un plus).

Educations et Certifications

  • Bac +3 à Bac +5 en informatique, gestion, systèmes d’information ou école de commerce.
  • Une première expérience (stage ou alternance) en tant que BA ou dans un rôle similaire est un plus.

4235447029,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/cat-data-and-tools-analyst-6-month-contract-at-partnerre-4235447029?position=5&pageNum=2&refId=ILBFkecQy%2FRxtrgGk2wGmw%3D%3D&trackingId=T5vQ5%2FbCGSg2CBLPOoU4rA%3D%3D,Cat Data and Tools Analyst (6 month contract),PartnerRe,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","PartnerRe is a leading, privately owned, multi-line global reinsurer with a reputation of financial stability and strength, and a commitment to rebuilding businesses and communities after risk events around the world.

Our mission is to continue to be a financially stable and predictable business partner, supporting our clients with solutions tailored to their needs, delivering superior returns to our owner, providing rewarding opportunities for our people and making a positive contribution to society. To achieve this, we live by our values of Integrity, Performance, Collaboration, Straightforward Communication and Respect and Care.

Core to The PartnerRe Experience is our global nature. No matter where you sit in the company, you are part of something bigger. Our teams represent our truly international mindset, forging connections across office locations and all levels of the organization and building a network of mutual success. The result is a day-to-day experience that will allow you to:
Connect with a community of experts
View Home - PartnerRe Experience e-book to find out more about what it’s like to work at PartnerRe.
We are always looking for bright, proactive individuals to join our team!
Please follow our Careers page for all updates on new positions. We look forward to receiving your application.
PartnerRe is an equal opportunities employer.
Please join our company LinkedIn Page for all updates on new positions that are coming live.

The position is within the Cat Tools and Technology team, which is part of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office responsible for research, modeling, pricing, and portfolio analytics of natural catastrophes (Cat).
The Tools and Technology team is leading the developments of all the Cat applications in collaboration with IT to drive innovation and efficiency in managing risk of natural catastrophes.
This temporary role supports the Cat Tools and Technology team in ongoing projects focusing on improving the reporting and analytics capabilities of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office unit.
In more detail your main tasks are to:
Enhance our existing reporting dashboard to improve efficiency and accuracy in assessing data quality and drivers of portfolio changes.
Replace existing Excel reports and integrate them into R Shiny dashboard.
Automate the production of existing reports through R Markdown.
The role will be based in Zurich.
You are passionate to apply your strong quantitative skills to the development of tools supporting the automation of processes and delivering business solutions.
The ideal candidate would have the following qualifications and personal qualities:
Master degree in computer science, data science, natural sciences (Climatology, Hydrology, Seismology, or similar), or a related quantitative field
Strong programming skills in R or Python and knowledge in databases (e.g., SQL or Snowflake)
Knowledge of R Shiny and R Markdown is a plus
Interest in data manipulation and data visualization
Pro-active, solution oriented with a high level of self initiative
Ability to work well in a team and to contribute towards common goals

PartnerRe provides a working environment in which diversity is valued, where all employees feel welcome, respected, and empowered to perform at their best. We invite you to learn more about D&I at PartnerRe.

PartnerRe is a leading, privately owned, multi-line global reinsurer with a reputation of financial stability and strength, and a commitment to rebuilding businesses and communities after risk events around the world.

Our mission is to continue to be a financially stable and predictable business partner, supporting our clients with solutions tailored to their needs, delivering superior returns to our owner, providing rewarding opportunities for our people and making a positive contribution to society. To achieve this, we live by our values of Integrity, Performance, Collaboration, Straightforward Communication and Respect and Care.

Core to The PartnerRe Experience is our global nature. No matter where you sit in the company, you are part of something bigger. Our teams represent our truly international mindset, forging connections across office locations and all levels of the organization and building a network of mutual success. The result is a day-to-day experience that will allow you to:

Shape your own career

Grow in a supportive environment

Connect with a community of experts

Make an impact

View Home - PartnerRe Experience e-book to find out more about what it’s like to work at PartnerRe.

We are always looking for bright, proactive individuals to join our team!

Please follow our Careers page for all updates on new positions. We look forward to receiving your application.

PartnerRe is an equal opportunities employer.

Please join our company LinkedIn Page for all updates on new positions that are coming live.



Job Description

About this job:

The position is within the Cat Tools and Technology team, which is part of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office responsible for research, modeling, pricing, and portfolio analytics of natural catastrophes (Cat).

The Tools and Technology team is leading the developments of all the Cat applications in collaboration with IT to drive innovation and efficiency in managing risk of natural catastrophes.



About the role:

This temporary role supports the Cat Tools and Technology team in ongoing projects focusing on improving the reporting and analytics capabilities of the Catastrophe Underwriting Office unit.

In more detail your main tasks are to:

  • Enhance our existing reporting dashboard to improve efficiency and accuracy in assessing data quality and drivers of portfolio changes.
  • Replace existing Excel reports and integrate them into R Shiny dashboard.
  • Automate the production of existing reports through R Markdown.

The role will be based in Zurich.



Qualifications

About you:

You are passionate to apply your strong quantitative skills to the development of tools supporting the automation of processes and delivering business solutions.

The ideal candidate would have the following qualifications and personal qualities:

  • Master degree in computer science, data science, natural sciences (Climatology, Hydrology, Seismology, or similar), or a related quantitative field
  • Strong programming skills in R or Python and knowledge in databases (e.g., SQL or Snowflake)
  • Knowledge of R Shiny and R Markdown is a plus
  • Interest in data manipulation and data visualization
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Pro-active, solution oriented with a high level of self initiative
  • Ability to work well in a team and to contribute towards common goals
  • Proficient (written and verbal) in English

Additional Information





PartnerRe provides a working environment in which diversity is valued, where all employees feel welcome, respected, and empowered to perform at their best. We invite you to learn more about D&

4235393271,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/it-systems-support-engineer-at-avaloq-4235393271?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=ILBFkecQy%2FRxtrgGk2wGmw%3D%3D&trackingId=326wpCL8t5K%2FYwqV3L9LCQ%3D%3D,IT Systems Support Engineer,Avaloq,"Bioggio, Ticino, Switzerland","Company Description

Founded and headquartered in Switzerland, Avaloq is continuously expanding its global footprint with around 2,500 colleagues in 12 countries, and more than 170 clients in 35 countries. We are an industry-leading provider of wealth management technology and services for financial institutions around the world, including private banks and wealth managers, investment managers, as well as retail and neo banks. Our research led approach and continual innovation is powered by the passion and creativity of our colleagues.

We are always looking for talented people to join us on our mission to orchestrate the financial ecosystem and democratize access to wealth management. Avaloq offers the opportunity to work closely with some of the world’s leading financial institutions as we jointly develop and shape careers. Championing a collaborative, supportive and flexible work environment empowers our colleagues to reach their full potential.
We are seeking a skilled IT Systems Support Engineer with expertise in Java applications deployed on Kubernetes.
In this role, you will be responsible for maintaining, troubleshooting, and optimizing application environments to ensure reliability, scalability, and performance.
Familiarity with the Avaloq ecosystem is highly desirable and will be considered a strong asset.
Monitor, maintain, and support Java-based applications running on Kubernetes clusters
Troubleshoot and resolve application performance issues, ensuring minimal downtime
Collaborate with project managers and developers to implement best practices for deployment and system management
Enhance system scalability, resilience, and performance through proactive measures
Manage system alerts and incidents, providing timely resolutions and detailed reports
Work closely with clients and stakeholders to ensure application requirements are met
Provide technical support and guidance to internal teams
3+ years of experience in IT systems support or a similar role
Proficiency in Java application support and troubleshooting
Hands-on experience with Kubernetes and related tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana)
Strong understanding of containerization and CI/CD pipelines
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, Azure, OCI) and hybrid cloud environments
Proficient with Linux systems and shell scripting
It would be a real bonus if you have
Experience working in or supporting the Avaloq ecosystem (ACP, Community API, FixBridge)
Knowledge of financial systems or FinTech environments

We realize that managing work life balance is a challenge we all face in our daily lives and in order to support with this we are pleased to offer hybrid and flexible working for most of our Avaloqers to maintain work life balance and still continue our fantastic Avaloq culture in our global offices.

In Avaloq we are proud to embrace diversity and understand the success of our business is built on the power of different opinions, we are whole heartedly committed to fostering an equal opportunity environment and inclusive culture where you can be your true authentic self.

We hire, compensate and promote regardless of origin, age, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other fantastic traits that make us all unique, we have done our best to write this advert in an inclusive and neutral way.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations.

Company Description

Founded and headquartered in Switzerland, Avaloq is continuously expanding its global footprint with around 2,500 colleagues in 12 countries, and more than 170 clients in 35 countries. We are an industry-leading provider of wealth management technology and services for financial institutions around the world, including private banks and wealth managers, investment managers, as well as retail and neo banks. Our research led approach and continual innovation is powered by the passion and creativity of our colleagues.

We are always looking for talented people to join us on our mission to orchestrate the financial ecosystem and democratize access to wealth management. Avaloq offers the opportunity to work closely with some of the world’s leading financial institutions as we jointly develop and shape careers. Championing a collaborative, supportive and flexible work environment empowers our colleagues to reach their full potential.

Job Description

We are seeking a skilled IT Systems Support Engineer with expertise in Java applications deployed on Kubernetes.

In this role, you will be responsible for maintaining, troubleshooting, and optimizing application environments to ensure reliability, scalability, and performance.

Familiarity with the Avaloq ecosystem is highly desirable and will be considered a strong asset.

Your key tasks

  • Monitor, maintain, and support Java-based applications running on Kubernetes clusters
  • Troubleshoot and resolve application performance issues, ensuring minimal downtime
  • Collaborate with project managers and developers to implement best practices for deployment and system management
  • Enhance system scalability, resilience, and performance through proactive measures
  • Manage system alerts and incidents, providing timely resolutions and detailed reports
  • Work closely with clients and stakeholders to ensure application requirements are met
  • Provide technical support and guidance to internal teams

Qualifications

  • 3+ years of experience in IT systems support or a similar role
  • Proficiency in Java application support and troubleshooting
  • Hands-on experience with Kubernetes and related tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana)
  • Strong understanding of containerization and CI/CD pipelines
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, Azure, OCI) and hybrid cloud environments
  • Proficient with Linux systems and shell scripting
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Strong communication and collaboration abilities

It would be a real bonus if you have

  • Experience working in or supporting the Avaloq ecosystem (ACP, Community API, FixBridge)
  • Knowledge of financial systems or FinTech environments
  • Certification in Kubernetes (CKA or CKAD)

Additional Information

We realize that managing work life balance is a challenge we all face in our daily lives and in order to support with this we are pleased to offer hybrid and flexible working for most of our Avaloqers to maintain work life balance and still continue our fantastic Avaloq culture in our global offices.

In Avaloq we are proud to embrace diversity and understand the success of our business is built on the power of different opinions, we are whole heartedly committed to fostering an equal opportunity environment and inclusive culture where you can be your true authentic self.

We hire, compensate and promote regardless of origin, age, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other fantastic traits that make us all unique, we have done our best to write this advert in an inclusive and neutral way.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations.

Datum: 22.05.2025
Standort: Zug, CH
Erfahrungslevel: Berufserfahrene
Anstellungsart: Unbefristet ― Vollzeit

WWZ – die innovative Anbieterin von Energiedienstleistungen und Versorgungsinfrastruktur – arbeitet daran, eine CO2-freie, digitale Energiewelt aufzubauen. Die Leistungen und Services für unsere Kundinnen und Kunden sind nicht nur nützlich, sondern auch nachhaltig. Wir denken weiter und setzen uns aktiv für heute und morgen ein. Du willst mit uns die nachhaltige Zukunft gestalten und dich für Zug und die ganze Region engagieren? Dann bewirb dich jetzt.

Das sind deine Aufgaben:

  • Als Teammitglied im Core Team Data Management erarbeitest du Lösungen im Bereich Data Engineering und Reporting
  • Du wirkst mit bei der Weiterentwicklung unserer Datenplattform
  • Du bringst die Bereitschaft mit, in Operations und Support mitzuwirken
  • Du stellst den täglichen reibungslosen Betrieb zusammen mit unseren externen Dienstleistern sicher
  • Als Teilprojektleiter/in verantwortest du die Entwicklung neuer Datenprodukte

Das bringst du mit:

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik / Data Science / Informatik oder äquivalente Ausbildung mit Erfahrung im Bereich Data Engineering
  • Mindestens 2 bis 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung
  • Gute SQL-Kenntnisse
  • Projekterfahrungen mit einem ETL-Tool
  • Starke Kommunikation gegenüber den verschiedenen Anwendergruppen (internen Kunden)
  • Vernetztes und analytisches Denken
  • Erfahrungen im agilen Entwicklungsvorgehen ist von Vorteil
  • Erfahrungen mit Power BI oder ähnliches ist von Vorteil
  • Deutsch mindestens Niveau B2 und gute Englischkenntnisse erwünscht

Das bieten wir:

  • Ein vielseitiges und verantwortungsvolles Aufgabengebiet in einem zukunftsorientierten Unternehmen
  • Ein vertrauensvolles Arbeitsklima mit modernen Arbeitsplätzen und zeitgemässer Infrastruktur
  • Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und die Möglichkeit von Home-Office
  • Die persönliche und fachliche Weiterentwicklung liegt uns am Herzen
  • Eine strukturierte Einführung in deine neuen Aufgaben und dein Arbeitsumfeld
  • Ein offenes Ohr für deine Ideen und die Chance, diese in Taten umzusetzen

Kontakt

Gemeinsam bewegen wir die Zukunft – bist du mit dabei? Bewirb dich bei WWZ! Wir freuen uns, dich kennenzulernen.

Deine HR-Anspechperson für diese Stelle:

Stéphanie Paulitsch, HR Business Partner
